original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: bo dhi satva ts'a rya aa ba t'a ra sang k'a ra /
analyzed: bo dhi satva ts'a rya aa ba t'a ra sang k'a ra /
translated: Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra-saṅkāra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba /
translated: The composition of the Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra

original: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi mnga' bdag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsung gi mnga' bdag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Lord of Speech, the youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: ngo bo nyid ni byang chub pa'i //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byang chub pa'i //
translated: The essence is enlightenment,

original: rgya mtsho de la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: rgya mtsho de la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to that ocean [of qualities],

original: bdag 'dra'i spyod pa'i yan lag la //
analyzed: bdag 'dra'i spyod pa'i yan lag la //
translated: For the sake of engaging in the branches of conduct like mine,

original: 'jug phyir legs sbyar bshad tsam bya //
analyzed: 'jug phyir legs sbyar bshad tsam bya //
translated: I shall explain just a little of the composition.

original: dam pa rnams kyis ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba mngon par 'phel bar bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba mngon par 'phel bar bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since the holy ones increase the virtue of the beginning, middle, and end,

original: bde gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bde gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: [The text] begins with Sugata and so forth.

original: 'dir phyag 'tshal ba ni dang por dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyag 'tshal ba ni dang por dge ba'o //
translated: Here, the homage is virtuous in the beginning.

original: chos bstan pa ni bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa ni bar du dge ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is virtuous in the middle.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'phel ba yin pas tha mar dge ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'phel ba yin pas tha mar dge ba yin no //
translated: The dedication of the roots of virtue is the increase of the roots of virtue, and so is the virtue at the end.

original: de la bde bar gshegs pa ni rtogs par bya ba'i lhag ma mi mnga' bas na yongs su rdzogs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde bar gshegs pa ni rtogs par bya ba'i lhag ma mi mnga' bas na yongs su rdzogs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: Here, the Well-Gone is the Well-Gone because of the complete understanding of the absence of any remainder of what is to be known.

original: chos kyi sku mnga' ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dam pa'i chos kyi tshogs ni chos kyi sku ste de dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku mnga' ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi dam pa'i chos kyi tshogs ni chos kyi sku ste de dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The One with the Dharma Body is the One with the Dharma Body because of the collection of the excellent Dharma, which is the nature of the scriptures and realizations.

original: sras bcas ni nyid las 'khrungs pa'i sras te /
analyzed: sras bcas ni nyid las 'khrungs pa'i sras te /
translated: The One with the Sons is the One with the Sons because of the sons born from oneself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The One with the Bodhisattvas is the One with the Bodhisattvas because of the Bodhisattvas.

original: @2a * // la la las ni bde gshegs dam pa'i chos dang dge 'dun bcas zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @2a * // la la las ni bde gshegs dam pa'i chos dang dge 'dun bcas zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say, “The Well-Gone, together with the excellent Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: btsun pa ni nyan thos chen po brgyad la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: btsun pa ni nyan thos chen po brgyad la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: ” The Noble Ones are the eight great śrāvakas and so forth.

original: de dag ma lus pa kun la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ma lus pa kun la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: All of them without exception are the ones to whom homage is paid.

original: dkon mchog gsum po gtso bor gyur pas so sor smos pa yin la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po gtso bor gyur pas so sor smos pa yin la /
translated: The Three Jewels are mentioned separately because they are the most important.

original: da dag kyang phyag bya bar 'os pa yin pas gus pas phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: da dag kyang phyag bya bar 'os pa yin pas gus pas phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Since they are also worthy of homage, he pays homage with respect.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says,

original: 'dir yon tan dam pa'i bstod pa rgya che ba dang / mchod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i mos pa'i bsam pa shin tu phul du byung ba'i dga' ba rgya che ba'i mchod pa dang bcas pas lus zhing thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyis btud cing phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'dir yon tan dam pa'i bstod pa rgya che ba dang / mchod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa las byung ba'i mos pa'i bsam pa shin tu phul du byung ba'i dga' ba rgya che ba'i mchod pa dang bcas pas lus zhing thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyis btud cing phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Here, with a vast praise of sublime qualities, and with a vast offering of delight that arises from keeping in mind the object of worship that is exalted, he bows down and pays homage with bodies as numerous as the particles of all the buddha-fields.

original: de ltar phyag btsal nas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar phyag btsal nas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: Having paid homage in this way, what will he do?

original: bde gshegs sras kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde gshegs sras kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, I will praise the Sugata's sons, etc.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bdag nyid ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bdag nyid ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The Sugata's nature is the Dharma Body.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa las skyes pas chen po thob pa dang / rgyal gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa las skyes pas chen po thob pa dang / rgyal gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Since they are born from it, they are the great sons, and the heirs of the Victor.

original: de rnams kyi sdom pa ni mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sdom pa ni mi dge ba spong ba dang / dge ba la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'o //
translated: The vow of those is to abandon the non-virtuous, to engage in the virtuous, and to work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can du gsungs la /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can du gsungs la /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has taught that it is of the nature of being extremely profound and vast.

original: der byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon la sogs pa'i don rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa des 'jug pa'i bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: der byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon la sogs pa'i don rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa des 'jug pa'i bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: There, the benefits of generating the mind of enlightenment and so on, which are the ten topics, should be taught in the introduction to the vow of the Sugata's sons.

original: de yang lung bzhin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang lung bzhin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be according to the scriptures.

original: lung gi don dang mi 'gal bar ro //
analyzed: lung gi don dang mi 'gal bar ro //
translated: It should not contradict the meaning of the scriptures.

original: lung las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rgya cher gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: lung las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rgya cher gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the Blessed One has taught it extensively in the scriptures,

original: mdor bsdus nas ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said to be in brief.

original: de lta yin du chug na /
analyzed: de lta yin du chug na /
translated: Even if that is the case,

original: ci 'dir sngon chad ma byung ba gzhan 'ga' zhig smas sam /
analyzed: ci 'dir sngon chad ma byung ba gzhan 'ga' zhig smas sam /
translated: is something else being said here that has not occurred before?

original: lung ji lta ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: lung ji lta ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it according to the scriptures?

original: sngon chad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sngon chad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said before and so on.

original: sdeb sbyor mkhas pas sngon ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sdeb sbyor mkhas pas sngon ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it a composition of verses?

original: sdeb sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdeb sbyor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, The so-called composition...

original: gang gi phyir 'dir sdeb sbyor la mkhas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi don du bdag gis 'di gzhung du nye bar sbyar ba ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir sdeb sbyor la mkhas pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi don du bdag gis 'di gzhung du nye bar sbyar ba ma byas so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that since there is no skill in composition here, I have not applied this as a text for the benefit of others.

original: de ltar gal te gzhan gyi don du ma byas na ci'i phyir byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te gzhan gyi don du ma byas na ci'i phyir byed ce na /
translated: If it is not done for the benefit of others, why is it done?

original: @2b de'i phyir rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @2b de'i phyir rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says for my own mind...

original: yid la 'dir byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: yid la 'dir byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: Here, the mind is the thought of enlightenment.

original: de bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of cultivating that, means for the sake of training in it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lung las tshig gi don rgya cher gsungs pa de las mdor bsdus te rang gi yid la bsgom par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis 'di byas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lung las tshig gi don rgya cher gsungs pa de las mdor bsdus te rang gi yid la bsgom par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis 'di byas so zhes pa'o //
translated: From the extensive explanation of the meaning of the words in the scriptures of the Bhagavat, I have made this in brief for the sake of cultivating it in my own mind.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na dge ba bsgom phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na dge ba bsgom phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And how is that? He says for the sake of cultivating virtue... and so on.

original: yid la dge ba bsgom par bya ba ni bdag gis dad pa'i shugs shin tu dag pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byas pa'o //
analyzed: yid la dge ba bsgom par bya ba ni bdag gis dad pa'i shugs shin tu dag pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byas pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of virtuous mental states is done in order to increase one's own faith and purity.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan gyi don la yang ltos pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan gyi don la yang ltos pa ste /
translated: The word just indicates that one should also consider the welfare of others.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi don du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi don du 'gyur te /
translated: This is for the welfare of others,

original: rgyud shin tu dag pa'i yid dang ldan pa rnams kyi goms pa phul du byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud shin tu dag pa'i yid dang ldan pa rnams kyi goms pa phul du byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because those who have a very pure mental continuum will develop an excellent practice.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi don du yang 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi don du yang 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, since it is also for the welfare of others, he says for the sake of myself and others like me.🔽Since there are others who are equal to me in spiritual lineage, it is also for their sake.

original: bdag dang skal pa mnyam zhing rigs mtshungs pa gang yin pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas de'i don du yang 'gyur ba mthong bas bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa brtsams pa 'di ni don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang skal pa mnyam zhing rigs mtshungs pa gang yin pa gzhan dag kyang yod pas de'i don du yang 'gyur ba mthong bas bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa brtsams pa 'di ni don yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is seen to be meaningful, this composition of the Bodhisattva vow is meaningful.

original: sdeb sbyor byed pa'i don ni kho bo mi 'dri'i /
analyzed: sdeb sbyor byed pa'i don ni kho bo mi 'dri'i /
translated: I do not ask about the meaning of the composition,

original: brjod par bya ba 'dri ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba 'dri ste /
translated: but about the meaning of what is to be expressed.

original: brjod par bya ba ni 'jug pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni 'jug pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The subject matter is for the sake of engagement.

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gzhung rtsom pa la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa dag brjod par bya ba'i gtam la brten pa nyid kyis na gtam yang bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa yin pas de ltar na bdag dang gzhan gyi gtam gyi dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhung rtsom pa la ni rtog pa dang ldan pa dag brjod par bya ba'i gtam la brten pa nyid kyis na gtam yang bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa yin pas de ltar na bdag dang gzhan gyi gtam gyi dgos pa yin la /
translated: in composing a treatise, those who are intelligent, by relying on the subject matter of the text, easily engage in the Bodhisattva vow of the Sugata's sons. Thus, it is the purpose of the text for oneself and others.

original: de gnyis thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i tshul du 'byung ba nyid ni 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i tshul du 'byung ba nyid ni 'brel ba yin no //
translated: The occurrence of those two in the manner of means and that which arises from the means is the connection.

original: de bas na bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa ni brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa ni brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the engagement in the Bodhisattva vow of the Sugata's sons is the subject matter.

original: glegs bam la la la tshig 'di med de /
analyzed: glegs bam la la la tshig 'di med de /
translated: In some texts, these words are not found.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: It is indeed the Compendium of Trainings itself.

original: der rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: der rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is unreasonable.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa ma yin la /🔽'dir ni bdag gis byang chub spyod pa la //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyi sdom pa la 'jug pa ma yin la / 'dir ni bdag gis byang chub spyod pa la //
translated: because it is the Compendium of Trainings itself, it is not an introduction to the vows of the Sugata's sons.🔽Here, it is reasonable to say,

original: 'jug pa rnam par bsams @3a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnam par bsams @3a * //
translated: I will think about engaging in the conduct of enlightenment.

original: pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po gcig yin pa'i phyir rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po gcig yin pa'i phyir rigs pa yin te /
translated: And it is reasonable because there is one agent.

original: gzhan du na nyan pa po'i 'jug pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i 'brel pa la sogs pa ma smras par 'gyur bas 'di ni 'dir rigs la /
analyzed: gzhan du na nyan pa po'i 'jug pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i 'brel pa la sogs pa ma smras par 'gyur bas 'di ni 'dir rigs la /
translated: Otherwise, one would not mention the connection, etc., which would be a factor of engagement for the listener.🔽The verse beginning,🔽The Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas...

original: sangs rgyas dang ni byang chub sems dpa' dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni der smos pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ni byang chub sems dpa' dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni der smos pa'i rigs so //
translated: is appropriate there.

original: ci tshe 'di nyid du dge ba la 'bad par ci ltar nus she na /
analyzed: ci tshe 'di nyid du dge ba la 'bad par ci ltar nus she na /
translated: How is it possible to strive for virtue in this very lifetime?🔽Therefore, it says,

original: de'i phyir dal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dal 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This leisure and opportunity...

original: dal ba zhes bya ba ni mi khom pa las log pa ste /
analyzed: dal ba zhes bya ba ni mi khom pa las log pa ste /
translated: Leisure is the opposite of unfavorable conditions.

original: 'dir ni sdom pa 'chags pa la dal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sdom pa 'chags pa la dal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the opportunity is called the leisure.

original: de'i 'byor ba ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'byor ba ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The endowment is the perfection.

original: 'di ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: This is very difficult to obtain.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin la /
translated: And that is taught by the Lord in the liberation called the source of the victors' heat, etc.

original: de ni kho bo cag rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that is obtained by us.

original: skyes bu'i don sgrub ni sems can gyi don byed par nus shing skal ba yod de /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don sgrub ni sems can gyi don byed par nus shing skal ba yod de /
translated: The ability to accomplish the aims of beings is the ability and opportunity to work for the benefit of beings.

original: de thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: That is obtained.

original: gal te dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa'i dus 'dir phan pa zhes bya ba bdag dang gzhan la yun ring du phan zhing bde bar 'gyur ba rnam par ma bsams na'o //
analyzed: gal te dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa'i dus 'dir phan pa zhes bya ba bdag dang gzhan la yun ring du phan zhing bde bar 'gyur ba rnam par ma bsams na'o //
translated: If, at this time of perfect endowment of leisure and opportunity, one does not reflect on what is called benefit, which is the long term benefit and happiness of oneself and others,

original: phyis 'di yang dag 'byor par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis 'di yang dag 'byor par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how will this perfect endowment occur again?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: shin tu rnyed par dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed par dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is very difficult to obtain.

original: phan pa de yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon dang / de bzhin du sdig pa bshags par gtogs pa bdun dang / byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blang ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la bag yod par bya ba dang /
analyzed: phan pa de yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon dang / de bzhin du sdig pa bshags par gtogs pa bdun dang / byang chub kyi sems yang dag par blang ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la bag yod par bya ba dang /
translated: and likewise the seven that belong to the confession of misdeeds, the taking of the mind of awakening, the conscientious attitude toward the mind of awakening,

original: shes bzhin la sogs pa bsrung ba dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin la sogs pa bsrung ba dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: the protection of vigilance, and so forth, patience, effort, concentration, wisdom, and the dedication.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bcu la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bcu la bya'o //
translated: The mind of awakening is to be understood as having ten aspects.

original: de la byang chub kyi phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, in terms of the benefits of the mind of awakening,

original: ji ltar mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Just as at night . . .” and so forth.

original: ji ltar mtshan mo sprin stug po mang pos khebs pas mun pa shin tu gnag pa na sprin dang mun nag gi thibs po gang yin pa der glog 'gyu skad cig ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo sprin stug po mang pos khebs pas mun pa shin tu gnag pa na sprin dang mun nag gi thibs po gang yin pa der glog 'gyu skad cig ste /
translated: Just as at night when it is covered by many thick clouds and very dark, in the darkness of the thick clouds and darkness, lightning flashes for an instant,

original: dus shin tu yun thung bas rab tu snang ba @3b ston te gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du shin tu yun ring ba'i 'khor ba'i btson ra mun rum du sdig pa'i stobs can gyi sprin mang pos mun nag tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten sdug bsngal gyi mun
analyzed: dus shin tu yun thung bas rab tu snang ba @3b ston te gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du shin tu yun ring ba'i 'khor ba'i btson ra mun rum du sdig pa'i stobs can gyi sprin mang pos mun nag tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten sdug bsngal gyi mun
translated: Just as a flash of lightning illuminates a dark night, so too, the Buddha, by the power of his merit, illuminates the world, which is like a dark night,🔽with the lightning of his appearance.🔽The world is a prison of cyclic existence, which is a very long time. It is a darkness because it is obscured by the thick clouds of nonvirtue.

original: gnag 'ba' zhig yod pa'o //
analyzed: gnag 'ba' zhig yod pa'o //
translated: It is a darkness of suffering because it is filled with only suffering.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas glog lta bu'i dbang gis bsod nams la blo gros te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas glog lta bu'i dbang gis bsod nams la blo gros te /
translated: By the power of the Buddha means that by the power of the Buddha, who is like lightning, the light of the mind of merit

original: blo'i khyad par gyi snang ba thang 'ga' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: blo'i khyad par gyi snang ba thang 'ga' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: appears for a while.

original: de ni shin tu rnyed dka' ba yin pas na lan 'ga' zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni shin tu rnyed dka' ba yin pas na lan 'ga' zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: Since that is very difficult to obtain, it is said to occur only once.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa des na des ltas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa des na des ltas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Since that is so, therefore it says, “By that, the world is like one who is asleep and dreaming.”

original: 'dir dge ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i tshul gyi dge ba'i sa bon lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i grogs dang bcas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i tshul gyi dge ba'i sa bon lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i grogs dang bcas pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, virtue is the seed of virtue, which is the cause designated as the effect, together with the cooperative causes.

original: de nyid ni nyam chung zhing stobs zhan pa nyid du rgyun gyis rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni nyam chung zhing stobs zhan pa nyid du rgyun gyis rtag pa yin no //
translated: That is weak and feeble by nature.

original: sdig pa'i sa bon ni stobs chen po dang ldan pa yin te /🔽lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i grogs dang bcas par che ba yin pas shin tu zhes bya ba lhag par mi bzad pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i sa bon ni stobs chen po dang ldan pa yin te / lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'i grogs dang bcas par che ba yin pas shin tu zhes bya ba lhag par mi bzad pa ste /
translated: The seed of evil is powerful.

original: 'jigs su rung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba yin no //
translated: Since it is great, together with the cooperative causes, it is extremely terrible, that is, very frightening.🔽That is the seed of evil.

original: de ni zhes bya ba stobs sam sdig pa de las rgyal bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba stobs sam sdig pa de las rgyal bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to conquer that power or evil,

original: gal te rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'tshang rgya bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dad pas nye bar bstan par byas pa'i shes rab dang snying rje gnyis dang ldan zhing yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i sems ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin pas
analyzed: gal te rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'tshang rgya bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dad pas nye bar bstan par byas pa'i shes rab dang snying rje gnyis dang ldan zhing yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i sems ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin pas
translated: if one has the mind of complete enlightenment, which is the mind that transcends existence and nonexistence, which is endowed with wisdom and compassion, which is taught through faith in order to become a buddha,🔽then that mind of complete enlightenment is the seed of virtue.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma yin pa dge ba gzhan gang gis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing rgyal bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma yin pa dge ba gzhan gang gis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing rgyal bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: What other virtue, which is not the thought of perfect enlightenment, could surpass or prevail over it?

original: sems de nyid ni nyes pa thams cad sel bar byed pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: sems de nyid ni nyes pa thams cad sel bar byed pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: That very thought is the basis for the removal of all faults.

original: de yang 'di nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa la sogs pa las 'di nyid gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'di nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa la sogs pa las 'di nyid gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And that is stated in this very [text], in the chapter on the perfection of wisdom, and in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, etc.

original: bskal pa du mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bskal pa du mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For many eons, etc.

original: thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du rab tu dgongs shing dpyad par mdzad pas kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'di phan pa yin par gzigs so //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du rab tu dgongs shing dpyad par mdzad pas kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'di phan pa yin par gzigs so //
translated: Even the Lord of Sages, the Blessed Buddha, who reflected and investigated for three incalculable eons, saw that this thought of perfect enlightenment is beneficial.

original: de yang gang gi phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba nyid kyis na lus dang @4a * //
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba nyid kyis na lus dang @4a * //
translated: Moreover, because it is the cause of happiness for oneself and others, the body is like a boat for crossing to the other side of samsara.🔽

original: sems tshim par byed pa'i bde ba nyid kyis bde ba rab tu 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur pa bde blag tu thob par 'gyur ba'am tshad med cing grangs med pa 'das pa'i skye bo'i tshogs te /
analyzed: sems tshim par byed pa'i bde ba nyid kyis bde ba rab tu 'phel zhing rgyas par gyur pa bde blag tu thob par 'gyur ba'am tshad med cing grangs med pa 'das pa'i skye bo'i tshogs te /
translated: Moreover, because it becomes the cause of happiness for oneself and others, the happiness that satisfies body and mind, by the very fact of that, happiness increases and expands.

original: sems can gyi tshogs rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The multitude of beings, the multitude of sentient beings, who have passed beyond measure and number, are liberated from the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa dag brten par bya ba'i phyir /🔽srid pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽bdag nyid kyi srid pa'i sdug bsngal brgya phrag ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa dag brten par bya ba'i phyir / srid pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bdag nyid kyi srid pa'i sdug bsngal brgya phrag ste /
translated: In order to establish those who abide in the thought of awakening,🔽it is said, those who desire to conquer the hundreds of sufferings of existence...

original: gzhom par 'dod cing sel bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gzhom par 'dod cing sel bar 'dod pas so //
translated: With the desire to destroy and remove the hundreds of sufferings of existence for oneself.

original: glegs bam la la las /🔽srid pa'i sdug bsngal brgya phrag las sgrol 'dod //
analyzed: glegs bam la la las / srid pa'i sdug bsngal brgya phrag las sgrol 'dod //
translated: In some texts,

original: ces zer te /
analyzed: ces zer te /
translated: it is said, those who desire to liberate from the hundreds of sufferings of existence.

original: der yang don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: der yang don ni 'di yin no //
translated: But the meaning there is the same.

original: gzhan yang / sems can gyi mi bde bsal bar 'dod pa dang / zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gzhom par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems can gyi mi bde bsal bar 'dod pa dang / zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gzhom par 'dod pas so //
translated: the desire to remove the suffering of sentient beings is the desire to destroy the suffering of poverty of others.

original: bde mang brgya phrag ni bde ba can gyi bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde mang brgya phrag ni bde ba can gyi bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The many hundreds of pleasures are the pleasures of the Land of Bliss, and so on.

original: spyod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni longs spyod par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: spyod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni longs spyod par 'dod pas so //
translated: The desire to enjoy is the desire to experience.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan dag spyod par 'dod pas kyang zhes ston to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan dag spyod par 'dod pas kyang zhes ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that one should also desire others to enjoy.🔽Thus,

original: des ni / byang chub sems nyid rtag tu gtang mi bya //
analyzed: des ni / byang chub sems nyid rtag tu gtang mi bya //
translated: the spirit of enlightenment should never be abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba ste de dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be discarded.

original: phan yon 'di ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: phan yon 'di ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: This benefit is for others at that time.

original: tshe 'di'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefit in this life is

original: byang chub sems skyes gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems skyes gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: stated with the words “when the spirit of enlightenment has arisen. ”

original: 'khor ba'i btson ra ni sred pas bcings pa'i khyim ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i btson ra ni sred pas bcings pa'i khyim ste /
translated: The prison of cyclic existence is the house bound by craving.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas bsdams pa gang yin pa de ni 'khor ba'i btson rar bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas bsdams pa gang yin pa de ni 'khor ba'i btson rar bsdams pa'o //
translated: He who is bound by desire and so on is bound in the prison of cyclic existence.

original: nyam thag rnams zhes bya ba ni mya ngan bya bar 'os pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyam thag rnams zhes bya ba ni mya ngan bya bar 'os pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are distressed are those who are fit to grieve, that is, those who are afflicted.

original: de ni skad cig gis zhes bya ba skad cig tsam gyis bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: de ni skad cig gis zhes bya ba skad cig tsam gyis bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: He is called a son of the Sugatas, that is, of the Buddhas, by the mere instant of generating the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is worthy of the homage of the world with its gods and humans.

original: skad cig gang gis zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig gang gis zhe na /
translated: By what instant?

original: byang chub sems skyes gyur nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems skyes gyur nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The verse says, “Having generated the Thought of Enlightenment.”

original: byang chub kyi sems skyes shing byung bar gyur pa nyid kyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems skyes shing byung bar gyur pa nyid kyis 'gyur te /
translated: By the mere generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, he becomes so.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: And that is as the Lord has declared in the noble Ratnakuṭa and other sūtras.

original: dris pa / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' bar @4b dang po byang chub kyi sems skye bar 'gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: dris pa / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' bar @4b dang po byang chub kyi sems skye bar 'gyur pa yin la /
translated: Question: The bodhisattva ground of Supreme Joy is where the bodhisattva spirit first arises.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i yin pas 'phags pa la ni nyam thag rnams zhes mi bya'o zhe na /🔽bden med kyi de ni chos la dmigs pa can yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i yin pas 'phags pa la ni nyam thag rnams zhes mi bya'o zhe na / bden med kyi de ni chos la dmigs pa can yin la /
translated: Since this is the ground of the noble ones, it is not correct to say that the bodhisattva spirit arises in those who are not noble ones.🔽Reply: The bodhisattva spirit that is the object of the bodhisattva vow is the spirit of enlightenment that is the object of the bodhisattva vow.🔽This is explained with the intention of referring to the spirit of enlightenment that is the object of the bodhisattva vow.

original: 'di ni yang dag par blangs pa brda can la dgongs nas de skad bshad pa yin pas yang dag par blangs pa brda can ni 'phags pa ma yin pa la yang skye bar mdo sde rnams las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par blangs pa brda can la dgongs nas de skad bshad pa yin pas yang dag par blangs pa brda can ni 'phags pa ma yin pa la yang skye bar mdo sde rnams las shes par bya ste /
translated: The sutras teach that the bodhisattva vow can arise in those who are not noble ones.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa las /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa las /
translated: The Sutra Teaching the Non-Arising of All Phenomena says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros la sas bar mthong sa phye nas de 'chi ba'i dus byas pa dang / sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros la sas bar mthong sa phye nas de 'chi ba'i dus byas pa dang / sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva Jayamati saw the ground of seeing the truths and then died and fell into the great hells.

original: de ni stong pa nyid la ma dad cing stong pa nyid smra ba la khong khro ba byas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / nges pa dang ma nges pa la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid la ma dad cing stong pa nyid smra ba la khong khro ba byas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / nges pa dang ma nges pa la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra on Entering Lanka also says:

original: gang la la zhig byang chub kyi sems bskyed la rtag par theg pa chen po mi 'dzin mi klog par nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la brten cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang la la zhig byang chub kyi sems bskyed la rtag par theg pa chen po mi 'dzin mi klog par nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la brten cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Someone who has given rise to bodhichitta but who does not constantly study and recite the Mahayana and who relies on the followers of the Hinayana will not be a bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni phyugs kyi shing rta lta bus 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni phyugs kyi shing rta lta bus 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called a bodhisattva who goes like a cow pulling a cart.🔽The cart of the Hinayana is pulled by a cow and goes to the level of buddhahood.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i phyugs kyi shing rtas sangs rgyas nyid kyi sar bgrod par 'gro ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / chos bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i phyugs kyi shing rtas sangs rgyas nyid kyi sar bgrod par 'gro ba yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / chos bcu pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra on the Ten Dharmas also says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa byang chub tu sems ma bskyed na /
translated: Someone who has the bodhisattva potential but who has not given rise to bodhichitta

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis bskul zhing skyo bar byas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis bskul zhing skyo bar byas /
translated: is urged on by the shravakas of the Tathagata and is made weary.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug ste /
translated: and having made them take it up,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni byang chub kyi sems la mos pa'i rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni byang chub kyi sems la mos pa'i rgyu dang po'o //
translated: he causes them to generate the thought of supreme perfect enlightenment. This is the first cause for the aspiration to enlightenment.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
translated: Having heard the praise of perfect enlightenment

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi bsngags pa thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi bsngags pa thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: and of the thought of enlightenment, he generates the thought of supreme perfect enlightenment. This is the second cause.

original: sems can mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / dpung gnyen med pa rnams mthong nas snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: sems can mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / dpung gnyen med pa rnams mthong nas snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Having seen beings without a protector, without a refuge, without a support,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: he generates the thought of supreme perfect enlightenment, having established the thought of compassion. This is the third cause.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa mthong nas dga' ba bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag @5a * //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa mthong nas dga' ba bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag @5a * //
translated: Having seen the Tathāgata, perfect in all aspects,🔽he generates joy and generates the thought of supreme perfect enlightenment. This is the fourth cause.

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth cause.

original: byang chub kyi sems de lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten du gyur par ni sdong po bkod pa las kyang gsungs pas lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mchod rten du gyur par ni sdong po bkod pa las kyang gsungs pas lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The Array of Stalks also says that the thought of awakening is a shrine for the world with its gods. Therefore, it is worthy of the homage of the world with its gods and humans.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob par lhag par mos pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon skad cig ma gang la skyes pa'i skad cig ma de la bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras zhes brjod🔽par bya ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob par lhag par mos pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon skad cig ma gang la skyes pa'i skad cig ma de la bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The moment the seed of the thought of awakening arises, which has the nature of the aspiration to attain the qualities of a sugata, at that moment one is called a child of the sugatas.

original: de bas na lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is worthy of the homage of the world with its gods and humans.

original: gser 'gyur rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la /
analyzed: gser 'gyur rtsi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la /
translated: The verse beginning with “The elixir called” and so on.

original: gser 'gyur rtsi ni rtsi'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gser 'gyur rtsi ni rtsi'i khyad par ro //
translated: The elixir is a special elixir.

original: mchog lta bu zhes bya ba ni rin po che nyid du byed nus pa ste /
analyzed: mchog lta bu zhes bya ba ni rin po che nyid du byed nus pa ste /
translated: “Like the best” means that it is able to make something into a jewel.

original: de ltar bsgyur nus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgyur nus pa'o //
translated: It is able to transform in that way.

original: mi gtsang lus 'di blangs nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang lus 'di blangs nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having taken up this impure body” means

original: da ltar gyi lus 'di gzung nas so //
analyzed: da ltar gyi lus 'di gzung nas so //
translated: having taken up this present body.

original: rgyal ba'i sku /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sku /
translated: The body of the Victor

original: rin chen rin thang med par bsgyur bas na //
analyzed: rin chen rin thang med par bsgyur bas na //
translated: is transformed into a priceless jewel.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar don chen po nyid du bsgyur nus pa de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar ming btags pa'i gser 'gyur gyi rtsi de rab tu brtan🔽cing ma nyams pa nyid du gzung zhing blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar don chen po nyid du bsgyur nus pa de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar ming btags pa'i gser 'gyur gyi rtsi de rab tu brtan cing ma nyams pa nyid du gzung zhing blang bar bya'o //
translated: The body of the Bhagavat Buddha, which is able to transform into a great purpose, like a wish-fulfilling jewel, is called “the elixir called enlightenment mind.” That elixir is to be held and taken up as very firm and undamaged.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na gser 'gyur rtsi dang 'dra bar bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gser 'gyur rtsi dang 'dra bar bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained it as being like the elixir,

original: rin po che dang 'dra ba nyid bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra ba nyid bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the analogy with a jewel,

original: 'gro ba'i ded dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ded dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The sole captain of the ship of beings,” and so on.

original: 'gro ba'i ded dpon gcig pu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ded dpon gcig pu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i ste /
translated: The sole captain of the ship of beings means that he is the captain of the ship of beings.

original: 'jig rten thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du khrid par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du khrid par mdzad pas so //
translated: He is the sole captain because he leads all worlds to the city of nirvana in accordance with their destinies.

original: tshad med blo zhes bya ba ni phra zhing tshad med pa'i yul yin pa nyid kyis gzhan dag gis gzhal bar mi nus pas tshad med pa'i blo gang la mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa'i blo mnga' zhing rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa
analyzed: tshad med blo zhes bya ba ni phra zhing tshad med pa'i yul yin pa nyid kyis gzhan dag gis gzhal bar mi nus pas tshad med pa'i blo gang la mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa'i blo mnga' zhing rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa
translated: He has immeasurable intelligence means that the Bhagavat Buddha, who has immeasurable intelligence, has intelligence that is subtle and immeasurable because it cannot be measured by others.

original: yang brnyes pa des legs par yongs su brtags pa ste /
analyzed: yang brnyes pa des legs par yongs su brtags pa ste /
translated: He, who has attained the perfection of his own aim, has well examined.

original: rin po che @5b rtog pa na de'i mtshan nyid la rmongs pa'am /
analyzed: rin po che @5b rtog pa na de'i mtshan nyid la rmongs pa'am /
translated: When one examines a jewel, one is confused about its characteristics,

original: gzhan slu bdag la log par rtog par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan slu bdag la log par rtog par byed na /
translated: or one deceives others and has wrong ideas about oneself.

original: sangs rgyas la gnyis po 'di dag mi mnga' bas des legs par yongs su brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la gnyis po 'di dag mi mnga' bas des legs par yongs su brtags pa yin no //
translated: Since the Buddha does not have these two, he has thoroughly examined.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rin che bas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rin che bas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said to be rare,🔽like a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar dpal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa yang rnyed par dka' ba yin na /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar dpal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa yang rnyed par dka' ba yin na /
translated: If it is difficult to obtain even the perfection of wealth, like a wish-fulfilling jewel,

original: byang chub kyi sems rin po che 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rin po che 'di lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention this precious thought of awakening?

original: des na 'gro ba'i gnas dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams te /
analyzed: des na 'gro ba'i gnas dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams te /
translated: Therefore, those who wish to be free from the abodes of migrating beings,

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar rgyu ba'i skal ba can gyi sems tshong ba rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems de legs par shin tu brtan par zung shig pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar rgyu ba'i skal ba can gyi sems tshong ba rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems de legs par shin tu brtan par zung shig pa'o //
translated: those who are destined to wander in the realms of hell and so forth, should hold this thought of awakening of the bodhisattvas well, very firmly.

original: yang gzengs bstod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzengs bstod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to encourage them,

original: dge ba gzhan kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba gzhan kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: it is said all other virtues and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi sems las gzhan pa'i dge ba thams cad ni zhi ba'i 'bras bu med par chu shing dang 'dra bar 'dzad pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems las gzhan pa'i dge ba thams cad ni zhi ba'i 'bras bu med par chu shing dang 'dra bar 'dzad pa yin la /
translated: All virtues other than the Thought of Enlightenment are exhausted like the plantain tree, without the fruit of peace.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi ljon shing ni rtag par yang 'bras bu 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi ljon shing ni rtag par yang 'bras bu 'byin pa yin te /
translated: But the tree of the Thought of Enlightenment always bears fruit,

original: skad cig ma re re zhing rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re zhing rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces the fruit of natural outcome in each moment.

original: de yang 'og nas /
analyzed: de yang 'og nas /
translated: And that is stated below:🔽From now on, whether I am sleeping

original: deng nas brtsams te gnyid log gam //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin pas skye ba re re zhing rnam par smin pa phul du byung ba bskyed du zin kyang /
analyzed: deng nas brtsams te gnyid log gam // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin pas skye ba re re zhing rnam par smin pa phul du byung ba bskyed du zin kyang /
translated: or not,🔽whether I am distracted or not,🔽may the Thought of Enlightenment🔽always arise in me.🔽Thus, even though it produces the most excellent fruit of evolutionary development in each rebirth,

original: 'gro ba ji srid gnas kyi bar du rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pas zad par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba ji srid gnas kyi bar du rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pas zad par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: it is not exhausted, because the fruit of natural outcome continues uninterrupted as long as the world exists.

original: de ltar na rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa las gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa las gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfection of the benefit for others comes from the perfection of one's own benefit.

original: gzhi de las gzhan rnams la yang byang chub kyi sems kyi ljon shing skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi de las gzhan rnams la yang byang chub kyi sems kyi ljon shing skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the tree of the Thought of Enlightenment grows from that basis in others also.

original: de ltar dge ba la mngon par 'jug pa bshad pas legs par gzengs bstod nas /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba la mngon par 'jug pa bshad pas legs par gzengs bstod nas /
translated: Thus, having encouraged well by explaining the engagement in virtue,

original: mi dge ba las ldog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par sbyar ba'i phyir dpa' bo dang 'dra bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba las ldog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par sbyar ba'i phyir dpa' bo dang 'dra bar bshad pa ni /
translated: in order to apply the cause of turning away from the non-virtuous, he explains the analogy of the hero:

original: sdig pa shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Even if one has done a terrible evil deed...

original: sdig pa mi bzad pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi bzad pa ste /
translated: Terrible evil means🔽like a great fear, such as doing harm to the Three Jewels.

original: dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa 'jigs pa chen po dang 'dra ba byas kyang dpa' bo la brten pa dang 'dra bar gang zhig la brten cing gnas @6a * //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa 'jigs pa chen po dang 'dra ba byas kyang dpa' bo la brten pa dang 'dra bar gang zhig la brten cing gnas @6a * //
translated: Even if one has done that, if one has recourse to the hero...🔽Hero means one who has recourse to the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: bcas na / yud kyis zhes bya ba ring po mi thogs par sgrol zhing skyob par nus pa'i byang chub kyi sems de la sems can bag dang ldan pa rnams kyis ci'i phyir brten par mi byed de /
analyzed: bcas na / yud kyis zhes bya ba ring po mi thogs par sgrol zhing skyob par nus pa'i byang chub kyi sems de la sems can bag dang ldan pa rnams kyis ci'i phyir brten par mi byed de /
translated: If so, why would not the conscientious beings rely on the Thought of Enlightenment which is able to rescue and protect in a moment, not after a long time?

original: shin tu yang rten bca' ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: shin tu yang rten bca' ba'i rigs so //
translated: It is most reasonable to rely on it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sdig pa byas shing bsags pa rnams rten gyi stobs kyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sdig pa byas shing bsags pa rnams rten gyi stobs kyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Lord also said in the Catuh-śataka-piṇḍārtha that the power of reliance overcomes the sins which have been done and accumulated.

original: de la rten gyi stobs ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'o zhes chos bzhi ba'i mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rten gyi stobs ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'o zhes chos bzhi ba'i mdo las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the power of reliance is the going for refuge to the Three Jewels and not abandoning the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de ltar dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mi dge ba las ldog pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems yin no zhes yang dag par gdams nas /
analyzed: de ltar dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mi dge ba las ldog pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems yin no zhes yang dag par gdams nas /
translated: Thus, having given the right instruction that the difference between engaging in virtue and turning away from non-virtue is the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: me'i khyad par dang 'dra bar bstan cing /
analyzed: me'i khyad par dang 'dra bar bstan cing /
translated: he taught it to be like the difference in fire.

original: phan yon dpag tu med pa nyid yod pas yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan yon dpag tu med pa nyid yod pas yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the benefits are immeasurable, they are perfectly extolled.🔽To explain this, he says,

original: des ni dus mtha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni dus mtha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: “It is like the fire at the end of time.”

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten 'jig pa'i dus kyi me'i phung po dang 'dra ba yin pas dus mtha'i me ste /🔽de dang 'dra bar mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa chen po rnams skad cig gcig gis zhes bya ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten 'jig pa'i dus kyi me'i phung po dang 'dra ba yin pas dus mtha'i me ste / de dang 'dra bar mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa chen po rnams skad cig gcig gis zhes bya ba /
translated: The fire at the end of time is like the fire at the end of the eon, since it is like the fire at the end of the eon.🔽It is to be grasped in a single instant,

original: lhag par mos pa'i bzod pa chen po'i skad cig ma gcig gis gzung bar bya ba nye bar mi dmigs pa na /
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i bzod pa chen po'i skad cig ma gcig gis gzung bar bya ba nye bar mi dmigs pa na /
translated: in a single instant of the great acceptance of superior motivation.

original: nges par sreg par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nges par sreg par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: When it is grasped, it definitely burns🔽the great sins, such as the actions of immediate retribution.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'i phan yon dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dag mgon po byams pa zhes bya ba blo dang ldan zhing shes rab che bas tshong dpon gyi bu pho nor bzangs zhes bya ba la bshad cing bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'i phan yon dpag tu med pa'i grangs med pa dag mgon po byams pa zhes bya ba blo dang ldan zhing shes rab che bas tshong dpon gyi bu pho nor bzangs zhes bya ba la bshad cing bka' stsal to //
translated: The benefits of the thought of awakening are immeasurable, and the wise one called Lord Maitreya explained them to the merchant’s son Sudhana, saying:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: “Son of good family, the thought of awakening is like the seed of all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yon tan gyi khyad par gzhan dag dang yang dag par ldan pa yin par 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yon tan gyi khyad par gzhan dag dang yang dag par ldan pa yin par 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is like a field, since it causes the white dharmas of all transmigrators to increase. ” And so on, and it is also said in the noble Array of Stalks that it is endowed with other special qualities.

original: de ltar de yan tshad kyi tshigs su bcad pas ni byang chub kyi sems la goms par byas pa tsam gyi phan yon bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar de yan tshad kyi tshigs su bcad pas ni byang chub kyi sems la goms par byas pa tsam gyi phan yon bshad pa yin la /
translated: In this way, the verse up to here explains the benefits of merely becoming familiar with the thought of awakening.

original: da 'di man chad kyis @6b gnas skabs kyi dbye ba la dgongs nas bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: da 'di man chad kyis @6b gnas skabs kyi dbye ba la dgongs nas bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Now, from here on, it should be understood that the explanation is intended with reference to the classification of the stages.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “that thought of enlightenment,” etc.

original: byang chub kyi sems de las byang chub tu mos pa'i sems ni bdag sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can rnams kyi don bya'o zhes dad pas nye bar bstan par bya ba'i blo dang / bya ba dag gis zab cing rgya che ba'i don thob par 'dod pa'i sems de nyid byang chub tu smon pa'i sems yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de las byang chub tu mos pa'i sems ni bdag sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can rnams kyi don bya'o zhes dad pas nye bar bstan par bya ba'i blo dang / bya ba dag gis zab cing rgya che ba'i don thob par 'dod pa'i sems de nyid byang chub tu smon pa'i sems yin no //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the thought of aspiration for enlightenment. The thought of aspiration for enlightenment is the very thought which, by the activities of the thought of enlightenment, desires to attain the profound and extensive meaning, with the understanding that one should demonstrate through faith, “Having become a Buddha, I will work for the welfare of sentient beings.”

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa yang dag par blang ba la sogs pas de la 'jug pa ni byang chub tu 'jug pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa yang dag par blang ba la sogs pas de la 'jug pa ni byang chub tu 'jug pa nyid yin te /
translated: The very engagement in that thought of enlightenment through the correct assumption of the practice of enlightenment, etc., is the very engagement in enlightenment.

original: de lta na rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de lta na rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two aspects.

original: de yang blo dang ldan pas nor bzangs la rigs kyi bu sems can gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: de yang blo dang ldan pas nor bzangs la rigs kyi bu sems can gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni rnyed par dka'o //
translated: Moreover, the wise one said to Sudhana: “Son of good family, it is difficult to find a sentient being who arouses the mind of awakening to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa de yang ches rnyed par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa de yang ches rnyed par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is even more difficult to find one who has entered the path to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dbye ba mang du gsungs la 'dir ni rnam pa bcur bshad la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dbye ba mang du gsungs la 'dir ni rnam pa bcur bshad la /
translated: The Bhagavān has taught many divisions of the grounds, perfections, and so on, and here they are explained in ten aspects.

original: de ji ltar na rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: How are they two aspects?

original: de'i phyir mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdor bsdu na /
translated: Therefore, in brief,

original: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
translated: it should be known as two aspects.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: This is said.

original: rnam pa bcu yin du zin kyang phan yon gyi skabs su mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu yin du zin kyang phan yon gyi skabs su mdor bsdu na /
translated: Even though there are ten aspects, in the context of the benefits, in brief,

original: rnam pa gnyis su gnas te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su gnas te /
translated: it is two aspects.

original: yang dag par blang ba dang / 'jug pa'i khyad par gyis gnyis yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba dang / 'jug pa'i khyad par gyis gnyis yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the two are distinguished by the difference between the aspiration and the engagement.

original: gal te de lta na smon pa byang chub kyi sems kyang spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin na 'di gnyis la dbye ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na smon pa byang chub kyi sems kyang spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin na 'di gnyis la dbye ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then the aspiration thought of enlightenment is also the nature of the practice. What is the difference between these two?

original: de'i phyir 'gro bar 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro bar 'dod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “like the difference between the one who wishes to go and the one who goes.

original: 'gro bar 'dod pa ni yul du 'gro 'dod pa nyid yin gyis 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'dod pa ni yul du 'gro 'dod pa nyid yin gyis 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: ” The one who wishes to go is the one who desires to go to a place, but is not going.

original: 'gro ba ni der 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni der 'gro ba ste /
translated: The one who goes is the one who goes there.

original: de gnyis kyi bye brag ci ltar shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bye brag ci ltar shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the difference between these two is understood,

original: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bye brag kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: so the difference between these two should be understood in the same way.

original: smon pa'i sems ni 'gro bar 'dod pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: smon pa'i sems ni 'gro bar 'dod pa lta bu yin la /
translated: The aspiration thought of enlightenment is like the one who wishes to go.

original: 'jug pa ni 'gro ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'gro ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The engagement is like the one who goes. This is the meaning.

original: gang gis shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis shes par bya zhe na /
translated: By what is it known?

original: mkhas pas te /
analyzed: mkhas pas te /
translated: By the wise.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las la yang dag par brtags nas /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las la yang dag par brtags nas /
translated: Having examined the actions of body, etc.,

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i @7a * //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i @7a * //
translated: One who knows the means of always benefiting oneself and others is wise, because one does not fall into error.

original: thabs shes nas rtag tu byed pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba'i nyes pa mi 'byung bas de ni shes rab yin la /
analyzed: thabs shes nas rtag tu byed pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba'i nyes pa mi 'byung bas de ni shes rab yin la /
translated: This is wisdom.

original: de 'di la yod pas na mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One who has this is called wise.

original: mkhas pa des shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa des shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand this wisdom.

original: smon pa ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam nyid yin la /
analyzed: smon pa ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam nyid yin la /
translated: Vows are simply the desire to do something.

original: 'jug pa ni yang dag par blangs pa la sogs pas 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin la /🔽'dir sdom pa yang dag par len pa 'am /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni yang dag par blangs pa la sogs pas 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin la / 'dir sdom pa yang dag par len pa 'am /
translated: Engagement is the nature of engaging in something through taking a vow, etc.🔽Here, the vow is the generation of the thought of enlightenment through taking the vow,

original: 'dis byang chub tu 'jug pas na yang dag par len pa dang / 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin pa ltar smon pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dis byang chub tu 'jug pas na yang dag par len pa dang / 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin pa ltar smon pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: or the generation of the thought of enlightenment through engagement.

original: de bas na 'khor ba'i tshe 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar 'jug pa las smon pa dang dbye ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba'i tshe 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar 'jug pa las smon pa dang dbye ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, there is no difference between the vow and engagement in terms of the great fruit that occurs in cyclic existence.

original: de ni bden mod kyi //
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi //
translated: This is true,🔽but the vow is the cause of the engagement.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras byang chub tu smon pa'i sems ni 'khor ba bdag dang gzhan gyi byang chub kyi don du 'gyur ba 'bras bu che ba nyid 'byung ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras byang chub tu smon pa'i sems ni 'khor ba bdag dang gzhan gyi byang chub kyi don du 'gyur ba 'bras bu che ba nyid 'byung ba yin mod kyi /
translated: The word “also” indicates that the aspiration thought of enlightenment is a great result, since it is for the sake of one’s own and others’ enlightenment in cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar 'jug pa'i sems kyis der 'jug pa bzhin du bsod nams rgyun mi chad par rgyun chags su 'byung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug pa'i sems kyis der 'jug pa bzhin du bsod nams rgyun mi chad par rgyun chags su 'byung ba ma yin pas /
translated: But it is not the case that merit arises continuously, without interruption, as it does with the engaged thought of enlightenment.

original: 'dir 'jug pa'i sems ni snga ma las khyad par yod do //
analyzed: 'dir 'jug pa'i sems ni snga ma las khyad par yod do //
translated: So the engaged thought of enlightenment is distinguished from the former.

original: de nyid ji ltar bsod nams kyi rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar bsod nams kyi rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does it arise as an uninterrupted stream of merit?

original: de'i phyir gang nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain this, he says, “From the time when…”

original: skad cig ma /🔽gang nas bzung ste sems can khams //
analyzed: skad cig ma / gang nas bzung ste sems can khams //
translated: The moment🔽when one first generates🔽the thought to liberate

original: mtha' yas rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mtha' yas rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir //
translated: the infinite realms of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can gyi khams 'di tsam zhes mtha' gzung bar ni mi nus pa'i mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sems can gyi khams 'di tsam zhes mtha' gzung bar ni mi nus pa'i mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: The realms of sentient beings are infinite, in the sense that it is impossible to set a limit on them, saying, “They are this much.”

original: sems can de rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na khams te /
analyzed: sems can de rnams kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na khams te /
translated: Since those sentient beings also hold their own characteristics, they are realms.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang rkyen skye ba'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang rkyen skye ba'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: They are the nature of the continuum of the arising of afflictions, karma, and conditions.

original: de rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang / 'khor ba'i btson ra las rab tu dgrol bar bya ba de'i don gyi phyir /🔽'khor ba ji srid gnas kyi bar du mi ldog cing phyir bzlog par mi nus pa'i sems kyis 'jug pa'i sems de ni mngon par 'phel zhing rnam par dag par bya ba yang dag par blangs pa'i sems de nyid kyis bya ba mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: de rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang / 'khor ba'i btson ra las rab tu dgrol bar bya ba de'i don gyi phyir / 'khor ba ji srid gnas kyi bar du mi ldog cing phyir bzlog par mi nus pa'i sems kyis 'jug pa'i sems de ni mngon par 'phel zhing rnam par dag par bya ba yang dag par blangs pa'i sems de nyid kyis bya ba mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir
translated: For the sake of completely liberating those from the bondage of afflictions and the prison of cyclic existence,🔽with a mind that does not turn back and cannot be turned back for as long as cyclic existence remains,

original: len par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: len par gyur pa'o //
translated: that mind that engages is the mind that takes up the vow in order to perfect the activity of that very mind that has taken up the vow in order to increase and purify.

original: dus deng nas bzung nas te gnyid log par gyur tam /
analyzed: dus deng nas bzung nas te gnyid log par gyur tam /
translated: From now on, whether one falls asleep or

original: bag med pa nyid du @7b gyur kyang mi dge ba las ldog pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rnams la byams pa dang / snying rje chen po dag gis bsod nams kyi shugs te /
analyzed: bag med pa nyid du @7b gyur kyang mi dge ba las ldog pa dang / dge ba la 'jug pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rnams la byams pa dang / snying rje chen po dag gis bsod nams kyi shugs te /
translated: Even when they are careless, they turn away from nonvirtue, they engage in virtue, and they work for the welfare of all sentient beings with love and great compassion.🔽The stream of their merit, which is the cause of their virtue, is inexhaustible.

original: dge ba'i rgyun bar mi 'chad pa dang / de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis zad mi shes pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyun re re zhing yang rnam pa tha dad du ma zhig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rgyun bar mi 'chad pa dang / de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis zad mi shes pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyun re re zhing yang rnam pa tha dad du ma zhig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Each of these streams of merit arises in many different ways.

original: de ltar shin tu rgya che ba dang / zad mi shes pa nyid kyis nam mkha' dang mnyam par rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu rgya che ba dang / zad mi shes pa nyid kyis nam mkha' dang mnyam par rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, they become like space, because they are so vast and inexhaustible.

original: dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: The Questions of Ugra Sutra says:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams gang //
translated: If the merit of bodhisattvas

original: de la gal te gzugs yod na //🔽nam mkha'i khams ni kun bkang ste //
analyzed: de la gal te gzugs yod na // nam mkha'i khams ni kun bkang ste //
translated: had a form,🔽it would fill all of space

original: de ni de bas lhag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni de bas lhag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and extend beyond it.

original: 'dir rigs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning here?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “This is…” and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems phan yon chen po dang bcas pa yin pa 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems phan yon chen po dang bcas pa yin pa 'di nyid ni /

analyzed: 'thad pa dang bcas par zhes bya bar rigs pa dang ldan pa yin par de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is said by the Tathāgata himself to be reasonable, that is, to be endowed with reasoning.

original: ci'i phyir gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsungs she na /

original: dman mos sems can don gyi phyir //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dman mos sems can don gyi phyir // zhes gsungs te /
translated: “For the sake of sentient beings with inferior aspiration.”

analyzed: 'gro ba dman pa la mos pa dag gi don du bya'o//
translated: It is to be done for the sake of those who have inferior aspiration.

original: gang las gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang las gsungs she na /
translated: From where is it said?

original: lag bzangs kyis ni zhus pa las //
analyzed: lag bzangs kyis ni zhus pa las //

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said.

original: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa las 'thad pa dang bcas par ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa las 'thad pa dang bcas par ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is it said in the Subāhupariprcchā to be reasonable?

original: de'i phyir sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The thought, ‘I will remove…’” and so on.🔽The thought, “I will remove

original: sems can rnams kyi glad nad tsam //🔽bsal lo snyam du sems pa yang //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi glad nad tsam // bsal lo snyam du sems pa yang //
translated: just the headache of sentient beings,”

original: phan 'dogs bsam pa dang ldan te //
analyzed: phan 'dogs bsam pa dang ldan te //
translated: is endowed with the thought to benefit.

original: sman pa la sogs pas rang gi 'dod pa'i don gyi srid pa med pa'i sems dang ldan na /
analyzed: sman pa la sogs pas rang gi 'dod pa'i don gyi srid pa med pa'i sems dang ldan na /
translated: If a physician, etc., who has no thought of gain,

analyzed: bsod nams su bya ba dpag tu med pa dag 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: grasps the immeasurable merit,
