analyzed: sems can re re'i mi bde ba'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med cing grangs med pa'i dbye ba snyed kyi bya ba la dmigs pa gsal bar 'dod cing gzhom par 'dod pa dang / sems can re re'ang yon tan dpag tu med pa 'grub cing skyed bar 'dod pa dag ni smos ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to speak of one who is clear about the immeasurable and countless types of actions that are the suffering of the unhappiness of each sentient being, who wishes to destroy it, and who wishes to accomplish and generate the immeasurable good qualities of each sentient being?

original: shin tu yang tshad med pa'i bsod nams su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar @8a * //
analyzed: shin tu yang tshad med pa'i bsod nams su 'gyur ro zhes bya bar @8a * //
translated: It is thought that he would have immeasurable merit.

original: dgongs so // de yang su la zhe na /
analyzed: dgongs so // de yang su la zhe na /
translated: Moreover, who is this?

original: 'di 'dra ba'i phan sems su zhig la yod ces spyir nye bar brtags nas khyad par bstan pa'i phyir pha 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i phan sems su zhig la yod ces spyir nye bar brtags nas khyad par bstan pa'i phyir pha 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In general, having examined who has such a helpful attitude, in order to teach the special case, he says “father” and so on.

original: pha 'am yang nam yang rung //
analyzed: pha 'am yang nam yang rung //
translated: A father or a mother

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgras ni mi rnams kyi spun zla 'am mdza' bo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “also” refers to human brothers, friends, and so on.

analyzed: lha dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “Gods” refers to the Lokapalas and so on.

analyzed: drang srong rnams zhes bya ba ni shed las skyes la sogs pa'i skyes bu rnams so //
translated: “Rishis” refers to the beings such as the Sages born from a womb.

analyzed: tshangs pa ni 'byin pa po nyid yin par gzhan dag mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Brahma is the creator, as others believe.

original: de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' dag sems can rnams phan par dgongs pa lta bu'i phan pa'i sems 'di yod pa ma yin te mi srid pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' dag sems can rnams phan par dgongs pa lta bu'i phan pa'i sems 'di yod pa ma yin te mi srid pa nyid yin no //
translated: For them, the bodhisattvas do not have this altruistic attitude, this attitude of benefit for sentient beings. It is impossible.

original: gzhan yang sems can de dag nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can de dag nyid de /
translated: Moreover, those very sentient beings

original: pha la sogs pa dang des rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: pha la sogs pa dang des rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i sems can rnams la /
translated: are the ones who were the parents and so on of these bodhisattvas in the past.

original: sngon chad rang gi don du yang 'di 'dra ba'i yid la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems rmi lam du yang ma rmis shing sngar skyes pa ma mthong na /
analyzed: sngon chad rang gi don du yang 'di 'dra ba'i yid la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems rmi lam du yang ma rmis shing sngar skyes pa ma mthong na /
translated: Previously, even for their own sake, they did not have such a wish in their minds, not even in a dream.

original: gzhan dag gi don du 'di 'dra ba'i sems par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi don du 'di 'dra ba'i sems par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could such a thought arise for the sake of others?

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba'i nad kyi rtsi sman du gyur pa ni thar pa thob pa'i don du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba'i nad kyi rtsi sman du gyur pa ni thar pa thob pa'i don du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the medicine of the thought of awakening is the medicine for the sickness of suffering, because it is for the sake of attaining liberation.

original: 'gro ba kun gyi dga' ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / skye dgu'i sdug bsngal gyi sman du gyur pa'i sems rin po che'i bsod nams gang yin pa zhes sgra ba can zin gyi mgo dang 'dra bar dbye ba med kyang phye ste bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi dga' ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / skye dgu'i sdug bsngal gyi sman du gyur pa'i sems rin po che'i bsod nams gang yin pa zhes sgra ba can zin gyi mgo dang 'dra bar dbye ba med kyang phye ste bshad pa yin no //
translated: The merit of the precious thought of awakening, which is the cause of the joy of all beings and the medicine for the suffering of all beings, is like the head of a peacock’s feather, which is indivisible.

original: 'dir bsod nams ni 'gro ba'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir bsod nams ni 'gro ba'i don gyi rgyur gyur pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Here, merit is the cause of the welfare of beings.

original: bsod nams de las ji ltar gzhal gyis lang //
analyzed: bsod nams de las ji ltar gzhal gyis lang //
translated: How could it be measured?

original: de bas shin tu yang tshad med pa yin no zhes de ltar 'dir ni lag bzangs kyis zhus pa las 'thad pa dang bcas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas shin tu yang tshad med pa yin no zhes de ltar 'dir ni lag bzangs kyis zhus pa las 'thad pa dang bcas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is immeasurable. In this way, the Questions of Subāhu presents this with reasoning.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / phan par bsams pa tsam gyis kyang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / phan par bsams pa tsam gyis kyang //
translated: Merely wishing to benefit

original: sangs rgyas mchod las khyad 'phags na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod las khyad 'phags na //
translated: It is more excellent than making offerings to the buddhas.🔽

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How much more so if it is superior to the worship of the Buddhas!

original: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: As the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: mchod pa tshad med rnams mang ji snyed pa //
analyzed: mchod pa tshad med rnams mang ji snyed pa //
translated: “However many immeasurable offerings there are,

original: zhing ni bye ba khrag khrig gtams rnyed du //
analyzed: zhing ni bye ba khrag khrig gtams rnyed du //
translated: in a hundred thousand quintillion buddha-fields,

original: skyes bu mchog la mchod pa de byas pas //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog la mchod pa de byas pas //
translated: by making those offerings to the supreme individuals,

original: byams pa'i sems la grangs dang char mi phod //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems la grangs dang char mi phod //
translated: the mind of lovingkindness does not equal a portion of that.🔽”

original: ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And as the noble Sūtra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head says,

original: sems @8b can kun gyi bde ba ni //
analyzed: sems @8b can kun gyi bde ba ni //
translated: “The happiness of all sentient beings comes from the happiness of one sentient being.

original: kun don brtson pa smos ci dges //
analyzed: kun don brtson pa smos ci dges //
translated: What need is there to say more about one who strives for the welfare of all sentient beings?🔽”

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyis bde ba thams cad thob pa'i don du brtson pas 'jug pa dag ni ci'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ma yin te /🔽khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyis bde ba thams cad thob pa'i don du brtson pas 'jug pa dag ni ci'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ma yin te / khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin no //
translated: What need is there to say more about one who strives for the welfare of all sentient beings?

original: de bzhin du byang chub tu smon pa dag gi bsod nams tshad med pa yin yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub tu smon pa dag gi bsod nams tshad med pa yin yang /
translated: In the same way, the goodness of those who aspire to Awakening is immeasurable.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du 'jug pas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du 'jug pas /
translated: But when they engage in the welfare of all sentient beings,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not superior, he says, “Suffering,” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal 'dor zhing de las nges par 'byung ba'i thar pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'dor zhing de las nges par 'byung ba'i thar pa ste /
translated: Liberation is the relinquishing of suffering and the definite emergence from it.

original: de 'dod pa'i phyir brtul zhugs can kha cig skra 'bal ba la sogs pa byed cing sdug bsngal nyid la mngon par brgyug go //
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i phyir brtul zhugs can kha cig skra 'bal ba la sogs pa byed cing sdug bsngal nyid la mngon par brgyug go //
translated: Because they desire that, some ascetics pull out their hair and so on and rush headlong into suffering.

original: de bzhin du gzhan ni bde ba 'thob par 'dod kyang mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam mi shes shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan ni bde ba 'thob par 'dod kyang mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam mi shes shing /
translated: Similarly, others, though desiring to attain happiness, do not know the path to heaven and liberation.🔽Because of their complete delusion, they rush headlong into the causes of great suffering, thinking that they are the causes of happiness. They do not know the causes of happiness in this life and the next.

original: kun tu gti mug pas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu dag la bde ba'i rgyu yin no snyam pas mngon par brgyug cing rang gi bde ba dag ni dgra bo ltar 'joms par byed pa ste mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i bde ba'i rgyu mi shes shing /
analyzed: kun tu gti mug pas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu dag la bde ba'i rgyu yin no snyam pas mngon par brgyug cing rang gi bde ba dag ni dgra bo ltar 'joms par byed pa ste mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i bde ba'i rgyu mi shes shing /
translated: Because of their complete delusion, they destroy their own happiness as if it were an enemy.

original: de la kun tu rmongs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa ni bde ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la kun tu rmongs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa ni bde ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Because of their complete delusion, they think that generosity and so on are the causes of happiness.

original: de kho na nyid shes pa'i blo ni thar pa'i rgyu yin no zhes mi shes pas de dang mi mthun pa 'ba' zhig ston par byed do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa'i blo ni thar pa'i rgyu yin no zhes mi shes pas de dang mi mthun pa 'ba' zhig ston par byed do //
translated: Those who do not know this are shown to be in opposition to it.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la sdom brtson can dang / khyim pa gang zhig bde bas mi ngoms pa'i phyir bde bas phongs par gyur pa dang / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan bas lan du mar gzir bar gyur pa de dag la byams pa chen po las byung ba'i bde ba kun gyis ni tshim par byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la sdom brtson can dang / khyim pa gang zhig bde bas mi ngoms pa'i phyir bde bas phongs par gyur pa dang / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan bas lan du mar gzir bar gyur pa de dag la byams pa chen po las byung ba'i bde ba kun gyis ni tshim par byed do //
translated: Those who are diligent in the precepts and those who are householders, who are not satisfied with happiness and therefore are deprived of happiness, who are oppressed again and again by the many sufferings of hell and so on, they are satisfied with all the happiness that arises from great love.

original: snying rje chen pos sdug bsngal thams cad ni gcod par byed cing 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sdug bsngal thams cad ni gcod par byed cing 'gog par byed do //
translated: With great compassion, they cut off and stop all suffering.

original: shes rab kyis gti mug kyang ni sel zhing 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis gti mug kyang ni sel zhing 'jig par byed do //
translated: With wisdom, they also remove and destroy delusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa dag ni rang bzhin gyis snying rje chen po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gsol ba ma btab tu zin kyang gzhan gyi don 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa dag ni rang bzhin gyis snying rje chen po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gsol ba ma btab tu zin kyang gzhan gyi don 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Those who possess the bodhisattva lineage are naturally endowed with great compassion and so forth, and so they engage in benefiting others even without being requested to do so.

original: de bas na sems can gyi don gyi 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dang dge zhing legs pa mtshungs shing mnyam pa ga @9a * //🔽la yod de /
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi don gyi 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dang dge zhing legs pa mtshungs shing mnyam pa ga @9a * // la yod de /
translated: So how can there be any virtue or goodness equal to that of the bodhisattva who engages in benefiting sentient beings?

original: smon pa la gnas su zin kyang de dang mnyam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smon pa la gnas su zin kyang de dang mnyam pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one abides in the aspiration, it is not equal to that.

original: ga la yod ces bya bas ni mi srid pa nyid yin par ston to //🔽de bas na 'phags pa byams pas kyang rigs kyi bu byang chub tu smon pa 'di yang rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: ga la yod ces bya bas ni mi srid pa nyid yin par ston to // de bas na 'phags pa byams pas kyang rigs kyi bu byang chub tu smon pa 'di yang rnyed par dka'o //
translated: “How can there be?” shows that it is impossible.🔽Therefore, the noble Maitreya also says, “Child of a good family, this aspiration for enlightenment is also difficult to obtain.

original: de bas kyang gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa de yang ches rnyed par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas kyang gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa de yang ches rnyed par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But it is even more difficult to obtain than that for those who engage in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.”

original: de ltar na byang chub tu 'jug pa'i bsod nams ni shin tu yang rnyed par dka' ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub tu 'jug pa'i bsod nams ni shin tu yang rnyed par dka' ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the merit of engaging in enlightenment is extremely difficult to obtain.

original: de 'dra'i bshes kyang ga la yod //
analyzed: de 'dra'i bshes kyang ga la yod //
translated: How could there be a friend like that?

original: ces bya ba ni smon pa la gnas su zin kyang 'jug pa'i sems lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni smon pa la gnas su zin kyang 'jug pa'i sems lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Even if one abides in the vow, one does not have the thought of engagement.

original: 'jug pa ni shin tu yang bsngags par bya ba yin pas 'di ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni shin tu yang bsngags par bya ba yin pas 'di ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Engagement is extremely praiseworthy, so this is the distinction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phan btags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phan btags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “benefiting,” etc.

original: gang gis phan 'dogs par byed pa 'dir phan 'dogs pa zhes bshad la /
analyzed: gang gis phan 'dogs par byed pa 'dir phan 'dogs pa zhes bshad la /
translated: Here, the one who benefits is explained as the benefactor.

original: phan btags pa de la slar lan lon pa de gang yin pa de ni lan ldon pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phan btags pa de la slar lan lon pa de gang yin pa de ni lan ldon pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The one who repays that benefit is called the one who repays.

original: de yang re zhig bsngags par 'os pa nyid yin na /🔽ma bcol phan par byed pa yi //
analyzed: de yang re zhig bsngags par 'os pa nyid yin na / ma bcol phan par byed pa yi //
translated: Moreover, that is praiseworthy.🔽Even without being asked, he benefits.

original: zhes bya ba gsol ba ma btab tu zin kyang thams cad du phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsol ba ma btab tu zin kyang thams cad du phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: Even without being requested, he benefits everyone.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is the one who exists as a bodhisattva.

original: de ni smos ci dgos pas shin tu yang bsngags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni smos ci dgos pas shin tu yang bsngags par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since he is the one who exists as a bodhisattva, he is the bodhisattva.

original: bstod pa'i tshig dag gis bsngags par 'os pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig dag gis bsngags par 'os pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: He is worthy of praise, not only because he is worthy of praise with words of praise,

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod pa bya ba yang yin no //🔽de yang gang gi phyir 'gro ba nyung zad cig la nar ma tsam gyis kha zas sbyor zhing sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa de la yang 'di ni 'gro ba la zas sbyin par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod pa bya ba yang yin no // de yang gang gi phyir 'gro ba nyung zad cig la nar ma tsam gyis kha zas sbyor zhing sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa de la yang 'di ni 'gro ba la zas sbyin par byed pa yin pas /
translated: but also because he is worthy of worship with prostrations and with offerings of flowers, incense, and so on.🔽Moreover, people honor and worship him, saying, “He is a virtuous person” because he provides food for the world.

original: dge ba byed pa yin no zhes skye bo rnams kyis bkur zhing mngon par mchod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba byed pa yin no zhes skye bo rnams kyis bkur zhing mngon par mchod par byed pa yin no //
translated: He provides food for the world, since he provides food for a few beings for a short time.

original: nar ma'i zas ci tsam zhig sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: nar ma'i zas ci tsam zhig sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: How much food does he provide?

original: skad cig tsam gyis dus thams cad du ma yin pa dang / zas tsam sbyin pa de yang brnyas pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsten par byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig tsam gyis dus thams cad du ma yin pa dang / zas tsam sbyin pa de yang brnyas pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsten par byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: For a mere instant, not for all time, and even that mere instant's gift of food is given with contempt.

original: ji ltar na brnyas pa dang bcas par byin du zin kyang dge ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brnyas pa dang bcas par byin du zin kyang dge ba yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be virtuous when given with contempt?

original: nyin phyed @9b 'grangs par byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyin phyed @9b 'grangs par byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, it satisfies for half a day.

original: 'gro ba nyung zad cig gi nyi ma phyed kyi 'tsho ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba nyung zad cig gi nyi ma phyed kyi 'tsho ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the livelihood for half a day for a few beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni sems can grangs nges pa med pa mtha' yas zhes bya bas nye bar mtshon pa rnams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni sems can grangs nges pa med pa mtha' yas zhes bya bas nye bar mtshon pa rnams la /
translated: The bodhisattvas give to beings who are not limited in number, as indicated by the word infinite.

original: dus ring du ste dus chad pa med par sbyin zhing ster bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus ring du ste dus chad pa med par sbyin zhing ster bar byed pa'o //
translated: They give for a long time, without interruption.

original: ci zhig sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: What do they give?

original: mkha' dang 'gro ba zad kyang gang yin la bsams pa ma lus pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'gro ba rnams zad par gyur kyang mi zad pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mkha' dang 'gro ba zad kyang gang yin la bsams pa ma lus pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'gro ba rnams zad par gyur kyang mi zad pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: and is inexhaustible even though space and beings are exhausted.

original: yid la bsams pa mtha' dag rdzogs byed cing//🔽mkha' dang 'gro ba zad kyang mi zad pa //
analyzed: yid la bsams pa mtha' dag rdzogs byed cing// mkha' dang 'gro ba zad kyang mi zad pa //
translated: It fulfills all wishes

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and is inexhaustible even though space and beings are exhausted.

original: dus gsum thams cad du dge ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum thams cad du dge ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of all things that are virtuous in all three times.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: yang dag par sbyin par byas pa'i sems can grangs mtha' yas nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir chad pa med pa dang / thams cad kyi yid la re ba ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'gro ba rnams yongs su zad kyang zad pa med pa nyid kyis dus kyi rgyun chad pa med par rjes su sbyin par byed pa dag ci'i phyir mchod par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyin par byas pa'i sems can grangs mtha' yas nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir chad pa med pa dang / thams cad kyi yid la re ba ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'gro ba rnams yongs su zad kyang zad pa med pa nyid kyis dus kyi rgyun chad pa med par rjes su sbyin par byed pa dag ci'i phyir mchod par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because they give to beings in a way that is uninterrupted, in order to illustrate the infinity of sentient beings who are given to perfectly, in order to fulfill the hopes of all without exception, and in order to give in a way that is uninterrupted over time, even though space and beings are inexhaustible, why would they not be the ones who make offerings?

original: gzhan du na de ni shin tu mchod par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du na de ni shin tu mchod par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, they are the ones who make the most excellent offerings.

original: de lta na gang zhig de 'dra'i rgyal sras nar ma'i sbyin bdag chen po'i yul la 'gro ba gang zhig gal te rang gi sems rnyog pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: de lta na gang zhig de 'dra'i rgyal sras nar ma'i sbyin bdag chen po'i yul la 'gro ba gang zhig gal te rang gi sems rnyog pa dang bcas shing /
translated: In this way, if someone who is an object of the generosity of such a bodhisattva, a great benefactor, should give rise to a negative thought,

original: dad pa med pa'i ngan sems skyed par byed pa de /
analyzed: dad pa med pa'i ngan sems skyed par byed pa de /
translated: with a mind that is clouded and without faith,

original: ngan sems bskyed pa'i grangs bzhin bskal par ni //
analyzed: ngan sems bskyed pa'i grangs bzhin bskal par ni //
translated: for as many eons as there are negative thoughts,

original: zhes pa rnyog pa'i ngan sems skyes pa'i skad cig ma'i grangs ji snyed pa'i skad cig ma de dang mnyam pa'i bskal pa'i grangs de snyed du dmyal bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes rgyal bas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: zhes pa rnyog pa'i ngan sems skyes pa'i skad cig ma'i grangs ji snyed pa'i skad cig ma de dang mnyam pa'i bskal pa'i grangs de snyed du dmyal bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes rgyal bas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: The Victorious One, the Buddha, the Transcendent Conqueror, has said that for as many moments of anger as one has felt, for that many eons will one have to remain in the hells.

original: pa brgyad stong pa la sogs pa las gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa brgyad stong pa la sogs pa las gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Conqueror, the Buddha Bhagavan, has said in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines and so on that for as many moments as the negative thoughts of defilement arise, for that number of eons will one stay in the hells.

original: 'on te rgyal ba'i sras la yid rab tu dang bar byed cing dang bar byed pa na skyes bu de'i 'bras bu sngar bshad pa'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba'i dus de las lhag par yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bde 'gro la sogs pa skyed par🔽'gyur ro // de bzhin du rgyal ba'i sras @10a * //
analyzed: 'on te rgyal ba'i sras la yid rab tu dang bar byed cing dang bar byed pa na skyes bu de'i 'bras bu sngar bshad pa'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba'i dus de las lhag par yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bde 'gro la sogs pa skyed par 'gyur ro // de bzhin du rgyal ba'i sras @10a * //
translated: But if one has faith in the Bodhisattvas, the offspring of the Conqueror, and if one has faith in them and has devotion for them, the result that will be produced in the person who has faith is a good rebirth in the higher realms and so on, which is far more pleasant than the unpleasant results explained above.🔽In the same way, even if one has committed a great many negative actions, if one has devotion for the Bodhisattvas, the offspring of the Conqueror, the result that will be produced in that person is a good rebirth in the higher realms and so on, which is far more pleasant than the unpleasant results explained above.

original: rnams la do gal lam stobs chen pos kyang sdig pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnams la do gal lam stobs chen pos kyang sdig pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: And even if one has not the slightest faith in the Bodhisattvas, the offspring of the Conqueror, and even if one has no devotion for them, one will not give rise to negative actions.

original: rkyen gyi stobs dang ldan pa dag nye bar gnas pas kyang /
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs dang ldan pa dag nye bar gnas pas kyang /
translated: And even if one is in the power of adverse conditions,

original: sems can gyi sdig pa'i las dang 'brel par mi mdzad la /
analyzed: sems can gyi sdig pa'i las dang 'brel par mi mdzad la /
translated: They do not engage in sinful actions in relation to sentient beings.

original: sems can mgu ba la mchog tu brtson pas dge ba ni ngang gis 'phel bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can mgu ba la mchog tu brtson pas dge ba ni ngang gis 'phel bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: And because they are intent on pleasing sentient beings, their virtue naturally increases.

original: de bas na gang gi sku la rgyal ba'i sras kyi sems kyi phan yon chen po de lta bu dang ldan pa'i mchog dam pa sems kyi rin po che 'di skyes shing 'khrungs par gyur pa de rnams kyi sku lus la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud par byed do
analyzed: de bas na gang gi sku la rgyal ba'i sras kyi sems kyi phan yon chen po de lta bu dang ldan pa'i mchog dam pa sems kyi rin po che 'di skyes shing 'khrungs par gyur pa de rnams kyi sku lus la phyag 'tshal zhing 'dud par byed do
translated: Therefore, we should pay homage and bow down to the bodies of those in whom this supreme, sublime, precious mind of the bodhisattva has arisen and been born, a mind that has such great benefits for the body of the victors.

original: // de bzhin du gang la gnod pa byas kyang bde ba dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: // de bzhin du gang la gnod pa byas kyang bde ba dang rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, even if you harm those who are related to happiness, you will still be related to happiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang mtho ris su nye bar 'gro ba'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang mtho ris su nye bar 'gro ba'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Blessed One said, “Those who harm the qualities of a buddha will also go to the higher realms.”

original: dmyal bar gnas par 'gyur zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
analyzed: dmyal bar gnas par 'gyur zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na /
translated: But didn’t he say that they will dwell in hell?

original: de ni bden mod kyis /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyis /
translated: That is true.

original: de rnams la gnod pa byas pa'i dbang gis dmyal ba rnams su gnas par gyur kyang de gzhi de las gnas skabs gzhan du sems dad cing dang bas slar yang snod du gyur pa na /
analyzed: de rnams la gnod pa byas pa'i dbang gis dmyal ba rnams su gnas par gyur kyang de gzhi de las gnas skabs gzhan du sems dad cing dang bas slar yang snod du gyur pa na /
translated: Even though they are in the hells because of the harm they have done to these beings, they will later become vessels for the Dharma, their minds full of faith and confidence.

original: de dad pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mtho ris su 'gro ba'i thabs kyang de nyid yin par de rnams kyis gzigs te /
analyzed: de dad pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mtho ris su 'gro ba'i thabs kyang de nyid yin par de rnams kyis gzigs te /
translated: Even though they are abiding in the hells due to the power of their having harmed those beings, they see that the very same beings are the means for their going to a higher rebirth, through faith and so on, once they have become vessels again.

original: dper na 'phags pa me tog zla mdzes kyis rgyal po dpa' byin la byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa me tog zla mdzes kyis rgyal po dpa' byin la byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the noble one Supuṣpacandra did this for King Vīradatta.

original: 'dir phan pa ni thar pa'i sa bon yin la /
analyzed: 'dir phan pa ni thar pa'i sa bon yin la /
translated: Here, benefit is the seed of liberation.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang de dang 'brel pa'i ngang tshul yin pas de ltar na brgyud pa'i sgo nas gnod par byed pa la yang bde zhing phan pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang de dang 'brel pa'i ngang tshul yin pas de ltar na brgyud pa'i sgo nas gnod par byed pa la yang bde zhing phan pa dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Since happiness and suffering are related to that, in that way, even those who harm them are related to their happiness and benefit.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' las ni phan pa dang bde ba nyid 'byung ba'i phyir bde ba'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' las ni phan pa dang bde ba nyid 'byung ba'i phyir bde ba'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since only benefit and happiness arise from the buddhas and bodhisattvas, they are called “the source of happiness.”

original: bde ba'i 'byung gnas ni bde ba'i zhing gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: bde ba'i 'byung gnas ni bde ba'i zhing gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Since the source of happiness is the field of happiness,

original: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa de la skyabs su mchi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa de la skyabs su mchi zhes pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva is the protector. I go for refuge to that.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon ni de'i 'bras bu 'am yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon ni de'i 'bras bu 'am yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba'o //
translated: The benefit of the thought of awakening is its great nature of result or quality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las le'u dang po'o /
translated: This completes the first chapter of the Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra, called “Embracing the Mind of Awakening.”

original: // / de ltar phan yon chen po dang ldan zhing bde ba'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de ltar phan yon chen po dang ldan zhing bde ba'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the precious mind is to be definitely held and taken up because it has great benefit and is itself the source of happiness,

original: sems rin @10b po che de nges par gzung zhing blang dgos pas de'i phyir rin chen sems de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems rin @10b po che de nges par gzung zhing blang dgos pas de'i phyir rin chen sems de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “That precious mind,” and so forth.

original: rin po che lta bu'i sems de yang dag par legs par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i sems de yang dag par legs par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to properly and perfectly hold that precious mind,

original: mchod pa yang dag par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa yang dag par bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings.

original: de yang dad pa'i shugs chen pos phyag 'tshal ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de yang dad pa'i shugs chen pos phyag 'tshal ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pas /
translated: Moreover, one should make prostrations and go for refuge with great force of faith.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgatas are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.🔽The immaculate, precious Dharma is the immaculate, precious Dharma, which is free from the stains of conceptualization of things and non-things.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / dam pa'i chos dkon mchog dri ma med pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam dpyad na dri ma'i nag nog dang bral ba dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi sras yon tan mtha' yas pa ste rgya mtsho snyed mnga' ba rnams la legs par mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / dam pa'i chos dkon mchog dri ma med pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam dpyad na dri ma'i nag nog dang bral ba dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi sras yon tan mtha' yas pa ste rgya mtsho snyed mnga' ba rnams la legs par mchod par bya ste /
translated: The Buddha’s sons are the Bodhisattvas, who possess infinite, ocean-like qualities.🔽Having made offerings to them,

original: mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas /
analyzed: mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa byas /
translated: having praised them, having prostrated to them, having gone for refuge, and so forth,

original: bsam pa yang dag par sbyangs nas sdig pa rnams kyang bshags la /
analyzed: bsam pa yang dag par sbyangs nas sdig pa rnams kyang bshags la /
translated: having purified one’s thoughts, one should also confess one’s misdeeds.

original: de'i rjes la byang chub tu smon par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la byang chub tu smon par bya ste /
translated: After that, one should make the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: de nas ni 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ni 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should engage in the practice.

original: de ltar sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug gis rgyas pa dang / yongs su dag pa nyid kyis sems rin po che de yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug gis rgyas pa dang / yongs su dag pa nyid kyis sems rin po che de yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, through the preliminaries, the main practice, and the conclusion, the precious mind will be properly taken up, and it will be expanded and purified.

original: de la mchod pa ni me tog dbul ba dang / de'i rkyen du gyur pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: de la mchod pa ni me tog dbul ba dang / de'i rkyen du gyur pa'i las rnams so //
translated: Worship is the offering of flowers and the actions that are the conditions for that.

original: de yang bla na yod pa dang bcas pa dang / bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bla na yod pa dang bcas pa dang / bla na med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is with remainder and without remainder.

original: de las kyang re zhig dang po bstan pa ni me tog 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las kyang re zhig dang po bstan pa ni me tog 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Among those, first, the teaching is the verse beginning with “flowers, fruits,” and so on.

original: ji snyed yod pa dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par smras pa yin no //
translated: “ As many as there are” is a specification.

original: sman gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sman gyi rigs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sman gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni sman gyi rigs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: “ Medicinal herbs” are included in the class of medicine.

original: sman gyi me tog la sogs pa'i mchog gang dag ji snyed yod pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten dag na rin po che'i rnam pa mchog tu gyur pa gang dag ji snyed yod pa ste /
analyzed: sman gyi me tog la sogs pa'i mchog gang dag ji snyed yod pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten dag na rin po che'i rnam pa mchog tu gyur pa gang dag ji snyed yod pa ste /
translated: Whatever supreme flowers, fruits, and so on of medicinal herbs there are, and likewise, whatever supreme types of jewels there are in the worlds,

original: 'dir 'jig rten zhes bya ba lha la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten zhes bya ba lha la sogs pa ste /
translated: here, the “worlds” are gods and so on.

original: 'jig rten na ji snyed yod pa zhes thams cad la yang sbyar ba'i phyir zlos pa'i tshig tu smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ji snyed yod pa zhes thams cad la yang sbyar ba'i phyir zlos pa'i tshig tu smos pa yin no //
translated: Since “as many as there are in the worlds” is applied to everything, the repetition is stated.

original: gtsang ma yang yin la yid du 'ong ba yang yin pas chu gtsang yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gtsang ma yang yin la yid du 'ong ba yang yin pas chu gtsang yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Since it is both pure and pleasing, it is pure and pleasing water.

original: ri bo ni sa 'dzin no //
analyzed: ri bo ni sa 'dzin no //
translated: A mountain is an earth-holder.

original: dben zhing nyams dga' ba ni dben zhing nyams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dben zhing nyams dga' ba ni dben zhing nyams dga' ba'o //
translated: A secluded and delightful place is one that is secluded and delightful.

original: ljon shing rang gi me tog gis brgyan cing 'bar bar snang ba ni brgyan pas @11a * //
analyzed: ljon shing rang gi me tog gis brgyan cing 'bar bar snang ba ni brgyan pas @11a * //
translated: A tree is a tree that is adorned with its own flowers and appears to be burning with splendor.

original: spud pa'o // de bzhin du shing gang 'bras bu bzang zhing mchog tu gyur pas yal ga dud cing g-yur za ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni shing gang 'bras bzang yal ga dud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spud pa'o // de bzhin du shing gang 'bras bu bzang zhing mchog tu gyur pas yal ga dud cing g-yur za ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni shing gang 'bras bzang yal ga dud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, a tree with excellent fruit is a tree that has the nature of bending down with excellent and supreme fruit.

original: dri ni bzhi po cha mnyam du sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ni bzhi po cha mnyam du sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fragrance is a mixture of the four types of fragrance, and so on.

original: spos ni aa ka ru nag po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spos ni aa ka ru nag po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Incense is black agarwood, and so on.

original: de yang phyogs la sogs pa stong par lha la sogs pas legs par sbyar te btang ba'o //
analyzed: de yang phyogs la sogs pa stong par lha la sogs pas legs par sbyar te btang ba'o //
translated: It is offered to the gods, and so on, in an empty place, and so on.

original: dpag bsam shing ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i shing ngo //
analyzed: dpag bsam shing ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i shing ngo //
translated: A wish-fulfilling tree is a tree that produces the fruits that are desired.🔽 🔽A cow of plenty is a cow that produces whatever is desired.🔽 🔽A wish-fulfilling jewel is a jewel that produces whatever is desired.

original: chu las skyes pa'i me tog padma la sogs pas brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni padmas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: chu las skyes pa'i me tog padma la sogs pas brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni padmas brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with lotuses, etc. , which grow in water.

original: de bzhin du ngang pa'i sgra skad shin tu snyan pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni ngang pa shin tu skad snyan yid 'ong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngang pa'i sgra skad shin tu snyan pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni ngang pa shin tu skad snyan yid 'ong zhes bya'o //
translated: It is endowed with the sweet sounds of geese, which are very pleasant to the mind.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni re re nas brjod par ji tsam zhig nus te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni re re nas brjod par ji tsam zhig nus te /
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to mention each one individually.

original: khyad par can gyi dngos po gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad dbul bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi dngos po gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad dbul bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: Whatever special things there are, all of them should be offered.🔽These flowers, etc. , which are ornaments for the Blessed Buddhas, who are worthy of worship, etc. ,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa mchod par 'os pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rgyan du gyur pa me tog la sogs pa 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa mchod par 'os pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rgyan du gyur pa me tog la sogs pa 'di dag ni /
translated: are offered to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,🔽and to the highest, supreme Bodhisattvas,🔽and to the Pratyekabuddhas and the noble Disciples,🔽and to all the sentient beings,🔽as much as they can be found,

original: nam mkha' rab 'byam khams kyi mthas gtugs pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' rab 'byam khams kyi mthas gtugs pa //
translated: throughout the whole extent of the realm of space.

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ma lus pa khyab par byed pa yongs su gzung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ma lus pa khyab par byed pa yongs su gzung ba med pa ste /
translated: The whole extent of space is taken as the measure.

original: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the northern continent of Kuru.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa de dag kun blo yis blangs shing kun nas bzung nas thub pa skyes bu rnams kyi mchog sras dang bcas pa rnams la legs par dbul ba bgyi zhing 'di dag bdag gis legs par bstab par bya'o //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa de dag kun blo yis blangs shing kun nas bzung nas thub pa skyes bu rnams kyi mchog sras dang bcas pa rnams la legs par dbul ba bgyi zhing 'di dag bdag gis legs par bstab par bya'o //
translated: Having mentally taken up all those wish-fulfilling trees and so on, I will offer them well to the Capable Ones, the best of beings, together with their sons. I will present these to them.🔽Then, you who are the best of those worthy of gifts, endowed with great compassion, having considered me with compassion, please accept all those flowers and so on that I have presented, wherever they may be.

original: de nas yon gnas kyi dam pa thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa khyed rnams kyis bdag la rjes su brtse bar dgongs pas bdag gi me tog la sogs pa gnas gang na gnas pa de dag thams cad bzhes par mdzod cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na
analyzed: de nas yon gnas kyi dam pa thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa khyed rnams kyis bdag la rjes su brtse bar dgongs pas bdag gi me tog la sogs pa gnas gang na gnas pa de dag thams cad bzhes par mdzod cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na
translated: Why is that?

original: / bsod nams mi ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / bsod nams mi ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “devoid of merit,”

original: bsod nams nye bar ma bsags pas so //
analyzed: bsod nams nye bar ma bsags pas so //
translated: because the accumulation of merit is not present.

original: de nyid kyis na bkren chen te shin tu dbul por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bkren chen te shin tu dbul por gyur pa'o //
translated: By that very fact, he is a great pauper, having become extremely poor.

original: de'i phyir mchod pa'i nor du rung ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i me tog la sogs pa las gzhan pa bdag la cang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchod pa'i nor du rung ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i me tog la sogs pa las gzhan pa bdag la cang yang ma mchis so //
translated: Therefore, I have nothing else at all suitable as wealth for worship, other than the flowers and so on that have been explained.

original: de bas na gzhan @11b gyi don la dgongs par mdzad pa'i mgon po khyed kyis me tog la sogs pa 'di rnams rang rang gi gnas na /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan @11b gyi don la dgongs par mdzad pa'i mgon po khyed kyis me tog la sogs pa 'di rnams rang rang gi gnas na /
translated: Therefore, O Protector, you who are intent on the welfare of others, please accept these flowers, etc.,🔽even though they are in their own places,

original: ji lta ba gnas su zin kyang bdag gi blo la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba gnas su zin kyang bdag gi blo la gnas pa ste /
translated: they are in my mind.

original: nyid kyi mthus bzhes par mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi mthus bzhes par mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: Please accept them by your power.

original: dris pa / khyed la rang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa yang yod bzhin du /
analyzed: dris pa / khyed la rang gi bdag nyid la sogs pa yang yod bzhin du /
translated: Question: Even though you have your own self, etc.,

original: bdag la ci yang ma mchis so zhes smra zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la ci yang ma mchis so zhes smra zhe na /
translated: why do you say, “I have nothing at all”?

original: de'i phyir rgyal dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says “the Victorious One,” etc.

original: rgyal ba ni bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: rgyal ba ni bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: The Victorious One is the Buddha who has conquered the four demons.

original: de sras dang bcas pa rnams la bdag gis ni dus gsum gyi dge ba thams cad dang bcas pa dang dngos po thams cad gtan du dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de sras dang bcas pa rnams la bdag gis ni dus gsum gyi dge ba thams cad dang bcas pa dang dngos po thams cad gtan du dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: Together with his sons, I offer everything, together with all virtues of the three times, forever.

original: des na sems dpa'i mchog khyed rnams kyis bdag yongs su bzhes shig / bdag gir mdzod cig / kye sems dpa'i mchog mchog tu gus pas khyed kyi 'bangs su mchi bar bgyi zhing 'bangs kyi dngos po nyid bgyid do zhes pa'o//
analyzed: des na sems dpa'i mchog khyed rnams kyis bdag yongs su bzhes shig / bdag gir mdzod cig / kye sems dpa'i mchog mchog tu gus pas khyed kyi 'bangs su mchi bar bgyi zhing 'bangs kyi dngos po nyid bgyid do zhes pa'o//
translated: O sublime bodhisattvas, with the greatest devotion I offer myself to you as your slave, and I will do whatever a slave has to do.

original: bdag nyid la sogs pa ni sems can thams cad la sbyin par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid la sogs pa ni sems can thams cad la sbyin par byed pa yin la /
translated: I will give myself and all others to all sentient beings.

original: des gdul bya de rnams kyi don ni khyed kyis bya dgos pa yin na /
analyzed: des gdul bya de rnams kyi don ni khyed kyis bya dgos pa yin na /
translated: And since it is you who must accomplish the benefit of those beings to be trained,

original: de bdag cag rnams la ci'i phyir dbul bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de bdag cag rnams la ci'i phyir dbul bar byed ce na /
translated: why do you make me give myself to you?

original: de'i phyir bdag ni khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is why he says, I am yours, etc.

original: bdag khyed kyis yongs su gzung zhing bzhes par mdzad na /
analyzed: bdag khyed kyis yongs su gzung zhing bzhes par mdzad na /
translated: If you accept me, if you take me as yours,🔽I will have no fear or anxiety in samsara and I will be able to work for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: srid pa ste 'khor ba na mi 'jigs shing skrag pa med pas sems can rnams la phan par gyur pa'i don bgyid pa dang / sngon gyi sdig las yang dag 'da' bgyid cing //
analyzed: srid pa ste 'khor ba na mi 'jigs shing skrag pa med pas sems can rnams la phan par gyur pa'i don bgyid pa dang / sngon gyi sdig las yang dag 'da' bgyid cing //
translated: I will purify my evil deeds of the past

original: sdig pa gzhan yang slan chad mi bgyid do //
analyzed: sdig pa gzhan yang slan chad mi bgyid do //
translated: I will not commit any other evil from now on.

original: yang de ltar gyur na chos dang mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pas sems can rnams la phan pa bgyid par rngo thogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang de ltar gyur na chos dang mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pas sems can rnams la phan pa bgyid par rngo thogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if it were like that, I would be able to help sentient beings with the gift of Dharma, the gift of fearlessness, and the gift of material things, but not otherwise.

original: chen po rnams la brten bcas na don chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po rnams la brten bcas na don chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one relies on the great, it becomes a great benefit.

original: gzhan yang khyed rnams kyis bzhed pa'i don ni 'gro ba'i don nyid yin pas khyed rnams la phul bas sems can thams cad la stsal bar gyur pa lags te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed rnams kyis bzhed pa'i don ni 'gro ba'i don nyid yin pas khyed rnams la phul bas sems can thams cad la stsal bar gyur pa lags te /
translated: Moreover, since the purpose that you desire is the benefit of the world, by offering it to you, it becomes offered to all sentient beings.

original: khyed kyi bka' nyid kyis de rnams la yang stsal bar bgyi'o zhes sbyin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi bka' nyid kyis de rnams la yang stsal bar bgyi'o zhes sbyin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: I will give it to them by your very words.

original: yang de'i rkyen du gyur pa dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽khrus kyi khang pa zhes bya ba la sogs @12a * //
analyzed: yang de'i rkyen du gyur pa dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir / khrus kyi khang pa zhes bya ba la sogs @12a * //
translated: In order to teach the conditions for that,

original: pa smos te /
analyzed: pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The bathing house,” and so on.

original: khrus kyi khang pa shin tu dri zhim pa dag ni shel gyi rang bzhin can gyis gzhi kun tu gsal zhing dang sa la 'tsher bag dang bcas pa nyid du bstar zhing byi dor byas pa de ni rin po che sna tshogs 'od zer 'bar ba dang ldan
analyzed: khrus kyi khang pa shin tu dri zhim pa dag ni shel gyi rang bzhin can gyis gzhi kun tu gsal zhing dang sa la 'tsher bag dang bcas pa nyid du bstar zhing byi dor byas pa de ni rin po che sna tshogs 'od zer 'bar ba dang ldan
translated: The bathing house is made of crystal and is very fragrant. The floor is clear and bright, smooth and polished. It is delightful and pleasing, with pillars of various precious gems that shine with radiant light.

original: pa'i ka bas yid du 'ong zhing nyams dga' bar gyur par mu tig gi rgyu las byas pa'i blo re 'od kyi mdangs chags pa bres pa gang yin pa der /
analyzed: pa'i ka bas yid du 'ong zhing nyams dga' bar gyur par mu tig gi rgyu las byas pa'i blo re 'od kyi mdangs chags pa bres pa gang yin pa der /
translated: A canopy of pearls with a radiant luster is spread above.

original: de dag dang de las gzhan pa'i rgyan rnams kyis kyang brgyan pa dag tu /
analyzed: de dag dang de las gzhan pa'i rgyan rnams kyis kyang brgyan pa dag tu /
translated: The bathing house is also adorned with other ornaments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de'i sras rnams la rin po che'i rang bzhin las byas pa'i bum pa grangs mang po du ma dag spos dri zhim po sna tshogs pa dang sbyar ba'i chu yid du 'ong ba dang / me tog gis kyang legs par bkang ba byas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de'i sras rnams la rin po che'i rang bzhin las byas pa'i bum pa grangs mang po du ma dag spos dri zhim po sna tshogs pa dang sbyar ba'i chu yid du 'ong ba dang / me tog gis kyang legs par bkang ba byas pa dang /
translated: In the bathing house, the tathāgatas and their bodhisattva sons fill many precious vases with fragrant water mixed with various sweet-smelling unguents and beautiful flowers.

original: de bzhin du glu snyan pa dang / rol mo snyan pa dang bcas pa du ma dag gis sku khrus gsol bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du glu snyan pa dang / rol mo snyan pa dang bcas pa du ma dag gis sku khrus gsol bar bgyi'o //
translated: In the same way, with many sweet songs and sweet music, I shall bathe their bodies.

original: de nas de'i rjes la khrus gsol ba de dag gi sku la na bza'i rnam pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gos gtsang zhing dri zhim po'i bdug pas rab tu bsgos shing bdug pas mdzes par bya ba'i phyir sku phyi bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes la khrus gsol ba de dag gi sku la na bza'i rnam pa mtshungs pa med pa'i gos gtsang zhing dri zhim po'i bdug pas rab tu bsgos shing bdug pas mdzes par bya ba'i phyir sku phyi bar bgyi'o //
translated: Then, after that bathing, in order to beautify their bodies, I shall dry them with unmatched garments, with clothes perfumed with sweet-smelling incense.

original: de nas ni de dag la kha dog tshon gyis legs par bsgyur zhing mdzes par bya ba dang / dri shin tu zhim pos bsgos pa'i na bza' dam pa bdag gis dbul ba 'am dbul du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ni de dag la kha dog tshon gyis legs par bsgyur zhing mdzes par bya ba dang / dri shin tu zhim pos bsgos pa'i na bza' dam pa bdag gis dbul ba 'am dbul du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, I shall offer them excellent garments, well-dyed and beautiful, and perfumed with very sweet scents, either by myself or by having others offer them.

original: na bza' dag la dri dang spos kyis bsgos shing byugs pa ni rgyan dang 'dra bar dregs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: na bza' dag la dri dang spos kyis bsgos shing byugs pa ni rgyan dang 'dra bar dregs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bkag pa yin la /
translated: The prohibition is because anointing and applying scents and incense to the garments is a cause of pride, like ornaments.

original: chos kyi bdag po yang rang nyid la gnas par mdzad pas slob ma rnams rjes su 'jug cing slob par mdzad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag po yang rang nyid la gnas par mdzad pas slob ma rnams rjes su 'jug cing slob par mdzad pa ma yin nam /
translated: And since the Lord of Dharma himself abides in them, are not disciples engaged in following and learning from him?

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: dad pas byin pa'i spos dang me tog la sogs pas mig la phan pa la sogs pa'i blos de la spyod par ni mngon sum snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dad pas byin pa'i spos dang me tog la sogs pas mig la phan pa la sogs pa'i blos de la spyod par ni mngon sum snang ba yin gyi /
translated: it is evident that he uses the incense, flowers, etc., given in faith with the thought of benefiting his eyes, etc.

original: brgyan pa 'am chags pa'i blos ni ma yin la /
analyzed: brgyan pa 'am chags pa'i blos ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not with the thought of adornment or attachment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la sogs pa la ni de ltar byas pa nyid kyang nyes pa yod pa ma yin pas brtsad pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la sogs pa la ni de ltar byas pa nyid kyang nyes pa yod pa ma yin pas brtsad pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: And since there is no fault in doing this with a buddha image, etc., what is the point of arguing?🔽The bodhisattvas who are householders wear fine clothes, as fine as those of the gods in the higher realms, various and thin, with many colors, and they are beautiful.

original: khyim pa'i rtags can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gos bzang po mtho ris na lha la yod pa lta bu srab cing shin tu phra ba sna tshogs shing kha dog du mas @12b nye bar bsgyur bas mdzes pa gang yin pa de ni srab la 'jam
analyzed: khyim pa'i rtags can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gos bzang po mtho ris na lha la yod pa lta bu srab cing shin tu phra ba sna tshogs shing kha dog du mas @12b nye bar bsgyur bas mdzes pa gang yin pa de ni srab la 'jam
translated: They are thin and soft,

original: pa sna tshogs mdzes //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa sna tshogs mdzes //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: various and beautiful.

original: de lta bu'i na bza' dang rgyan mchog brgya phrag de dang de dag gis zhes bya ba gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / snyan cha dang / cod pa na la sogs pa bzang po rnams kyis ma pham pa la sogs pa la mchod cing brgyan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i na bza' dang rgyan mchog brgya phrag de dang de dag gis zhes bya ba gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / snyan cha dang / cod pa na la sogs pa bzang po rnams kyis ma pham pa la sogs pa la mchod cing brgyan par bgyi'o //
translated: With such and such hundreds of excellent garments and ornaments, such as bracelets, armlets, earrings, and diadems, I worship and adorn Manjushri and so forth.

original: de la ma pham pa ni bdud thams cad kyis pham par mi nus pas nam pham pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma pham pa ni bdud thams cad kyis pham par mi nus pas nam pham pa ste /
translated: Among them, Manjushri is called invincible because all maras are unable to defeat him.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'o //
translated: He is the noble Maitreya.

original: kun nas bzang bas na kun tu bzang po ste /
analyzed: kun nas bzang bas na kun tu bzang po ste /
translated: Because he is completely good, he is Samantabhadra.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no //
translated: He is a bodhisattva.

original: 'jam zhing snyan pa'i dbyangs mnga' zhing byis pa 'dra bas na 'jam dbyangs so //
analyzed: 'jam zhing snyan pa'i dbyangs mnga' zhing byis pa 'dra bas na 'jam dbyangs so //
translated: He is Manjushri because he has a gentle and melodious voice and resembles a child.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi dbang phyug bzang ba yin zhing de'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa rnams la spyan ras kyis 'tsho zhing gzigs par mdzad pas na 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi dbang phyug bzang ba yin zhing de'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i phyir dang / 'gro ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa rnams la spyan ras kyis 'tsho zhing gzigs par mdzad pas na 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
translated: He is Avalokiteshvara because he is the excellent lord of all worlds and resembles him, and because he looks upon and cares for beings who are suffering.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
translated: It is the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa bsdu ste /
translated: The word “etc.” includes Vajrapāṇi and so on.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus:

original: mi pham kun tu bzang dang 'jam dbyangs dang // 'jig rten dbang phyug sogs la 'ang brgyan par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi pham kun tu bzang dang 'jam dbyangs dang // 'jig rten dbang phyug sogs la 'ang brgyan par bgyi // zhes bya ste /
translated: I also adorn Ajita, Samantabhadra, Mañjughoṣa, Lokanātha, and so on.

original: de rnams ni gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas khyim pa'i rtags 'dzin par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas khyim pa'i rtags 'dzin par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: These are the ones who, in accordance with the needs of those to be trained, take on the appearance of householders.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras gdul bya'i dbang gis sangs rgyas de lta bur ston par mdzad pa la yang brgyan par bgyi'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras gdul bya'i dbang gis sangs rgyas de lta bur ston par mdzad pa la yang brgyan par bgyi'o zhes ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that I also adorn those who, in accordance with the needs of those to be trained, manifest as buddhas.

original: gling bzhi pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa re re zhing stong stong yod pa la ni stong spyi phud ces bya'o //🔽de stong la ni stong gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa re re zhing stong stong yod pa la ni stong spyi phud ces bya'o // de stong la ni stong gnyis pa'o //
translated: A set of one thousand of each of the four continents, the sun, the moon, and so on is called a chiliocosm.🔽A set of one thousand of those is called a dichiliocosm.

original: stong gnyis pa stong la ni stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams te /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa stong la ni stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams te /
translated: A set of one thousand of those is called a trichiliocosm.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig yin la zhing rnams la ni phyogs bcu dag tu mtha' yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig yin la zhing rnams la ni phyogs bcu dag tu mtha' yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is the buddhafield of a single buddha, but the buddhafields are not limited to the ten directions.

original: stong gsum de thams cad du dri'i dad ldang zhing 'gro ba khyab par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni /🔽stong gsum kun tu ri dang ldang ba yi //
analyzed: stong gsum de thams cad du dri'i dad ldang zhing 'gro ba khyab par 'byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni / stong gsum kun tu ri dang ldang ba yi //
translated: It has the nature of the fragrance of incense pervading and arising throughout all of the trichiliocosm.🔽The one who has that nature is called

original: dri mchog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dri mchog ces bya ba ste /
translated: The supreme fragrance pervading the trichiliocosm.🔽With those, we anoint the bodies of all the lords of sages,

original: de rnams kyis thub dbang kun gyi sku zhes bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku la byug par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis thub dbang kun gyi sku zhes bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku la byug par bgyi'o //
translated: that is, the bodies of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: ji lta bu'i sku la byug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i sku la byug par bya zhe na /
translated: With what kind of body do we anoint?

original: thub pa rnams kyi @13a * //
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyi @13a * //
translated: The bodies of the sages

original: sku gang yin pa de gser de mdog bzangs ksha ra dang / sa'i skyong du kha sbyar nang du legs par bsregs shing btsos la shin tu sbyangs shing dag par byas nas byi dor byas te phyis pa lta bu'i 'od chags shing shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa de dag la bdag nyid rang gis byug par bgyi pa 'am gzhan
analyzed: sku gang yin pa de gser de mdog bzangs ksha ra dang / sa'i skyong du kha sbyar nang du legs par bsregs shing btsos la shin tu sbyangs shing dag par byas nas byi dor byas te phyis pa lta bu'i 'od chags shing shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa de dag la bdag nyid rang gis byug par bgyi pa 'am gzhan
translated: The body, which is like gold, is anointed with the finest perfumes, such as the fragrant resin called kashara and the resin called earth protector, which are well burned, well cooked, well refined, well purified, well polished, and well applied.

original: dag nye bar byug tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dag nye bar byug tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should do this oneself or have others do it.

original: gzhan yang thub pa'i dbang po mchog mchod par bya ba'i gnas kyi mchog la dri dang dbyibs la sogs pa yid du 'ong pa'i me tog lha yul na yod pa'i me tog dri zhim pa mand'a ra ba zhes bya ba dang / padma dang / autpala la sogs pa zhes bya ba de dag thog mar gyur pa sna ma dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang thub pa'i dbang po mchog mchod par bya ba'i gnas kyi mchog la dri dang dbyibs la sogs pa yid du 'ong pa'i me tog lha yul na yod pa'i me tog dri zhim pa mand'a ra ba zhes bya ba dang / padma dang / autpala la sogs pa zhes bya ba de dag thog mar gyur pa sna ma dang /
translated: One should also offer to the supreme among the lords of sages, the supreme object of offering, flowers that are pleasing in their color, shape, and so forth. These include the divine flowers that grow in the celestial realms, such as the fragrant flowers called mandara, lotus, and utpala, as well as the earthly flowers such as jasmine,

original: tsam pa dang / n'a ga ge sar la sogs pa'i me tog gang yin pa de thams cad kyis thub pa'i dbang po la mchod pa dang / phreng bas kyang mchod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: tsam pa dang / n'a ga ge sar la sogs pa'i me tog gang yin pa de thams cad kyis thub pa'i dbang po la mchod pa dang / phreng bas kyang mchod par bgyi'o //
translated: All flowers, such as champak, jasmine, and so on, are offered to the Lord of Sages, and also garlands.

original: ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: ji lta bus she na /
translated: With what kind?

original: spel legs yid 'ong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: spel legs yid 'ong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: With well-arranged, pleasing ones.

original: sna tshogs pa spel legs par byas pas dbyibs yid du 'ong zhing snying du sdug par gyur pa rnams kyis mchod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa spel legs par byas pas dbyibs yid du 'ong zhing snying du sdug par gyur pa rnams kyis mchod par bgyi'o //
translated: With various well-arranged shapes, pleasing and delightful, they are offered.

original: de bzhin du spos kyi dri'i ngad kyis 'gro ba thams cad khyab par byed pas rgya cher spros par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spos kyi dri'i ngad kyis 'gro ba thams cad khyab par byed pas rgya cher spros par gyur pa ste /
translated: Likewise, with the fragrance of incense pervading all beings, it becomes vast.

original: de nyid kyis ni yid du 'ong bas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni yid du 'ong bas /
translated: By that very thing, it is pleasing.

original: spos mchog yid 'phrog dri ngad khyab pa yi //
analyzed: spos mchog yid 'phrog dri ngad khyab pa yi //
translated: The supreme fragrance, captivating, pervades with scent.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta bu'i bdug pa'i sprin tshogs zhes bdug spos kyi tshogs rnams kyis thub pa'i dbang po de la dbul bar bgyi zhing bdug par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdug pa'i sprin tshogs zhes bdug spos kyi tshogs rnams kyis thub pa'i dbang po de la dbul bar bgyi zhing bdug par bgyi'o //
translated: With such a cloud of incense, with a collection of incense, that is offered to the Lord of Sages, it is offered as incense.

original: de bzhin du zhal zas kyi rnam pa 'bras chan la sogs pa dang / kha ra dkar po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa dang bcas pa dang / btung ba yid du 'ong ba dang / rgya star gyi 'bras bu'i khu ba la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i lha bshos rnams kyang thub pa de rnams la dbul bar bgyi zhing bstab par bgyi'o //🔽de bzhin du mar me'i rnam pa gser gyi padma rnams la tshar du dngar nas gnas pa'i rin po che sgron ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal zas kyi rnam pa 'bras chan la sogs pa dang / kha ra dkar po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa dang bcas pa dang / btung ba yid du 'ong ba dang / rgya star gyi 'bras bu'i khu ba la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i lha bshos rnams kyang thub pa de rnams la dbul bar bgyi zhing bstab par bgyi'o // de bzhin du mar me'i rnam pa gser gyi padma rnams la tshar du dngar nas gnas pa'i rin po che sgron ma ste /
translated: Likewise, I offer to those Sages various kinds of food, such as rice, and various kinds of sweets, such as white sugar, and various kinds of drinks, such as the juice of the tamarind fruit.🔽Likewise, I offer to them lamps, such as golden lotuses, which are arranged in rows and are jeweled lamps,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che la sogs pa gsal zhing snang bar byed pa rnams kyang de rnams la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che la sogs pa gsal zhing snang bar byed pa rnams kyang de rnams la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: which are clear and shining, such as wish-fulfilling jewels.

original: gzhan yang sa gzhi legs par bstar zhing byi dor byas pa dri zhim pas nye bar byugs pa gang yin pa der me tog gi sil ma kha dog dang dbyibs @13b sna tshogs pa yid du 'ong bas spel ba dgram zhing dgod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sa gzhi legs par bstar zhing byi dor byas pa dri zhim pas nye bar byugs pa gang yin pa der me tog gi sil ma kha dog dang dbyibs @13b sna tshogs pa yid du 'ong bas spel ba dgram zhing dgod par bgyi'o //
translated: Furthermore, in that place, the ground should be well swept and anointed with sweet scents, and strewn with various colored flower petals.

original: gzhal yas khang gi khyad par dbul ba ni sngar phul ba'i gzhal yas khang gi khyad par gyi tshogs kyi sprin mang po la de na gnas pa'i lha'i bu mo rnams kyis sbyar zhing nye bar blangs pa'i bstod pa dang / glu shin tu yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa dang ldan pa dang /🔽gzhan yang mu tig dang / nor bu rnams kyi chun 'phyang gis de la mdzes par byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang gi khyad par dbul ba ni sngar phul ba'i gzhal yas khang gi khyad par gyi tshogs kyi sprin mang po la de na gnas pa'i lha'i bu mo rnams kyis sbyar zhing nye bar blangs pa'i bstod pa dang / glu shin tu yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa dang ldan pa dang / gzhan yang mu tig dang / nor bu rnams kyi chun 'phyang gis de la mdzes par byas pa 'am /
translated: The special celestial mansion is offered by the many clouds of offerings of the special celestial mansion that was previously offered, with the goddesses who reside there singing and praising with very beautiful and melodious songs.🔽Furthermore, it is beautified with garlands of pearls and jewels.

original: des mdzes par byas pas mu tig chun 'phyang mdzes pa 'bar //
analyzed: des mdzes par byas pas mu tig chun 'phyang mdzes pa 'bar //
translated: Or, it is beautified by that, so the garland of pearls is beautiful and blazing.

original: zhes bya ba la de dag thams cad kun nas 'bar zhing 'od dang ldan pa dang / rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bla re la sogs pa 'od dang bcas shing snang ba'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis phyogs bcu pa thams cad kyi mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' brgyan cing 'od kyis khyab par gyur la de dag kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de dag thams cad kun nas 'bar zhing 'od dang ldan pa dang / rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bla re la sogs pa 'od dang bcas shing snang ba'i rang bzhin can rnams kyis phyogs bcu pa thams cad kyi mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' brgyan cing 'od kyis khyab par gyur la de dag kyang /
translated: All of them are blazing and radiant, and with jeweled parasols, banners, flags, canopies, and so on, which are radiant and luminous by nature, the infinite space of the ten directions is adorned and pervaded by light.

original: byams pa chen po'i rang bzhin can byams pa chen po gang la goms shing mngon du mdzad pa rnams la khyab par dbul ba ste /
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i rang bzhin can byams pa chen po gang la goms shing mngon du mdzad pa rnams la khyab par dbul ba ste /
translated: And they are offered to those who are habituated to and actualize great love, which is by nature great love.

original: sems can thams cad la phan zhing bde bar 'dod pas bsdus pa ni byams pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan zhing bde bar 'dod pas bsdus pa ni byams pa ste /
translated: Love is the desire to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings.

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyi thub pa rnams la bstab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyi thub pa rnams la bstab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are offered to the sages who are by nature love.

original: gzhan yang gdugs kyi mchod pa ni gang 'di rin po che'i rgyu las byas pa'i gdugs sdug cing yid du 'ong bas mdzes par gyur pa de ni rin chen gdugs mdzes zhes bya ba yang de'i khyad par ni gser gyi yu ba can du byas pas nye bar
analyzed: gzhan yang gdugs kyi mchod pa ni gang 'di rin po che'i rgyu las byas pa'i gdugs sdug cing yid du 'ong bas mdzes par gyur pa de ni rin chen gdugs mdzes zhes bya ba yang de'i khyad par ni gser gyi yu ba can du byas pas nye bar
translated: Its particular features are indicated by the golden handle,🔽adorned with beautiful ornaments such as strings of pearls all around,

original: mtshon pa dang / khor khor yug tu mu tig gi rgyan gyi rnam pa la sogs pa yid du 'ong ba btags pas brgyan cing mdzes pa dang / dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug par snang ba de gyen du bsgreng ba 'di yang rtag tu thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyi thad du bzung la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa dang / khor khor yug tu mu tig gi rgyan gyi rnam pa la sogs pa yid du 'ong ba btags pas brgyan cing mdzes pa dang / dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug par snang ba de gyen du bsgreng ba 'di yang rtag tu thub pa'i dbang po rnams kyi thad du bzung la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and its shape is good, appearing pleasing to the eye. This is raised up and always held in front of the Lords of Sages.

original: de ltar mchod pa'i dbye ba phyogs tsam zhig smras nas /
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa'i dbye ba phyogs tsam zhig smras nas /
translated: Having spoken a mere fraction of the divisions of offerings in this way,

original: gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas spyir mchod pa'i sprin ji snyed pa so sor gnas pa 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas spyir mchod pa'i sprin ji snyed pa so sor gnas pa 'byung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: fearing excessive length, in general, in order to teach that as many offering clouds as there are exist individually,

original: de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: mchod pa'i las kyi rten du gyur pa de dag las mchog ste /🔽snga ma las phul du byung ba nyid du so sor gnas shing 'byung bar byin gyis @14a * //
analyzed: mchod pa'i las kyi rten du gyur pa de dag las mchog ste / snga ma las phul du byung ba nyid du so sor gnas shing 'byung bar byin gyis @14a * //
translated: Among those which are the basis of the activity of worship, may the best,

original: rlob par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: rlob par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: the most excellent, be individually present and arise, blessed.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

original: mchod pa'i tshogs te mchod pa'i sprin gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i tshogs te mchod pa'i sprin gyi phung po'o //
translated: The collection of worship, the mass of the cloud of worship.

original: rol mo ni rnga bo che la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rol mo ni rnga bo che la sogs pa'o //
translated: Music is the great drum, etc.

original: dbyangs snyan pa ni rdza rnga la sogs pa'i rol mo dang / gar dang bcas pa'i dbyangs snyan pa'i glu len pa yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: dbyangs snyan pa ni rdza rnga la sogs pa'i rol mo dang / gar dang bcas pa'i dbyangs snyan pa'i glu len pa yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: Sweet song is the sweet song of the drum, etc., with dance, which is pleasing to the mind.

original: de rnams kyis sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyang tshim par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyang tshim par byed pa nyid do //
translated: By those, may the suffering sentient beings be satisfied.

original: dam pa ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: dam pa ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: The holy one is the Buddha.

original: de'i chos ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i chos ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: His Dharma is the nature of scripture and realization.

original: de ni dkon mchog yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa nyid thob kyang rnyed dka' ba dang / don che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dkon mchog yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang 'dra bar dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa nyid thob kyang rnyed dka' ba dang / don che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the precious wish-fulfilling jewel of the Three Jewels, for it is difficult to obtain even when one has attained the perfect endowment of leisure and opportunity, and it is of great benefit.

original: dam chos dkon mchog kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: dam chos dkon mchog kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The jewel of the holy Dharma is the best of all, and so it is called the best of all jewels.

original: dam pa'i chos dkon mchog de la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dkon mchog de la /
translated: With regard to that jewel of the holy Dharma,

original: de'i glegs bam la sogs pa mchod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa dang / de'i glegs bam la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'am sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung chud par byas pa'i mchod rten rnams dang / sku gzugs rnams la rin po che dang / me tog la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i char rgyun mi 'chad cing bar mtshams med pa nyid du 'bab par shog cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i glegs bam la sogs pa mchod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa dang / de'i glegs bam la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'am sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung chud par byas pa'i mchod rten rnams dang / sku gzugs rnams la rin po che dang / me tog la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i char rgyun mi 'chad cing bar mtshams med pa nyid du 'bab par shog cig ces pa'o //
translated: one should make offerings to it in the form of offering its texts and so on, and one should make offerings to those who possess its texts and so on, or to stupas that contain relics of the Buddha, or to images of the Buddha, with precious substances, flowers and so on, and one should pray that a rain of such offerings should fall continuously and uninterruptedly.

original: de ltar bla na yod pa dang bcas pa'i mchod pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bla na yod pa dang bcas pa'i mchod pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the offerings that are surpassed,

original: bla na med pa'i mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the unsurpassable offerings,🔽it says:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse beginning just as and so on.

original: bgrod par bya ba ji snyed pa thugs su chud pas na /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ji snyed pa thugs su chud pas na /
translated: Since he has understood the full extent of what is to be traversed,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: he is the Tathagata,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: the perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: bstod pa bshad pa ni yon tan rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
