analyzed: bstod pa bshad pa ni yon tan rgya mtsho zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the praise is stated in I praise those who have an ocean of qualities and so on.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag ni so ring zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga po re re zhing yang yan lag ni dbye ba mtha' yas pa yod pas rgya mtsho ji snyed pa gang ba'i bstod pa'i tshogs rnams kyis /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag ni so ring zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga po re re zhing yang yan lag ni dbye ba mtha' yas pa yod pas rgya mtsho ji snyed pa gang ba'i bstod pa'i tshogs rnams kyis /
translated: The aspects of melodiousness are the five beginning with long vowels and so on. Since each of them has an infinite number of divisions, the collection of praises that fill the ocean of melodiousness,

original: yon tan rgya mtsho de snyed mnga' ba rnams la bdag gis bstod pa bgyi'o zhes pa'o //🔽bstod pa'i byin gyis brlab pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho de snyed mnga' ba rnams la bdag gis bstod pa bgyi'o zhes pa'o // bstod pa'i byin gyis brlab pa smras pa ni /
translated: I praise those who have an ocean of qualities.

original: bstod dbyangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bstod dbyangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The statement of the blessing of praise is stated in the cloud of melodious praises and so on.

original: bstod pa'i dbyangs glur yang dag par blangs pa'i tshogs ni bstod dbyangs snyan pa'i sprin te /
analyzed: bstod pa'i dbyangs glur yang dag par blangs pa'i tshogs ni bstod dbyangs snyan pa'i sprin te /
translated: The collection of praises that are sung in melodious tones is the cloud of melodious praises.

original: de dag kyang yon tan rgya mtsho dang @14b ldan pa'i spyan sngar nges par kun du 'byung ba 'am rnam pa thams cad du 'byung bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang yon tan rgya mtsho dang @14b ldan pa'i spyan sngar nges par kun du 'byung ba 'am rnam pa thams cad du 'byung bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May they all arise or occur in every way in the presence of those who possess an ocean of good qualities.

original: phyag 'tshal ba smras pa ni /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba smras pa ni /
translated: The homage is stated

original: dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: in the verse beginning with “All the buddhas who have gone in the three times.🔽”

original: dus gsum gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kun //
analyzed: dus gsum gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kun //
translated: All the buddhas who have gone in the three times

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum po'i spyir bsdus pa ni dus gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum po'i spyir bsdus pa ni dus gsum ste /
translated: means that the three times, past and so on, are included in the general category of the three times.

original: de dag tu gshegs shing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag tu gshegs shing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: They have gone and abide in those.

original: su zhig ce na /
analyzed: su zhig ce na /
translated: Who are they?

original: sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas te /
translated: The buddhas.

original: shes bya mthar thug pa med na yang ye shes mtha' yas pa'i stobs mnga' ba nyid kyis na /
analyzed: shes bya mthar thug pa med na yang ye shes mtha' yas pa'i stobs mnga' ba nyid kyis na /
translated: Even though objects of knowledge are not ultimately exhausted, they possess the power of infinite wisdom.

original: shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus pa khyab par mdzad pa'i blo gang la mnga' ba de ni sangs rgyas te de rnams kun la'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus pa khyab par mdzad pa'i blo gang la mnga' ba de ni sangs rgyas te de rnams kun la'o //
translated: Therefore, the buddhas are those who have the mind that pervades the entire sphere of objects of knowledge.

original: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /🔽chos dang tshogs kyi mchog bcas la //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / chos dang tshogs kyi mchog bcas la //
translated: Not only that,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: but also the Dharma and the supreme assembly.

original: dam pa'i chos dang tshogs kyi mchog dang bcas pa ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / gang zag chen po brgyad la sogs pa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs snyed kyi lus thams cad kyis rab tu btud pas ni bdag phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang tshogs kyi mchog dang bcas pa ni lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / gang zag chen po brgyad la sogs pa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs snyed kyi lus thams cad kyis rab tu btud pas ni bdag phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
translated: Together with the supreme assembly of the holy Dharma, which is the essence of the scriptures and realizations, and together with the Sangha of the eight great beings and so forth, with all my bodies as numerous as the atoms in all buddhafields, I bow down.

original: gzhan yang phyag bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhi sku'i gzugs brnyan rnams dang / bang rim dang / bum pa dang / kha khyer dang / srog shing dang / 'khor lo dang / gdugs la sogs pa'i gzugs so phag la sogs pa las brtsigs shing bsags pa las bsgrubs pa nyid ni mchod rten no //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyag bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzhi sku'i gzugs brnyan rnams dang / bang rim dang / bum pa dang / kha khyer dang / srog shing dang / 'khor lo dang / gdugs la sogs pa'i gzugs so phag la sogs pa las brtsigs shing bsags pa las bsgrubs pa nyid ni mchod rten no //
translated: Moreover, the objects of homage are the bases, the images of the bodies of the bodhisattvas, and the stupas, which are constructed from bricks, vases, ledges, life-wood, wheels, parasols, and so forth.

original: mchod rten de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa'i snying po dang ldan par byas pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi rten ni 'di la phyag bya ba la sogs pas bsod nams bskyed pa'i don du byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas de
analyzed: mchod rten de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa'i snying po dang ldan par byas pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi rten ni 'di la phyag bya ba la sogs pas bsod nams bskyed pa'i don du byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas de
translated: Therefore,

original: la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: one should prostrate to it.

original: 'dir phyag 'tshal ba'i sgra'i don ni yan lag gi dam pa sa la btud pa yin pa /
analyzed: 'dir phyag 'tshal ba'i sgra'i don ni yan lag gi dam pa sa la btud pa yin pa /
translated: Here, the meaning of the word “prostration” is bowing with the best of limbs to the ground.

original: yan lag gi dam pa yang mgo bo yin pas de btud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag gi dam pa yang mgo bo yin pas de btud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the best of limbs is the head, the meaning is “bowing that.”

original: ched du song ste 'di las lung nod pas na mkhan po'o //
analyzed: ched du song ste 'di las lung nod pas na mkhan po'o //
translated: Since one goes forth to them and receives the scriptures from them, they are preceptors.

original: thar pa'i don du 'bad cing brtsal bas na brtul zhugs can te /
analyzed: thar pa'i don du 'bad cing brtsal bas na brtul zhugs can te /
translated: Since they strive and seek the meaning of liberation, they are ascetics.

original: de dag mngon du dmigs nas phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //🔽@15a * // de bzhin du skyabs su 'gro ba smras pa ni /
analyzed: de dag mngon du dmigs nas phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o // @15a * // de bzhin du skyabs su 'gro ba smras pa ni /
translated: Having observed them, one should prostrate to them.

original: byang chub snying por zhes pa la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub snying por zhes pa la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, the statement of going for refuge is stated by “to the essence of enlightenment” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddhas.

original: ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: byang chub snying por mchis kyi bar //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub snying por mchis kyi bar // zhes bya ste /
translated: Until I reach the essence of enlightenment.

original: snying por gyur pa byang chub kyi mchog thob kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: snying por gyur pa byang chub kyi mchog thob kyi bar du'o //
translated: The essence is the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Dharma is nirvana.

original: de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: I go for refuge to that.

original: tshogs la'ang de bzhin skyabs su mchi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshogs la'ang de bzhin skyabs su mchi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: And likewise to the host of Bodhisattvas.🔽Here, the host of Bodhisattvas is the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: sngar bde ba'i 'byung gnas de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa rnams la dad pa skyes pa'i shugs kyis de skad smras pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar bde ba'i 'byung gnas de la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa rnams la dad pa skyes pa'i shugs kyis de skad smras pa yin la /
translated: Previously, I go for refuge to that, the source of happiness, means that one speaks thus through the force of faith in those who have generated the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: da ltar ni sdom pa len pa'i don du skyabs su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni sdom pa len pa'i don du skyabs su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: But now, one goes for refuge in order to take the vow.

original: sdig pa bshags pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the confession of evil deeds, he says:

original: phyogs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In all directions, etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs par kun la sangs rgyas pas na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs par kun la sangs rgyas pas na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the perfect Buddha because he is enlightened in all aspects.

original: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las kun du gdon par bzhed pa nyid ni thugs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las kun du gdon par bzhed pa nyid ni thugs te /
translated: His mind is the desire to deliver all beings from suffering and the causes of suffering.

original: des gzhan gyi don du spyod par mdzad pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid brnyes par gyur pas na /
analyzed: des gzhan gyi don du spyod par mdzad pas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa nyid brnyes par gyur pas na /
translated: He has attained the perfection of the welfare of others because he acts for the welfare of others.

original: thugs rje chen po mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po mnga' ba ste /
translated: He is the one who possesses great compassion.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang thal mo sbyar te gsol bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang thal mo sbyar te gsol bar bgyi'o //
translated: I join my palms in reverence and make requests to such bodhisattvas.

original: thog ma med ldan zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par skye ba dang / gtso bo las skye bar 'dod pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i phyir 'khor ba ni thog ma med par bstan pa yin te /🔽'khor ba la thog ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thog ma med ldan zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par skye ba dang / gtso bo las skye bar 'dod pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i phyir 'khor ba ni thog ma med par bstan pa yin te / 'khor ba la thog ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: As for the line “endowed with no beginning,” this teaches that cyclic existence has no beginning in order to refute the belief that it arises without a cause or that it arises from a primal cause.🔽Cyclic existence has no beginning.

original: thog ma med ldan 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: thog ma med ldan 'khor ba ste //
translated: Cyclic existence is endowed with no beginning.

original: des na tshe rabs 'di 'am sngon gyi skye ba gzhan dag la gang bdag gis ma 'tshal zhing phyugs ltar rmongs pas sdig pa'i rnam pa bdag nyid kyis bgyis pa 'am /
analyzed: des na tshe rabs 'di 'am sngon gyi skye ba gzhan dag la gang bdag gis ma 'tshal zhing phyugs ltar rmongs pas sdig pa'i rnam pa bdag nyid kyis bgyis pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, in this life or in other lives, whatever negative actions I have done out of ignorance, like an animal,🔽

original: gzhan bgyid du stsal ba nyid dang / rjes su yi rang ba gang bgyis pa ci yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan bgyid du stsal ba nyid dang / rjes su yi rang ba gang bgyis pa ci yang rung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever I have done myself, or caused others to do, or have rejoiced in, in this life or in other lives, by the power of ignorance, like an animal.

original: de ci'i phyir de ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de ltar byed ce na /
translated: Why do I do this?

original: gti mug 'khrul pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gti mug 'khrul pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “through the delusion of confusion.

original: de'i 'bras bu mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mi shes pa'o //
translated: ” I do not know the result of that.

original: ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What will happen?

original: bdag non te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag non te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “I will be tormented.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” Because I will be dwelling in the realms of hell and so on.

original: de ltar khyed kyi dka' ba las 'das @15b pa'i nongs pa de ni rjes su 'gyod pa'i sgo nas de'i nyes pa mthong bar bgyis nas bsam pa thag pas yang dag par bshags par bgyid do //
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyi dka' ba las 'das @15b pa'i nongs pa de ni rjes su 'gyod pa'i sgo nas de'i nyes pa mthong bar bgyis nas bsam pa thag pas yang dag par bshags par bgyid do //
translated: Thus, I confess with a sincere mind, having seen the fault of that, through subsequent regret, that offense which is beyond your patience.

original: de ltar byas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar byas pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bshad nas /
translated: In this way, and in other ways, the Buddha taught.🔽

original: yul dang bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i dbye bas de bshags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i dbye bas de bshags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained in this way, in order to demonstrate the confession of those [sins] by way of the distinctions of object, attitude, and application,

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “I confess all the vile actions I have done,” and so on.

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa spyad pa mthar thug pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa spyad pa mthar thug pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha, which arises from the culmination of the practice of the conduct of enlightenment, is the Buddha.

original: de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa ni 'dir de'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du skye ba med pa ni 'dir de'i chos yin no //
translated: The non-arising of reality is here his Dharma.

original: de mthong ba ni dge 'dun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de mthong ba ni dge 'dun zhes bya ste /
translated: The seeing of that is called the Saṅgha.

original: 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'i kun rdzob kyi dkon mchog gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa'i kun rdzob kyi dkon mchog gsum mo //
translated: This is the conventional Three Jewels of realization.

original: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi sku sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa de'i sku'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi sku sgyu ma lta bur bstan pa de'i sku'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The conventional of the world is the Buddha, who is the illusory manifestation of the Buddha’s form body. His image and so on are the Dharma.

original: gzhi de las byung ba'i de'i lung gi glegs bam la sogs pa ni chos so //
analyzed: gzhi de las byung ba'i de'i lung gi glegs bam la sogs pa ni chos so //
translated: The books of his scriptures and so on that arise from that basis are the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong gzhi'i tshogs la sogs pa'i 'dus pa ni dge 'dun yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gzhi'i tshogs la sogs pa'i 'dus pa ni dge 'dun yin no //
translated: The Sangha is the assembly of monks, nuns, and so forth.

original: 'dir mngon par rtogs pa'i dkon mchog gsum la ni gnod par bya bar nus pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir mngon par rtogs pa'i dkon mchog gsum la ni gnod par bya bar nus pa ma yin pas /
translated: Here, the three jewels of realization cannot be harmed.

original: dkon mchog gsum po cig shos kyi yul la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po cig shos kyi yul la /
translated: But the other three jewels can be harmed

original: shas che ba'i sems kyis gnod pa bgyis pa'am /
analyzed: shas che ba'i sems kyis gnod pa bgyis pa'am /
translated: by a mind that is predominantly nonvirtuous.

original: pha ma dag gam /🔽bla ma ste /
analyzed: pha ma dag gam / bla ma ste /
translated: Or, you can harm your parents🔽or your gurus

original: mkhan po dang / slob dpon la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: mkhan po dang / slob dpon la sogs pa'am /
translated: such as your abbot or ordination master.

original: gzhan gang yang rung ba dag la nyon mongs kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ba dag la nyon mongs kyi sgo nas te /
translated: Or, you can harm anyone else through the afflictions.🔽Whatever harm I have done with a harmful attitude🔽through the actions of my body, speech, or mind,

original: gnod pa'i bsam pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyis gnod pa bgyis pa gang lags pa dang / mdor na /🔽nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags pa'i //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bsam pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can gyis gnod pa bgyis pa gang lags pa dang / mdor na / nyes pa du ma'i skyon chags pa'i //
translated: and in brief

original: sdig can bdag gis sdig pa gang //
analyzed: sdig can bdag gis sdig pa gang //
translated: whatever sins I have committed

original: shin tu mi bzad bgyis pa de //
analyzed: shin tu mi bzad bgyis pa de //
translated: with the fault of many downfalls,

original: thams cad 'dren pa rnams la 'chags //
analyzed: thams cad 'dren pa rnams la 'chags //
translated: all of that I confess in the presence of the leaders.

original: zhes bya ba spyir bsdus te bshags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba spyir bsdus te bshags pa'o //
translated: This is the general confession.

original: ci'i phyir 'bad pas 'chags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bad pas 'chags she na /
translated: Why do you confess with such effort?

original: gal te bdag ni sdig pa bgyis pa ma byang zhing ma zad par myur du 'gum par 'gyur du mchi zhing 'ong bar 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gal te bdag ni sdig pa bgyis pa ma byang zhing ma zad par myur du 'gum par 'gyur du mchi zhing 'ong bar 'gyur bas //
translated: If I were to die suddenly, before my evil deeds were purified and exhausted,

original: ji ltar na sdig pa 'di dag las sam /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdig pa 'di dag las sam /
translated: how could I be freed from these evil deeds?

original: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba las nges par thar cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba las nges par thar cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba /
translated: How could I be freed from the cycle of existence, which has no beginning?

original: myur ba'i tshul gyis te /🔽rings pa nyid du mgon pos yongs su bskyab tu gsol zhing bde ba dam bar nges par 'byung ba'i @16a * //
analyzed: myur ba'i tshul gyis te / rings pa nyid du mgon pos yongs su bskyab tu gsol zhing bde ba dam bar nges par 'byung ba'i @16a * //
translated: How could I be freed quickly?🔽How could I be freed quickly?🔽Please, O Protector, save me!

original: thabs bstan du gsol zhes pa'o //🔽'di ltar 'chi bdag 'dis ni bya ba 'di byas zin la /
analyzed: thabs bstan du gsol zhes pa'o // 'di ltar 'chi bdag 'dis ni bya ba 'di byas zin la /
translated: Please teach me the method for attaining the highest bliss and certain deliverance!🔽The Lord of Death will not wait, thinking,

original: 'dis ni da rung ma byas so zhes sdod par mi byed pas na /
analyzed: 'dis ni da rung ma byas so zhes sdod par mi byed pas na /
translated: “He has done this much, but not that much.”🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: yid brtan mi rung 'chi bdag 'di //
analyzed: yid brtan mi rung 'chi bdag 'di //
translated: This Lord of Death is undependable.

original: byas dang ma byas mi sdod pas //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byas dang ma byas mi sdod pas // zhes bya ste /
translated: He does not wait to see if you have done this or not done that.

original: nad med cing bde bar byas pas yid brtan du rung ba yin na yang /
analyzed: nad med cing bde bar byas pas yid brtan du rung ba yin na yang /
translated: Even if you are healthy and happy, you cannot be sure.

original: dogs pa med kyang 'joms par byed pas /
analyzed: dogs pa med kyang 'joms par byed pas /
translated: Even if you have no fear, you will be destroyed.

original: yid brtan du mi rung ba yin pas de bas na /
analyzed: yid brtan du mi rung ba yin pas de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: na dang mi na kun gyis kyang //
analyzed: na dang mi na kun gyis kyang //
translated: whether sick or well,

original: glo bur tshe la yid mi brtan //
analyzed: glo bur tshe la yid mi brtan //
translated: do not rely on this fleeting life.

original: zhes bya ba ste dogs pa med kyang glo bur nyid du 'byung bas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste dogs pa med kyang glo bur nyid du 'byung bas /
translated: Even without fear, harm can suddenly occur,

original: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' las thog chen po 'bab pa dag srid pa dang 'dra bar glo bur du gnod pa chen po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' las thog chen po 'bab pa dag srid pa dang 'dra bar glo bur du gnod pa chen po 'byung ngo //
translated: like a great lightning bolt falling from a cloudless sky.

original: de bzhin du thams cad bor te cha dgos par //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad bor te cha dgos par //
translated: Thus, one must go forth, abandoning everything.

original: bdag gis de ltar ma shes nas //
analyzed: bdag gis de ltar ma shes nas //
translated: I did not understand this.

original: zhes bya ba sdug pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad bor zhing spangs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sdug pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad bor zhing spangs nas /
translated: Abandoning all things, such as those that are dear,🔽one must go forth, following the path of one's own karma.

original: rang gi las kyi lam 'ga' zhig dang chas shing 'gro dgos pa yin pas bdag gis de lta bu 'di mi shes na /
analyzed: rang gi las kyi lam 'ga' zhig dang chas shing 'gro dgos pa yin pas bdag gis de lta bu 'di mi shes na /
translated: Since I did not understand this,🔽I have committed various sins

original: mdza' dang mi mdza' kun gyi phyir //🔽sdig pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas //
analyzed: mdza' dang mi mdza' kun gyi phyir // sdig pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas //
translated: for the sake of both friends and foes.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu des mi dge ba du ma zhig byas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu des mi dge ba du ma zhig byas so zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of this, I have done many nonvirtuous actions.

original: she bar gyur nas ni bdag dang mi mdza' ba'i dgra bo rnams kyang med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: she bar gyur nas ni bdag dang mi mdza' ba'i dgra bo rnams kyang med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Having become ashes, the enemies who are not friends,

original: gzhan dag kyang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang med par 'gyur la /
translated: and others,🔽and those who are dear and beloved,

original: mdza' ba ste sdug pa rnams kyang med par 'gyur ba dang / bdag nyid kyang ni med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdza' ba ste sdug pa rnams kyang med par 'gyur ba dang / bdag nyid kyang ni med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and even I myself will be no more.

original: de lta na su zhig cha dgos par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na su zhig cha dgos par 'gyur //
translated: In that case, who will be attached to whom?

original: sems kyi rgyun rgyun nyid 'gro'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun rgyun nyid 'gro'o //
translated: The continuum of the mind is what goes.

original: de lta na ni de nyid bdag ce na /
analyzed: de lta na ni de nyid bdag ce na /
translated: If that is so, then that is the self.

original: de ni bden mod kyi /🔽tshe 'di'i phung po'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'am /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi / tshe 'di'i phung po'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'am /
translated: That is true, but🔽it does not transfer in any way from the suffering of the aggregates of this life

original: de las gzhan pa dag la rnam pa thams cad du 'pho bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la rnam pa thams cad du 'pho bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: to those of another life.

original: 'chi ba'i skad cig ma'i rkyen dang phrad pa las skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba na dran pa'i tshul nyid kyis de dang de dran pa'i yul du de 'gyur ba yin pas na de dran par byed de /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i skad cig ma'i rkyen dang phrad pa las skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba na dran pa'i tshul nyid kyis de dang de dran pa'i yul du de 'gyur ba yin pas na de dran par byed de /
translated: When it goes to another birth due to the condition of the moment of death, it becomes the object of memory through the mere fact of remembering it.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore, it is remembered.

original: dngos po gang dang gang dag rjes su spyad pa de dang de goms pa'i sems kyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang dag rjes su spyad pa de dang de goms pa'i sems kyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Whatever things you have experienced, you have done so with a mind that was habituated to them.

original: de yang rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du tshe 'di 'das shing song bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni slar mthong bar mi 'gyur @16b zhing /
analyzed: de yang rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du tshe 'di 'das shing song bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni slar mthong bar mi 'gyur @16b zhing /
translated: And just like the experience of a dream, all of that will be gone and passed, and you will not see it again.

original: nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You will not experience it again.

original: skye ba gzhan dag tu nyams su myong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos kyi /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan dag tu nyams su myong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos kyi /
translated: What need is there to mention the experience of other lives?

original: re zhig gson pa'i dus kyi da ltar gyi tshe 'di nyid la mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba du ma zhig 'das par gyur kyang /
analyzed: re zhig gson pa'i dus kyi da ltar gyi tshe 'di nyid la mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba du ma zhig 'das par gyur kyang /
translated: In this very life, many friends and foes have passed away.

original: rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du /
translated: Like the experience of a dream,

original: dran pa'i yul du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dran pa'i yul du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: they have become objects of memory.

original: slar mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You will not see them again.

original: de dag gi don du byas pa'i sdig pa mi bzad cing rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba 'byin pa'i drag po gang yin pa de ni mdun na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi don du byas pa'i sdig pa mi bzad cing rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba 'byin pa'i drag po gang yin pa de ni mdun na gnas pa yin no //
translated: The terrible misdeeds you have done for their sake, which will yield an unpleasant karmic maturation, are still right here.

original: de la thams cad bor te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang bral ba sngon byung ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la thams cad bor te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang bral ba sngon byung ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning with the words having abandoned all explains the past separation from friends and foes.

original: mi mdza' rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mdza' rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning with the words and the foes explains the future separation.

original: rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ltar ba yin te /🔽tshe 'dir yang mi mdza' ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gang dang gang las 'jigs pa la sogs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa de dang der ni skad cig ma re re zhing dran pa nyid kyis dran pa'i yul du gyur pa yin pas de ni rmi
analyzed: rmi lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ltar ba yin te / tshe 'dir yang mi mdza' ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gang dang gang las 'jigs pa la sogs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa de dang der ni skad cig ma re re zhing dran pa nyid kyis dran pa'i yul du gyur pa yin pas de ni rmi
translated: The passage beginning with the words like the experience of a dream explains the present.

original: lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du 'das par gyur pa thams cad slar mthong bar mi 'gyur te /🔽rnam pa thams cad du 'jigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam nyams su myong ba bzhin du 'das par gyur pa thams cad slar mthong bar mi 'gyur te / rnam pa thams cad du 'jigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this life, whatever things, such as foes, one experiences as fear, etc., in each moment, they are the objects of memory, since they are remembered. Therefore, like the experience of a dream, all that has passed is not seen again.

original: ji ltar na dran pa dang / slar ngo shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na dran pa dang / slar ngo shes par 'gyur /
translated: Because it is fearful in every way, how can there be memory and recognition?

original: las dang 'bras bu yang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu yang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And karma and its effects would not be related.

original: de ni ma yin te /🔽de nyams su myong ba'i skad cig ma re re las mngon sum mam /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / de nyams su myong ba'i skad cig ma re re las mngon sum mam /
translated: That is not so.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis dran pa la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i sa bon dang rkyen du gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshul gyis dran pa la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i sa bon dang rkyen du gyur pa yin pas /
translated: From each moment of experiencing it, memory and so on arise either directly or indirectly through a sequence.

original: de ltar tshe snga ma nas 'ongs pa dang / thams cad bor te skye ba gzhan dag tu 'gro dgos pas bdag ni glo bur ba yin no zhes bdag gis so sor rtogs shing shes par ma gyur pas /🔽rgyu des na mdza' ba 'am mi mdza' ba rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar tshe snga ma nas 'ongs pa dang / thams cad bor te skye ba gzhan dag tu 'gro dgos pas bdag ni glo bur ba yin no zhes bdag gis so sor rtogs shing shes par ma gyur pas / rgyu des na mdza' ba 'am mi mdza' ba rnams la /
translated: Since it is the seed and condition of that, I have not understood and realized that the self is adventitious, that it comes from a previous life and that it must go to another birth, abandoning everything.🔽For that reason, I have committed many kinds of negative actions under the influence of attachment and aversion toward friends and enemies.

original: rjes su chags pa dang zhe sdang ba'i dbang gis sdig pa rnam pa du ma zhig byas par gyur pa 'di la gal te bdag 'chi bar gyur pan slar bcos pa'i thabs las brtson par ma byas na myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang zhe sdang ba'i dbang gis sdig pa rnam pa du ma zhig byas par gyur pa 'di la gal te bdag 'chi bar gyur pan slar bcos pa'i thabs las brtson par ma byas na myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If I die before I have made an effort to remedy them, I will quickly die.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyin mtshan sdod pa yong med par //
analyzed: nyin mtshan sdod pa yong med par //
translated: Day and night, without a pause,

original: tshe 'di rtag tu 'god 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: tshe 'di rtag tu 'god 'gyur zhing //
translated: this life is always slipping by.

original: @17a * // snon pa gud nas 'ong med na //
analyzed: @17a * // snon pa gud nas 'ong med na //
translated: And no extension can be gained

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: tshe ma nyams pa 'am /
analyzed: tshe ma nyams pa 'am /
translated: There is no way to stop the decline of life,

original: 'phel ba 'am /
analyzed: 'phel ba 'am /
translated: no way to make it increase,

original: slar 'ong bar gyur pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: slar 'ong bar gyur pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: and no way to make it come back again.

original: bdag lta 'chi bar cis mi 'gyur te nges par 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag lta 'chi bar cis mi 'gyur te nges par 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: So how can I avoid death? I am certain to die.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe na yang bdag nyid kyi mal du 'dug pa bzhin du 'am /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe na yang bdag nyid kyi mal du 'dug pa bzhin du 'am /
translated: And when I die, even if I am lying on my bed

original: gnyen bshes rnams kyis mtha' nas nye bar bskor du zin kyang /
analyzed: gnyen bshes rnams kyis mtha' nas nye bar bskor du zin kyang /
translated: and my friends and relatives are gathered around me,🔽I will have to experience the pain of dying

original: srog chad pa'i tshor ba dag srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag nyid gcig pus rjes su myong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srog chad pa'i tshor ba dag srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni bdag nyid gcig pus rjes su myong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: all by myself.

original: nye du dang mal stan la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin no //🔽de lta na yang de rnams ni skyob par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: nye du dang mal stan la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin no // de lta na yang de rnams ni skyob par byed do zhe na /
translated: My friends and relatives, my bed and so on, will not suffer in my place.🔽But they will protect me, won’t they?

original: de rnams ni tshe 'di nyid la skyob par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de rnams ni tshe 'di nyid la skyob par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: They will protect me in this life, but not in the next.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe na /
translated: At the time of death,

original: gshin rje'i pho nyas zin pa la //
analyzed: gshin rje'i pho nyas zin pa la //
translated: seized by the messengers of the Lord of Death,

original: gnyen pas ci phan bshes ci phan //
analyzed: gnyen pas ci phan bshes ci phan //
translated: what help are relatives, what help are friends?

original: de tshe bsod nams gcig skyabs na //
analyzed: de tshe bsod nams gcig skyabs na //
translated: At that time, merit alone is a refuge,

original: bsod nams de yang bdag gis ma bsten to //
analyzed: bsod nams de yang bdag gis ma bsten to //
translated: but I have not cultivated that merit.

original: de bas na mgon po bag med par gyur pa bdag gis ni sdig pa mang po zhig nye bar bsgrubs shing bsags par gyur to //
analyzed: de bas na mgon po bag med par gyur pa bdag gis ni sdig pa mang po zhig nye bar bsgrubs shing bsags par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, O Protector, I, who have become heedless, have accumulated many sins.

original: ci'i phyir ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: Why? How?

original: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'di 'dra ba nyid ma 'tshal bas /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa 'di 'dra ba nyid ma 'tshal bas /
translated: Not knowing this fear of death,

original: mi rtag tshe 'di nyid kyi ched du bdag dang bdag gir lhag par chags pa'i rgyus sdig pa rnams bsags so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag tshe 'di nyid kyi ched du bdag dang bdag gir lhag par chags pa'i rgyus sdig pa rnams bsags so zhes pa'o //
translated: for the sake of this impermanent life, I have accumulated sins out of excessive attachment to self and possessions.

original: de bas na bdag nyid ni gshin rje'i pho nyas nges par khrid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid ni gshin rje'i pho nyas nges par khrid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, I will certainly be led away by the messengers of the Lord of Death.

original: de ltar na de nyid kyi tshe kun nas skyob pas bsod nams dag bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid kyi tshe kun nas skyob pas bsod nams dag bya'o zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, “At that time, I will make merit, since it is a complete protection,”

original: skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skye bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the verse] says “People . . . ” and so on.

original: skye bo dag yan lag bcad pa'i phyir de'i sar nyes pa'i dbang gis de ring khrid par gyur pa yang 'jigs pas bred par 'gyur zhing skom pas shin tu gdungs pas kha skams pa dang / mig rtsa ngan pa la sogs pa rang bzhin snga ma las gzhan du gyur pa snang zhing /
analyzed: skye bo dag yan lag bcad pa'i phyir de'i sar nyes pa'i dbang gis de ring khrid par gyur pa yang 'jigs pas bred par 'gyur zhing skom pas shin tu gdungs pas kha skams pa dang / mig rtsa ngan pa la sogs pa rang bzhin snga ma las gzhan du gyur pa snang zhing /
translated: They appear different from their former selves.

original: de phyogs bzhir skyabs dag tshol bar byed pa na /
analyzed: de phyogs bzhir skyabs dag tshol bar byed pa na /
translated: When they search in the four directions for someone to protect them,

original: skyabs byed pa dag med pa na /
analyzed: skyabs byed pa dag med pa na /
translated: if they do not find anyone to protect them,

original: lhag par zhum par byed pa yin na /🔽'chi ba'i dus byed pa'i gshin rje'i pho nya shin tu 'jigs 'jigs lta bu'i sha tshugs can gyis bzung zhing /
analyzed: lhag par zhum par byed pa yin na / 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'i gshin rje'i pho nya shin tu 'jigs 'jigs lta bu'i sha tshugs can gyis bzung zhing /
translated: they become even more depressed.🔽When the messengers of the Lord of Death, who are extremely terrifying, seize you and take you away,

original: bdag gir byas par gyur la 'jigs pa chen pos skrag par byed pa'i rims nad kyis thebs par @17b gyur cing /
analyzed: bdag gir byas par gyur la 'jigs pa chen pos skrag par byed pa'i rims nad kyis thebs par @17b gyur cing /
translated: you will be stricken with a terrible disease that terrifies you.

original: rab tu nyam thag byed pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu nyam thag byed pa ste /
translated: You will be in a state of utter despair.

original: bshang gci 'byung bar lus la gos par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs su lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: bshang gci 'byung bar lus la gos par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs su lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the situation when you are covered with excrement and urine?

original: de nas sngar bas /
analyzed: de nas sngar bas /
translated: Then,

original: bred sha 'thon pa'i mig bgrad nas //
analyzed: bred sha 'thon pa'i mig bgrad nas //
translated: with eyes wide open in terror,

original: phyogs bzhir skyabs dag tshol bar byed //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir skyabs dag tshol bar byed //
translated: he searches in the four directions for a protector.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: su zhig 'jigs chen 'di las bdag / legs par skyob par byed 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: su zhig 'jigs chen 'di las bdag / legs par skyob par byed 'gyur zhes //
translated: “Who will protect me from this great fear?”

original: de ltar skyabs tshol bas /
analyzed: de ltar skyabs tshol bas /
translated: Thus, searching for a protector,

original: phyogs bzhir skyabs med mthong nas ni ste bsod nams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir skyabs med mthong nas ni ste bsod nams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he sees no protector in the four directions, because he has no merit.

original: bsod nams las ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa de'i tshe yang skyabs mdzad par snang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams las ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa de'i tshe yang skyabs mdzad par snang ngo //
translated: But if he has merit, the Buddha and so on appear to him as a protector at that time.

original: bsod nams kyang sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs kyis de la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyang sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs kyis de la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And merit is the basis of the Buddha’s blessing, which is the going for refuge and so on.

original: bdag nyid rang bzhin du gnas par gyur pa yang de ltar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid rang bzhin du gnas par gyur pa yang de ltar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if one is in a natural state, it will be like that.

original: sdig pa shin tu drag pa yang de'i tshe rang bzhin du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa shin tu drag pa yang de'i tshe rang bzhin du gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one has very strong evil karma, it will not be like that at that time.

original: de nas kun tu yi mug 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas kun tu yi mug 'gyur //
translated: Then, he becomes utterly despondent.

original: skyob par gyur pas kyang /
analyzed: skyob par gyur pas kyang /
translated: Even if there is a protector,

original: gnas der skyabs yod ma yin na //
analyzed: gnas der skyabs yod ma yin na //
translated: there is no protection in that place.

original: de tshe bdag gis ji ltar bya //
analyzed: de tshe bdag gis ji ltar bya //
translated: What can I do at that time?🔽Therefore,🔽I go for refuge today

original: de'i phyir / de bas rgyal ba 'gro ba'i mgon //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de bas rgyal ba 'gro ba'i mgon //
translated: to the Victorious Ones, the protectors of the world,

original: 'gro ba bskyab pa'i don brtson pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba bskyab pa'i don brtson pa //
translated: who strive to protect the world,

original: stobs chen 'jigs pa kun sel la //
analyzed: stobs chen 'jigs pa kun sel la //
translated: who have great power and remove all fear.

original: de ring nyid nas skyabs su mchi //🔽rgyal ba de yis thugs su chud pa'i chos //
analyzed: de ring nyid nas skyabs su mchi // rgyal ba de yis thugs su chud pa'i chos //
translated: I also go for refuge to the Dharma

original: de kho na nyid /🔽'khor ba'i 'jigs pa sel ba dang // byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la yang //
analyzed: de kho na nyid / 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa sel ba dang // byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la yang //
translated: that is understood by the Victorious Ones,🔽the truth that removes the fears of cyclic existence,

original: de bzhin yang dag skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: de bzhin yang dag skyabs su mchi //
translated: and to the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: bdag ni 'jigs pas rnam skrag nas //🔽kun tu bzang la'ang bdag nyid dbul //🔽'jam pa'i dbyangs la'ang bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: bdag ni 'jigs pas rnam skrag nas // kun tu bzang la'ang bdag nyid dbul // 'jam pa'i dbyangs la'ang bdag nyid kyis //
translated: Terrified by fear,🔽I offer myself to Samantabhadra.🔽I also offer my body

original: bdag gi lus ni dbul bar bgyi //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ni dbul bar bgyi //
translated: to Manjusri.

original: de la lhag par mos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of my intense interest in them.

original: mos pa'i bdag nyid sna tshogs pa'i stobs kyis de la yang dang yang bdag nyid kyi lus dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i bdag nyid sna tshogs pa'i stobs kyis de la yang dang yang bdag nyid kyi lus dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: With the power of various kinds of interest, I repeatedly offer my body to them.

original: 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dbyangs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: Mañjuśrī is the symbol of the Tathāgata family.

original: de la mngon par brtson pa nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid phul nas /🔽padma'i rigs gang la thugs rjes spyod pa ma 'khrul pa'i ngang tshul mnga' ba'i /
analyzed: de la mngon par brtson pa nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid phul nas / padma'i rigs gang la thugs rjes spyod pa ma 'khrul pa'i ngang tshul mnga' ba'i /
translated: Therefore, having offered oneself,🔽one should supplicate Mañjuśrī,🔽the one who is endowed with the nature of non-deluded compassion

original: thugs rjes spyod pa ma 'khrul ba'i //
analyzed: thugs rjes spyod pa ma 'khrul ba'i //
translated: in the lotus family.

original: spyan ras gzigs mgon de la ni //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs mgon de la ni //
translated: To the protector Avalokiteśvara,

original: nyam thag nga ros 'o dod 'bod //🔽sdig @18a * //
analyzed: nyam thag nga ros 'o dod 'bod // sdig @18a * //
translated: one should cry out with a distressed voice,

original: ldan bdag la bskyab tu gsol //
analyzed: ldan bdag la bskyab tu gsol //
translated: saying, Protect me, a sinful one!

original: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po dang // sa yi snying po dag dang ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po dang // sa yi snying po dag dang ni //
translated: To the noble Ākāśagarbha, Kṣitigarbha,

original: thugs rje che mgon thams cad la'ang //
analyzed: thugs rje che mgon thams cad la'ang //
translated: and all the great compassionate protectors,

original: skyabs tshol snying nas 'o dod 'bod //
analyzed: skyabs tshol snying nas 'o dod 'bod //
translated: one should cry out from the depths of one's heart, seeking refuge.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi bdag po la'ang //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi bdag po la'ang //
translated: To the lord of the vajra family,

original: gang zhig mthong nas gshin rje yi //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong nas gshin rje yi //
translated: seeing whom

original: pho nya la sogs sdang ba rnams //
analyzed: pho nya la sogs sdang ba rnams //
translated: the messengers of Yama and so forth

original: skrag nas phyogs bzhir 'byer byed pa'i //
analyzed: skrag nas phyogs bzhir 'byer byed pa'i //
translated: flee in the four directions in fear,

original: rdo rje can la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: rdo rje can la skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to Vajrapāṇi.

original: de yang blos mngon sum du byas nas bdag ni /
analyzed: de yang blos mngon sum du byas nas bdag ni /
translated: Moreover, having made it manifest to the mind, one should say:

original: sngon chad khyed kyi bka' las 'das //
analyzed: sngon chad khyed kyi bka' las 'das //
translated: I have transgressed your word in the past.

original: da ltar nyid ni da ltar te //
analyzed: da ltar nyid ni da ltar te //
translated: Now I am afraid, now I am afraid!

original: da ni 'jigs pa che mthong nas //
analyzed: da ni 'jigs pa che mthong nas //
translated: Now I see great fear.

original: khyed la skyabs su mchi lags kyis //
analyzed: khyed la skyabs su mchi lags kyis //
translated: I go to you for refuge.

original: skrag par gyur pa'i 'jigs pa myur du bsal du gsol /
analyzed: skrag par gyur pa'i 'jigs pa myur du bsal du gsol /
translated: Quickly remove the fear that has arisen!

original: khyed kyi bka' las 'das pa las //
analyzed: khyed kyi bka' las 'das pa las //
translated: I have transgressed your word.🔽I am greatly despised.

original: bdag shin tu smad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag shin tu smad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show this, he says,

original: tha mal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha mal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ordinary sicknesses, etc.

original: tha mal nad kyis zhes bya ba ni lus la byung ba ste /
analyzed: tha mal nad kyis zhes bya ba ni lus la byung ba ste /
translated: The ordinary sicknesses are those that arise in the body.

original: de dag ni sman gyis bcos na legs par myur du zhi zhing dus thung dus sel ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sman gyis bcos na legs par myur du zhi zhing dus thung dus sel ba'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are easily and quickly pacified by medical treatment, and their nature is to be removed in a short time.

original: de dag kyang rims dang mdze la sogs pa'i dbye bas stong phrag nyi shu yod de /
analyzed: de dag kyang rims dang mdze la sogs pa'i dbye bas stong phrag nyi shu yod de /
translated: They are also twenty thousand in number, classified as fevers, leprosy, etc.

original: des 'jigs pa la yang bdag nyid shes pas sman pa'i ngag bzhin du bya dgos na /
analyzed: des 'jigs pa la yang bdag nyid shes pas sman pa'i ngag bzhin du bya dgos na /
translated: If one should act according to the doctor's instructions out of fear of them,🔽how much more so should one act according to the Sugata's instructions out of fear of the three sufferings!

original: ci yid kyis thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa ma yin pa /🔽'dod chags la sogs nyes brgya yi //
analyzed: ci yid kyis thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa ma yin pa / 'dod chags la sogs nyes brgya yi //
translated: Since beginningless time, the mind has accumulated negative tendencies, so it is not ordinary.🔽What need is there to speak of the mind

original: nad kyis rtag btab smos ci dgos //
analyzed: nad kyis rtag btab smos ci dgos //
translated: constantly afflicted by the disease of hundreds of faults such as attachment?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi po de dag kyang spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi po de dag kyang spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi /
translated: The four hundred and four diseases such as attachment are the eighty-four thousand behaviors.

original: mdor bsdu na bzhi brgya dag yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bzhi brgya dag yin te /
translated: In brief, they are four hundred,

original: bag la nyal ba tha dad pa las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba tha dad pa las bshad pa yin no //
translated: as explained in the Exposition of Unwholesomeness.

original: bag la nyal de dag kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ba la sogs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin na /
analyzed: bag la nyal de dag kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ba la sogs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin na /
translated: If those latent states are the ninety-eight latent states of desire realm attachment and so on,

original: kha cig gis ni brgya bzhi bcu yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni brgya bzhi bcu yin te /
translated: some say they are one hundred and forty.

original: zag pa bzhi dang / chu bo bzhi dang / sbyor ba bzhi dang / nye bar len pa bzhi dang / 'ching ba gsum dang / kun nas sbyor ba dgu dang / srid pa'i kun tu spyod pa bco brgyad dang / kun nas dkris pa bcu dang /
analyzed: zag pa bzhi dang / chu bo bzhi dang / sbyor ba bzhi dang / nye bar len pa bzhi dang / 'ching ba gsum dang / kun nas sbyor ba dgu dang / srid pa'i kun tu spyod pa bco brgyad dang / kun nas dkris pa bcu dang /
translated: They are the four contaminants, four floods, four bonds, four clingings, three fetters, nine bonds, eighteen courses of existence, ten entanglements,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug dang / sgrib pa lnga dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga dang / gong @18b ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga dang / sa mang po pa bcu dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug dang / sgrib pa lnga dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga dang / gong @18b ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga dang / sa mang po pa bcu dang /
translated: The six secondary defilements, the six stains, the five hindrances, the five lower fetters, the five higher fetters, the ten universal defilements,

original: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rnal 'byor rnams kyi gzhi phran tshegs kyi ming can lnga bcu rtsa bdun dag yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rnal 'byor rnams kyi gzhi phran tshegs kyi ming can lnga bcu rtsa bdun dag yin no //
translated: the two unwholesome universals, and the fifty-seven minor defilements which are the bases of the yogins.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag ni mang du yod de gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag ni mang du yod de gtso bo ji lta ba bzhin du brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug yin no //
translated: There are many secondary defilements, but the principal ones are the fifty-six.

original: de gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba //🔽nad brgya po gang yin pa dag las khros pa gcig gis kyang 'dzam gling na /
analyzed: de gcig gis kyang zhes bya ba // nad brgya po gang yin pa dag las khros pa gcig gis kyang 'dzam gling na /
translated: One of them means

original: gnas pa'i mi kun rlag byed la //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mi kun rlag byed la //
translated: that one of the one hundred diseases, anger, destroys all the people who live in Jambudvīpa.

original: dper na gzhan dag tu drang srong khros pas zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan dag tu drang srong khros pas zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in other sūtras it is said, Through the anger of a sage.

original: de dag sred pa'i 'tshe bas khros pas 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag sred pa'i 'tshe bas khros pas 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: They increase through the anger of craving.

original: rmongs pas kha na ma tho ba chen po thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rmongs pas kha na ma tho ba chen po thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and through delusion, one obtains a great offense.

original: dper na gzhan dag tu yid gnyis kha na ma tho cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan dag tu yid gnyis kha na ma tho cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in other sūtras, doubt is called a great offense.

original: de dag ces bya ba nad brgya po lus la byung ba'i nad kyi rgyu dag gi gso ba'i sman gzhan te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba nad brgya po lus la byung ba'i nad kyi rgyu dag gi gso ba'i sman gzhan te /
translated: The word those refers to the other medicines for curing the hundred diseases that arise in the body.

original: phyi rol dag gi sman ni /
analyzed: phyi rol dag gi sman ni /
translated: External medicines

original: phyogs rnams kun nas btsal na'ang mi rnyed na /
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun nas btsal na'ang mi rnyed na /
translated: are not found even if sought in all directions.

original: rims la sogs pa gso bar mi nus pa dang / glo bur ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: rims la sogs pa gso bar mi nus pa dang / glo bur ba ma yin pa gang yin pa de dag gi nang nas /
translated: They are unable to cure fevers and so on, and those that are not adventitious🔽are the one hundred and one diseases arising from wind,🔽the one hundred and one diseases arising from bile,

original: rlung las gyur pa brgya rtsa gcig dag dang / de bzhin bad kan las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa brgya rtsa gcig dag dang / de bzhin bad kan las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: and the one hundred and one diseases arising from phlegm.

original: nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi po de dag ni 'phags pa dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi po de dag ni 'phags pa dpa' sbyin gyis zhus pa las /
translated: Those four hundred and four diseases are explained in the Ārya-śūras-pariprcchā

original: 'phags pa phal chen gyi 'dul ba las bshad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa phal chen gyi 'dul ba las bshad pa dag yin no //
translated: and in the Vinaya of the Mahāsāṃghikas.

original: gang gi phyir nad 'ga' po gcig gis kyang 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa'i mi thams cad rnam par 'gyur bar byed cing 'jig bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nad 'ga' po gcig gis kyang 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa'i mi thams cad rnam par 'gyur bar byed cing 'jig bar byed pa na /
translated: For, even a single disease can transform and destroy all the people living in Jambudvīpa.

original: yul ka shi ka'i bdag por gyur pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nyams par gzigs shing sman pa la dris nas /
analyzed: yul ka shi ka'i bdag por gyur pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nyams par gzigs shing sman pa la dris nas /
translated: The Lord of Kāśi was seen by the Buddha to be in decline, and the Buddha asked a physician

original: phyogs thams cad du de'i sman mi rnyed pas na de mi srid do snyam pa nyid kyis sman pas gson pa'i sha chen po bstan pa na /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du de'i sman mi rnyed pas na de mi srid do snyam pa nyid kyis sman pas gson pa'i sha chen po bstan pa na /
translated: “It is impossible to find a medicine for him anywhere,” and the physician thought, “It is his own flesh that is the medicine.”

original: bden pa'i phyin gyi rlabs bsgrubs nas gso bar mdzad do //
analyzed: bden pa'i phyin gyi rlabs bsgrubs nas gso bar mdzad do //
translated: The Buddha established the power of truth and healed him.

original: nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi po de dag gis gzir ba ni de'i rgyu dag gis gzir ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi po de dag gis gzir ba ni de'i rgyu dag gis gzir ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those afflicted by the four hundred and four diseases are afflicted by their causes.

original: de la ste nge dag gi sman pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la ste nge dag gi sman pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin te /
translated: The physician for those is omniscience.

original: sman pa thams cad mkhyen pas lus kyi zug rdu'i rgyu 'byin cing zug rdu 'byin par mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sman pa thams cad mkhyen pas lus kyi zug rdu'i rgyu 'byin cing zug rdu 'byin par mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: The physician, omniscience, removes the cause of the pain of the body and removes the pain.

original: gang la @19a * //
analyzed: gang la @19a * //
translated: For whom?

original: zug rdu thams cad 'byin pa'i ngang tshul mnga' ba de ni /
analyzed: zug rdu thams cad 'byin pa'i ngang tshul mnga' ba de ni /
translated: He has the nature of removing all pain.

original: zug rngu thams cad 'byin pa'i'o //
analyzed: zug rngu thams cad 'byin pa'i'o //
translated: He is the remover of all pain.

original: bka' ste dam pa'i chos kyi sman gyi man ngag ltar mi byed mi sems pa ni //
analyzed: bka' ste dam pa'i chos kyi sman gyi man ngag ltar mi byed mi sems pa ni //
translated: Not to act in accordance with the instructions of the medicine of the holy Dharma, the Word of the Buddha, is

original: shin tu gti mug smad pa'i gnas //
analyzed: shin tu gti mug smad pa'i gnas //
translated: A state of utter stupidity and contempt.

original: shin tu rmongs pa kun nas skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa kun nas skyes pa yin no //
translated: It is born of utter delusion.

original: de ltar ni g-yang sa tha mal chung du la'ang //
analyzed: de ltar ni g-yang sa tha mal chung du la'ang //
translated: In this way, one should be heedful even in a small ordinary pit.

original: bag yod gnas par bya dgos na //🔽tshegs chung dus bgrod par bya ba tha mal pa'i nad pa yang sman pa'i ngag las 'das par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: bag yod gnas par bya dgos na // tshegs chung dus bgrod par bya ba tha mal pa'i nad pa yang sman pa'i ngag las 'das par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If one should be heedful even in a small ordinary pit,

original: dpag tshad stong du ltung ba yi //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong du ltung ba yi //
translated: then how much more so in the case of an ordinary patient who is to be cured with little difficulty, and who should not transgress the instructions of the physician.🔽In the case of a long fall into a deep abyss,

original: yun rings g-yang sar te /
analyzed: yun rings g-yang sar te /
translated: a long fall into a deep abyss,

original: yid kyi nad sman pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' las 'das pa lta smos ci dgos bag med pas gnas par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi nad sman pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' las 'das pa lta smos ci dgos bag med pas gnas par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: how much more so should one not be heedless, transgressing the instructions of the physician, the Omniscient One, the medicine for the mental illness?

original: g-yang sa chung ngu la yang bag med pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu nyes pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes dgos so //
analyzed: g-yang sa chung ngu la yang bag med pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu nyes pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes dgos so //
translated: The fault of carelessness with respect to even a small precipice becomes very great.

original: de lta ni 'gyur mod kyis /
analyzed: de lta ni 'gyur mod kyis /
translated: This is the point.🔽But it is not right to say,

original: de ring kho na mi 'chi zhes //
analyzed: de ring kho na mi 'chi zhes //
translated: Today I will not die,

original: re zhig bde bar gnas la /
analyzed: re zhig bde bar gnas la /
translated: and then to live happily,

original: de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i las bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i las bya'o zhe na /
translated: and then to do virtuous actions such as confessing sins.🔽Therefore it is said,

original: de ring kho na mi 'chi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ring kho na mi 'chi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Today I will not die,🔽and so on.

original: med do zhes bde bar 'dug pa'i rigs ma yin /
analyzed: med do zhes bde bar 'dug pa'i rigs ma yin /
translated: It is not right to live happily, thinking,🔽I will not die today.

original: gang tshe bdag med 'gyur pa'i dus //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag med 'gyur pa'i dus //
translated: When the time comes for me to die,

original: de ni gdon mi za bar 'byung //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar 'byung //
translated: that time will surely come.

original: sdig pa las 'jigs par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa las 'jigs par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one should not fear sin,🔽because it is certain to be experienced.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: bdag la mi 'jigs su yis byin //
analyzed: bdag la mi 'jigs su yis byin //
translated: Who can give me immunity?

original: 'di las ji ltar des thar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di las ji ltar des thar 'gyur //
translated: How can I escape from this?

original: gdon mi za bar med gyur na //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar med gyur na //
translated: If I cannot avoid it,

original: ci phyir bdag nyid bde bar 'dug / ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ci phyir bdag nyid bde bar 'dug / ces bya ba smos so //
translated: why do I live so happily?

original: longs spyod kyis bde bar gnas pa yin no zhe na smras pa /🔽sngon chad myong ste zhig pa las te longs spyod dag las /
analyzed: longs spyod kyis bde bar gnas pa yin no zhe na smras pa / sngon chad myong ste zhig pa las te longs spyod dag las /
translated: If you say that you live happily through possessions,🔽then what remains of the possessions

original: lhag par gnas pa ci yod na //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa ci yod na //
translated: that have been experienced and destroyed?

original: bdag ni longs spyod la mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: bdag ni longs spyod la mngon par zhen nas /
translated: I have been attached to possessions🔽and have acted contrary to the teacher’s words.🔽If you say that you live happily through the mind,🔽then what remains of the mind🔽that has been born and will perish?🔽If you say that you live happily through friends,🔽then what remains of the friends🔽that have been experienced and destroyed?🔽I have been attached to friends

original: bla ma'i bka' dang 'gal bar byas //
analyzed: bla ma'i bka' dang 'gal bar byas //
translated: and have acted contrary to the teacher’s words.🔽If you say that you live happily through relatives,🔽then what remains of the relatives

original: 'on kyang yid gnyen ma shes kyis bde bar gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang yid gnyen ma shes kyis bde bar gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: that have been experienced and destroyed?🔽I have been attached to relatives🔽and have acted contrary to the teacher’s words.🔽If you say that you live happily through the body,🔽then what remains of the body🔽that has been born and will perish?

original: smras pa / gson tshe 'di dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: smras pa / gson tshe 'di dang de bzhin du //
translated: I have been attached to the body🔽and have acted contrary to the teacher’s words.🔽 Translation: भोगैर्हि सुखेन जीवितव्यमिति चेत्?🔽पूर्वं तावत् परिभुक्तविनाशाद् भोगेभ्यः🔽किं नु तदस्ति यन्न विनाशिष्यते?🔽अहं पुनर्भोगाभिष्वङ्गात्🔽गुरूणामाज्ञां विलोमयन्,

original: gnyen dang bshes pa rnams spangs nas //
analyzed: gnyen dang bshes pa rnams spangs nas //
translated: Having abandoned friends and relatives,🔽

original: gcig pu ga shes 'gro dgos na //
analyzed: gcig pu ga shes 'gro dgos na //
translated: If I must go alone,🔽

original: mdza' dang mi mdza' kun ci rung //
analyzed: mdza' dang mi mdza' kun ci rung //
translated: What does it matter if everyone likes you or not?🔽

original: de dag gi don byed par nus pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag gi don byed par nus pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that they are not able to perform their functions.🔽🔽

original: mi dge ba las sdug bsngal 'byung //
analyzed: mi dge ba las sdug bsngal 'byung //
translated: Suffering arises from nonvirtue.🔽

original: de las ji ltar nges thar zhes //
analyzed: de las ji ltar nges thar zhes //
translated: How can one be liberated from that?🔽

original: nyin mtshan rtag tu bdag gis @19b ni //
analyzed: nyin mtshan rtag tu bdag gis @19b ni //
translated: I will always, day and night,🔽

original: 'di nyid 'ba' zhig bsam pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'ba' zhig bsam pa'i rigs //
translated: It is only right to think of this alone.🔽

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽

original: thabs gang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs gang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “by what means?”

original: bdag gol ba med par gzhan grol bar mi nus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag gol ba med par gzhan grol bar mi nus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: I am unable to liberate others without deviating myself.

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal las thar pa'i thabs yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal las thar pa'i thabs yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that confessing evil and so on are the means of liberation from suffering,🔽he says:

original: smras pa / bdag ni mi shes pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag ni mi shes pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I am an ordinary being due to ignorance.

original: gti mug pas zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa thob pa dang dor ba mi shes pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gti mug pas zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa thob pa dang dor ba mi shes pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of delusion, he does not know how to obtain and discard what is beneficial and harmful, respectively.🔽 Whatever evil I have done with body, speech, and mind,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sdig pa gang yang rung ba bgyis pa rnams yang dang yang du byas pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sdig pa gang yang rung ba bgyis pa rnams yang dang yang du byas pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i bar du'o //
translated: repeatedly, up to rejoicing in it.

original: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis gang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid kyis gang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba'am /
translated: By nature, whatever is afflicted is by its very essence a misdeed.

original: gang yang nyes dmigs su gzigs pa las nyon mongs pa can ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gang yang nyes dmigs su gzigs pa las nyon mongs pa can ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Whatever is seen to have disadvantages, even if not afflicted,🔽is also a misdeed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par mdzad pa de lta na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par mdzad pa de lta na /
translated: The Blessed One has made them reprehensible.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus they are reprehensible by prescription.

original: de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bshags par bgyi //
translated: I confess all of them.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

analyzed: bdag la gang brdzun gyis sun 'byin par byed pa 'am /
