original: rgal 'dod rnams kyi gru dang ni //🔽gzings dang zam pa nyid du gyur //
analyzed: rgal 'dod rnams kyi gru dang ni // gzings dang zam pa nyid du gyur //
translated: I am the boat, the raft, and the bridge for those who wish to cross the rivers and so forth.🔽I am the island for those who seek an island.

original: gling don gnyer la bdag gling dang // gnas mal 'dod la gnas mal dang // bdag ni lus can bran 'dod pa //
analyzed: gling don gnyer la bdag gling dang // gnas mal 'dod la gnas mal dang // bdag ni lus can bran 'dod pa //
translated: I am the bed for those who desire a resting place.🔽I am the servant for all who desire a body.

original: kun gyi bran du 'gyur bar shog /'dod pa @21b thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i nor bu dang bum pa ni /
analyzed: kun gyi bran du 'gyur bar shog /'dod pa @21b thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i nor bu dang bum pa ni /
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel and the excellent vase that fulfill all wishes are

original: yid bzhin nor bu bum pa bzang po'o //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu bum pa bzang po'o //
translated: the wish-fulfilling jewel and the excellent vase.

original: klag pa nyid las don byed pa ni rig sngags grub pa'o //
analyzed: klag pa nyid las don byed pa ni rig sngags grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of knowledge mantras is the performance of benefits through mere recitation.

original: sman don chen po byed pa ni /
analyzed: sman don chen po byed pa ni /
translated: The great purpose of medicine is🔽

original: sman chen du gyur cig pa'o //🔽ji ltar yongs su bsams pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'i shing ni /
analyzed: sman chen du gyur cig pa'o // ji ltar yongs su bsams pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa'i shing ni /
translated: The great medicine is the great physician.🔽The tree that bears fruit according to one's wishes is the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: dpag bsam gyi ni shing dag dang // ji ltar 'dod pa'i dngos po thams cad 'dod 'jor gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi ni shing dag dang // ji ltar 'dod pa'i dngos po thams cad 'dod 'jor gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: Just as it is the wish-granting tree and the wish-fulfilling gem,

original: lus can rnams la 'dod 'jor gyur //
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'dod 'jor gyur //
translated: may I become a wish-fulfilling gem for all embodied beings.🔽In brief, just as the great elements such as earth,

original: mdor bsdu na ji ltar sa sogs 'byung ba chen po dang // nam mkha' ma lus pa na gnas pa yi //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ji ltar sa sogs 'byung ba chen po dang // nam mkha' ma lus pa na gnas pa yi //
translated: and all that exists in space,🔽are the basis for the manifold sustenance

original: sems can dpag tu med pa yi //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa yi //
translated: of limitless sentient beings,🔽may I too become in the same way

original: rnam mang nyer 'tsho'i gzhir yang shog / rnam pa mang po dag gis so //
analyzed: rnam mang nyer 'tsho'i gzhir yang shog / rnam pa mang po dag gis so //
translated: the basis for the manifold sustenance of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du bdag po'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag po'i dbang gis so //
translated: In this way, through the power of the master,

original: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i rgyun rings shing rgya che bas mtha' yas pa'i sems can khams la rnam kun du /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i rgyun rings shing rgya che bas mtha' yas pa'i sems can khams la rnam kun du /
translated: in all ways and at all times,🔽may I be a cause of happiness

original: rnam pa du mas sems can thams cad mya ngan 'das bar du /
analyzed: rnam pa du mas sems can thams cad mya ngan 'das bar du /
translated: for all sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence.

original: bdag ni nyer 'tsho'i rgyur yang shog / sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag ni nyer 'tsho'i rgyur yang shog / sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having become a Buddha, I will work for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar mchod pa la sogs pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa'i sems kyi mthar thug pa dka' ba dag gis sbyor ba rnam par dag cing bsam pa yongs su rgyas pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa la sogs pa dang / byang chub tu smon pa'i sems kyi mthar thug pa dka' ba dag gis sbyor ba rnam par dag cing bsam pa yongs su rgyas pa yin /
translated: Thus, the practice is pure in its completion of the worship, etc., and the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: sdom pa yang dag par len pa ni gang /
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par len pa ni gang /
translated: What is the taking of the vow?🔽As it is said,

original: ji ltar sngon gyi bde gshegs kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon gyi bde gshegs kyis //
translated: Just as the Sugatas of the past

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: Here, the thought of enlightenment is the vow of the Bodhisattva.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus,

original: bla ma sdom la gnas shing mkhas //
analyzed: bla ma sdom la gnas shing mkhas //
translated: The Guru, abiding in the vow, and learned,

original: nus dang ldan las blang bar bya //
analyzed: nus dang ldan las blang bar bya //
translated: endowed with power, from him one should take it.

original: de 'dra ba mi rnyed na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa ma lus pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de 'dra ba mi rnyed na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa ma lus pa dang ldan pa /
translated: If one cannot find such a Guru, then from all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, endowed with all the vows,

original: byang chub kyi mthar byon pa thams cad la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi mthar byon pa thams cad la /
translated: who have come to the end of enlightenment,

original: thogs pa med pa'i spyan mnga' bas mdun du bltas la /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i spyan mnga' bas mdun du bltas la /
translated: Since he has unobstructed vision, look in front of you.

original: de dag las dad pa'i bya ba drag po dang / de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa dag gis yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las dad pa'i bya ba drag po dang / de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa dag gis yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
translated: From among them, you should correctly take up the practice of faith and the practice of devotion to reality.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: Having made the offerings and so on as explained,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: you should recite these two verses.

original: bla ma rnyed nas yang de dang de dag las de bzhin du byas te /
analyzed: bla ma rnyed nas yang de dang de dag las de bzhin du byas te /
translated: Having found the guru, you should do the same with him or her,

original: tshul khrims kyi @22a * //🔽le'u las bshad pa 'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi @22a * // le'u las bshad pa 'am /
translated: and you should correctly take up the practice of morality🔽as explained in the chapter on morality

original: bslab pa kun las btus las bshad pa'i tshogs yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus las bshad pa'i tshogs yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
translated: or as explained in the Compendium of Trainings.

original: de ni tsandan gyis brlan pa'i yan lag drug dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i zer dag gis ston ka'i bsil ba'i zla ba'i zer 'ba' zhig bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni tsandan gyis brlan pa'i yan lag drug dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i zer dag gis ston ka'i bsil ba'i zla ba'i zer 'ba' zhig bzhin no //
translated: This is like the autumn cool-rayed moon, which is alone, unlike the moonbeams of the month of Karttika, which are accompanied by the rays of the six-limbed moon moistened with sandalwood.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis sngon gyi bde gshegs kyi byang chub thugs ni bskyed pa dang / bdag gi gnas skabs 'di lta bur gyur pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis sngon gyi bde gshegs kyi byang chub thugs ni bskyed pa dang / bdag gi gnas skabs 'di lta bur gyur pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In whatever way, by whatever aspect, the past Well-Gone Ones generated the Thought of Awakening, and in whatever way, by whatever aspect, the future Well-Gone Ones will generate the Thought of Awakening, and in whatever way, by whatever aspect, the present Well-Gone Ones in the ten directions generate the Thought of Awakening, in just that way, by just that aspect, I too will generate the Thought of Awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la //
translated: In the training of the Bodhisattvas,

original: de dag rim bzhin gnas pa ltar //
analyzed: de dag rim bzhin gnas pa ltar //
translated: just as they are set forth in order,

original: zhes bya ba la gnas pa ni rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gnas pa ni rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Set forth” means “engaged in.”

original: de bzhin 'gro la phan don du //
analyzed: de bzhin 'gro la phan don du //
translated: In the same way, for the sake of helping the world,

original: de'i rgyu mtshan du 'jug pa'i byang chub sems ni bskyed bgyi zhing //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan du 'jug pa'i byang chub sems ni bskyed bgyi zhing //
translated: I will generate the Thought of Awakening, which is the cause of that.

original: de bzhin du ni bslab pa la'ang //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni bslab pa la'ang //
translated: And in the same way, in the training,

original: rim pa bzhin du ste mthar gyis bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du ste mthar gyis bslab par bgyi /
translated: I will train in order, that is, gradually.

original: de ltar mchod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi'i rnam pa dag cing rgyas pa dag gis stong pa nyid dang / snying rje'i snying po can bzung bas blo snying rjes non pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi'i rnam pa dag cing rgyas pa dag gis stong pa nyid dang / snying rje'i snying po can bzung bas blo snying rjes non pa'o //
translated: Thus, with pure and extensive forms of application and actual practice of worship and so forth, and by taking up the essence of emptiness and compassion, the mind is pervaded by compassion.

original: 'di la yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i blo yod pas na blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yod pa dang med pa las 'das pa'i blo yod pas na blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with intelligence, because he has the intelligence that transcends existence and nonexistence.

original: ci zhig bzung nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig bzung nas she na /
translated: What does he apprehend?

original: byang chub sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems so //
translated: The spirit of enlightenment.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How does he apprehend it?

original: rab dang ste bsam pa dag pas so //
analyzed: rab dang ste bsam pa dag pas so //
translated: With a pure intention, that is, with a pure attitude.

original: mjug kyang rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: mjug kyang rgyas pa ste /
translated: The conclusion is also extensive.

original: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi rgyas pa nyid yod pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi rgyas pa nyid yod pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though the practice and the actual ceremony are extensive,🔽he still extols the spirit of enlightenment,

original: yang rgyas par bya ba'i phyir /🔽sems ni 'di ltar gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang rgyas par bya ba'i phyir / sems ni 'di ltar gzengs bstod do //
translated: in order to make it even more extensive.

original: ji ltar gzengs bstod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzengs bstod par bya zhe na /
translated: How does he extol it?

original: deng du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: deng du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, today, etc.

original: deng du bdag tshe 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: deng du bdag tshe 'bras bu yod //
translated: Today my life has become fruitful,

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas /
translated: because in this way I have obtained

original: mi yi srid pa legs par thob //
analyzed: mi yi srid pa legs par thob //
translated: a human life of great opportunity,

original: de ring sangs rgyas rigs su skyes //
analyzed: de ring sangs rgyas rigs su skyes //
translated: and today I am born into the Buddha’s family.

original: sangs rgyas sras su da gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras su da gyur to //
translated: I have now become a child of the Buddha.

original: sa bcu las sa dang po la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sa bcu las sa dang po la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Hasn’t it been explained that one who is established in the first stage of a bodhisattva is born into the family of the Tathāgatas?

original: bden te der ni sa chen po'i rigs la dgongs pa yin la /
analyzed: bden te der ni sa chen po'i rigs la dgongs pa yin la /
translated: True, but there the intention is the lineage of the great stage.

original: sngar ni sangs rgyas nyid la mos pa'i rigs la brda yang dag par len pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las skyes par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni sangs rgyas nyid la mos pa'i rigs la brda yang dag par len pa byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las skyes par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Previously, it was explained that the generation of the resolve to attain enlightenment is the correct assumption of the vow in the lineage of those who aspire to buddhahood.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las /
translated: The Akasagarbhasutra declares:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i @22b sdom pa yang dag par len pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa dag la yang yod do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i @22b sdom pa yang dag par len pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa dag la yang yod do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The correct assumption of the bodhisattva vow exists even among those who are not āryas.

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa la chags pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they turn their backs on attachment to gain and so forth.

original: sa bcu las kyang sa dang po las 'ga' zhig kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti lhag pa mi 'dod ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu las kyang sa dang po las 'ga' zhig kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti lhag pa mi 'dod ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Daśabhūmika states that some on the first stage do not desire gain and honor.

original: 'phags pa la yang log pa'i 'tsho ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa la yang log pa'i 'tsho ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that even āryas do not have wrong livelihood.🔽The Bodhisattvaprātimokṣa declares:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las kyang rigs yi bu mo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa las kyang rigs yi bu mo zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Son or daughter of the lineage.”

original: bud med nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba byang chub don du gnyer ba byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'dod pa dag la yang byang chub kyi bar du sdom pa 'di skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bud med nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba byang chub don du gnyer ba byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'dod pa dag la yang byang chub kyi bar du sdom pa 'di skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Also, in women who have little of the affliction of desire, who strive for enlightenment, and who wish to train in the bodhisattva trainings, this vow will arise up to enlightenment.

original: skye ba gzhan dag tu yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan dag tu yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It will also arise in other lives.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'am 'di'i sdom pa zhig na yang dran pa sad par bya ba'i don du nyin re zhing lan gsum du thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'am 'di'i sdom pa zhig na yang dran pa sad par bya ba'i don du nyin re zhing lan gsum du thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: If there is a root downfall or a violation of this vow, then in order to awaken the mindfulness, three times each day and night one should perfectly take up the vow with the thought, “Great Compassionate One, please consider me.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
translated: I, by the name so-and-so, confess each and every misdeed.

original: yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bsam pas yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bsam pas yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
translated: I will not do it again.”

original: spyir sdig pa thams cad bshags pas gzhan yang skye ba gzhan du byas pa dang / ltung ba gzhan dag las kyang grol na dri ma med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyir sdig pa thams cad bshags pas gzhan yang skye ba gzhan du byas pa dang / ltung ba gzhan dag las kyang grol na dri ma med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In general, all sins are confessed, and it is taught that if one is freed from other downfalls as well, one will become stainless.

original: da ni bdag gis ci nas kyang rigs dang mthun pa'i las brtsams te /
analyzed: da ni bdag gis ci nas kyang rigs dang mthun pa'i las brtsams te /
translated: Now, I will do whatever it takes to begin the activity that is in accord with my family.

original: skyon med btsun pa'i rigs 'di la //
analyzed: skyon med btsun pa'i rigs 'di la //
translated: In this family of the pure, which is faultless,

original: rnyog par mi 'gyur de ltar bya //
analyzed: rnyog par mi 'gyur de ltar bya //
translated: I will act so as not to sully it.

original: byang chub sems de rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems de rnyed par dka'o //
translated: The bodhisattva spirit is difficult to find.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽long bas phyag dar phung po las //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir / long bas phyag dar phung po las //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:🔽As if a blind person were to find a jewel

original: phyag dar khrod kyi phung po dag las //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod kyi phung po dag las //
translated: in a heap of rubbish,

original: ji ltar rin chen rnyed pa ltar de bzhin ji zhig ltar stes nas /
analyzed: ji ltar rin chen rnyed pa ltar de bzhin ji zhig ltar stes nas /
translated: in the same way, by some chance,

original: byang chub sems ni bdag la skyes //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bdag la skyes //
translated: the bodhisattva spirit has arisen in me.

original: 'di don chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'gro ba'i 'chi bdag 'joms byed pa'i //
analyzed: 'di don chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / 'gro ba'i 'chi bdag 'joms byed pa'i //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this has great meaning, it is said:🔽This is also the supreme nectar

original: bdud rtsi mchog kyang 'di yin te //
analyzed: bdud rtsi mchog kyang 'di yin te //
translated: that conquers the Lord of Death for beings.

original: tha dad pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the meaning of being different.🔽It is the inexhaustible treasure🔽that removes the poverty of the world.

original: 'gro ba'i dbul ba sel ba yi //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dbul ba sel ba yi //
translated: It has the meaning of being the inexhaustible great enjoyment.🔽It is the supreme medicine🔽that completely cures the disease of the world.🔽It has the meaning of being the supreme medicine that cures the disease of the world.🔽It is the tree that refreshes the weary🔽travelling on the road of existence.🔽It is the tree that refreshes the weary travelling on the road of existence.🔽It is the tree that gives shade on the road🔽of the world that is a great wilderness.🔽It has the meaning of being the tree that gives shade on the road of the world that is a great wilderness.

original: mi zad gter yang 'di yin no //
analyzed: mi zad gter yang 'di yin no //
translated: It is the supreme resting place🔽for those who are tired of the three worlds.🔽It has the meaning of being the supreme resting place for those who are tired of the three worlds.🔽It is the supreme boat🔽for crossing over the river of existence.

original: longs spyod chen po mi zad pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po mi zad pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the meaning of being the supreme boat for crossing over the river of existence.🔽It is the supreme lamp🔽for dispelling the darkness of the world.

original: 'gro ba'i nad rab zhi byed pa'i //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i nad rab zhi byed pa'i //
translated: It has the meaning of being the supreme lamp for dispelling the darkness of the world.

original: @23a * // sman gyi mchog kyang 'di yin te //
analyzed: @23a * // sman gyi mchog kyang 'di yin te //
translated: It is the supreme medicine🔽for curing the disease of the world.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the meaning of being the supreme medicine for curing the disease of the world.🔽It is the tree that refreshes the weary

original: srid pa nyid la ma yin te /🔽de la 'khyams pa ni rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa nyid la ma yin te / de la 'khyams pa ni rgyu ba'o //
translated: travelling on the road of existence.🔽It is the tree that gives shade on the road

original: des dub pa ni 'gro ba'i ngal bso ljon shing yin //
analyzed: des dub pa ni 'gro ba'i ngal bso ljon shing yin //
translated: of the world that is a great wilderness.

original: lam ka'i grib ma can gyi shing yin te //
analyzed: lam ka'i grib ma can gyi shing yin te //
translated: It has the meaning of being the tree that gives shade on the road of the world that is a great wilderness.🔽It is the supreme resting place🔽for those who are tired of the three worlds.🔽It has the meaning of being the supreme resting place for those who are tired of the three worlds.🔽It is the supreme boat🔽for crossing over the river of existence.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don nyams par 'gyur bar byas pa de bas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don nyams par 'gyur bar byas pa de bas na /

analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi bgegs byed pa de'i ngan 'gro ba mtha' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no end to the bad migrations of one who creates an obstacle to the welfare of beings.

original: de lta na yang gang lhung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang lhung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In that case, who would fall into bad migrations?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas bshags pa byas shing sdom pa gtang nas kyang len par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas bshags pa byas shing sdom pa gtang nas kyang len par byed pa yin te /
translated: Even if one gives up the vow, one should take it again,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i chos 'dul ba ni nges par 'byin pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ngan song gi de ltar ltung ba'i stobs ldan dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i chos 'dul ba ni nges par 'byin pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // ngan song gi de ltar ltung ba'i stobs ldan dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i /
translated: because the Buddha’s Dharma Vinaya is itself the means of deliverance.🔽The power of falling into bad rebirths and the power of the thought of enlightenment of the Well Gone One

original: byang chub sems stobs ldan pa dag / ltung ba dang kun nas ldang ba dag gis /
analyzed: byang chub sems stobs ldan pa dag / ltung ba dang kun nas ldang ba dag gis /
translated: are the two powers of falling and rising.

original: 'khor bar res kyis spyod pa ni res kyis 'dre bar byed na'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar res kyis spyod pa ni res kyis 'dre bar byed na'o //
translated: One who alternates in samsara is one who alternates in the practice of the two.

original: sa thob pa la ste /
analyzed: sa thob pa la ste /
translated: One who attains the stages

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa thob pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa thob pa la /
translated: is a bodhisattva who attains the stages of the Joyous, etc.

original: yun ring thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yun ring thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who attains them will be delayed for a long time.

original: tha na dam bcas pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa thob pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: tha na dam bcas pa mos pas spyod pa'i sa thob pa la yang ngo //
translated: Even if one attains the stage of practice through devoted interest, one will be delayed.

original: de thob na yang ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thob na yang ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one attains that stage, one will not go to bad rebirths.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du bslab pa de dag la bslab par bya ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du bslab pa de dag la bslab par bya ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, one should train in those precepts just as they are.

original: ci ltar dam bcas pa yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar dam bcas pa yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as I have taken the vow,

original: bdag gis gus par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis gus par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: I shall respectfully accomplish it.🔽I shall not transgress the training without fail, always.

original: g-yel ba med par rtag tu bslab pa las mi 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yel ba med par rtag tu bslab pa las mi 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar ni de bas brtson par ma byas na /
analyzed: de ltar ni de bas brtson par ma byas na /
translated: If I do not strive in this way,

original: de'i 'og nas te ngan song nas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og nas te ngan song nas so //
translated: then after that, from the lower realms,

original: 'og tu ste ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'og tu ste ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: I will go down, to the lower realms.

original: ngan 'gro kho nar brgyud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: ngan 'gro kho nar brgyud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: I will only continue in the lower realms. This is the meaning.

original: @25a * // sangs rgyas bzhugs pa ma yin nam de 'og nas 'og tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽sems can thams cad phan mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: @25a * // sangs rgyas bzhugs pa ma yin nam de 'og nas 'og tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na / sems can thams cad phan mdzad pa'i //
translated: If you say, “Since the Buddha is present, I will not go down to the lower realms after that,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the text] says, “The buddhas, who act for the benefit of all sentient beings,” and so on.

original: gnas gzhan drug cus phyin pa ni grangs yin la /
analyzed: gnas gzhan drug cus phyin pa ni grangs yin la /
translated: The number is the sixty abodes.

original: bgrang bar mi nus pa ni grangs med pa ste /
analyzed: bgrang bar mi nus pa ni grangs med pa ste /
translated: The incalculable is that which cannot be counted.

original: sems can phan par mdzad pa yi //
analyzed: sems can phan par mdzad pa yi //
translated: The buddhas, who act for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas grangs med 'das gyur kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas grangs med 'das gyur kyang //
translated: have passed into nirvāṇa, incalculable in number.

original: bdag ni rang gi nyes pa de'i //
analyzed: bdag ni rang gi nyes pa de'i //
translated: But because of my own faults,

original: gso ba'i spyod yul ma gyur to //
analyzed: gso ba'i spyod yul ma gyur to //
translated: I was not the object of their healing.

original: bdag de dag gis gso bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag de dag gis gso bar ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: I was not the object of their healing.

original: da dung de bzhin bdag byed na //
analyzed: da dung de bzhin bdag byed na //
translated: If I act like that again,

original: ji ltar bdag sngon gyi skye bar bag med par gyur pas yang dang yang du de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag sngon gyi skye bar bag med par gyur pas yang dang yang du de bzhin te /
translated: just as I did in the past,

original: ngan 'gro dang / bde 'gro dang nad la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur zhing thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang / bde 'gro dang nad la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur zhing thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: I will again and again experience and obtain the results of those actions, such as miserable realms and sickness.

original: sangs rgyas bzhugs na yang tshogs pa rnyed par dka'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // dad dang mi lus thob pa dang // mi'i 'gro ba nyid dang / dge goms rung ba de lta bur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhugs na yang tshogs pa rnyed par dka'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // dad dang mi lus thob pa dang // mi'i 'gro ba nyid dang / dge goms rung ba de lta bur //
translated: In order to demonstrate that even when the Buddha is present, it is difficult to obtain the right conditions,🔽he says:🔽When will I obtain such a human body,🔽with the right conditions for virtue,🔽which is so rare,

original: dkon pa nam zhig thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dkon pa nam zhig thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: even when a Tathāgata has appeared?

original: gzhan yang nad med nyi ma 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni mi'i lus nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang nad med nyi ma 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni mi'i lus nyid de /
translated: Moreover, “such a day of health” refers to a human body.

original: 'di nad med pa'i nyi ma yin pas na nad med nyi ma'o //
analyzed: 'di nad med pa'i nyi ma yin pas na nad med nyi ma'o //
translated: Since this is a day of health, it is a day of health.

original: zas bcas 'tsho ba med kyang ni //
analyzed: zas bcas 'tsho ba med kyang ni //
translated: Even if I have no food or means of livelihood,

original: tshe ni skad cig slu ba ste //
analyzed: tshe ni skad cig slu ba ste //
translated: Life is fleeting and deceptive,

original: lus ni thang cig brnyan po bzhin //
analyzed: lus ni thang cig brnyan po bzhin //
translated: And the body is like a borrowed asset.

original: brnyan po byas pa'ang rnyed par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: brnyan po byas pa'ang rnyed par 'gyur gyis /
translated: Even if I am accused of being a thief,🔽I will not engage in negative actions.

original: nyes par spyod pa 'ang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa 'ang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is stated:

original: bdag gi spyod pa 'di 'dras ni //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa 'di 'dras ni //
translated: With this kind of conduct,

original: mi yi lus kyang 'thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi yi lus kyang 'thob mi 'gyur //
translated: I will not even attain a human body.

original: mi lus thob par ma gyur na //
analyzed: mi lus thob par ma gyur na //
translated: If I do not attain a human body,

original: sdig pa 'ba' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdig pa 'ba' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: I will only accumulate negative karma.

original: dge ba las kyang ngan 'gro 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba las kyang ngan 'gro 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether there is a possibility of going to the lower realms from virtue,

original: dge ba med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dge ba med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: it is stated, “There is no virtue.”

original: mi la yang dge ba goms pa las bde 'gror 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi la yang dge ba goms pa las bde 'gror 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Even for humans, going to the higher realms is from the familiarity of virtue and not from any other way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: gang tshe dge spyad skal ldan yang //
analyzed: gang tshe dge spyad skal ldan yang //
translated: when I have the fortune to practice virtue,

original: dge ba bdag gis ma byas na //
analyzed: dge ba bdag gis ma byas na //
translated: if I do not practice virtue,

original: ngan song sdug bsngal kun rmongs pa //
analyzed: ngan song sdug bsngal kun rmongs pa //
translated: when I am confused by the suffering of the lower realms,

original: de tshe bdag gis ci byar yod //
analyzed: de tshe bdag gis ci byar yod //
translated: what can I do at that time?

original: ngan song dag tu'o //
analyzed: ngan song dag tu'o //
translated: It is the lower realms.

original: dge ba dag kyang ma byas la //
analyzed: dge ba dag kyang ma byas la //
translated: And I have not performed any virtue,

original: sdig pa dag kyang ste /
analyzed: sdig pa dag kyang ste /
translated: and I have committed many sins.

original: gcig la gcig za zhing dmyal ba'i srung ma sdang ba la sogs pa 'phel zhing nyer bsags na /
analyzed: gcig la gcig za zhing dmyal ba'i srung ma sdang ba la sogs pa 'phel zhing nyer bsags na /
translated: If I am reborn in the hells,

original: re zhig 'di gnyis kyis @25b kyang bde 'gror mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'di gnyis kyis @25b kyang bde 'gror mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then for a long time I will not even hear the words ‘happy rebirth.’

original: bskal pa bye ba brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba brgyar yang ni //
translated: For hundreds of millions of eons

original: bde 'gro'i sgra yang thos mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i sgra yang thos mi 'gyur //
translated: I will not even hear the words ‘happy rebirth.’

original: de nyid phyir na bcom ldan gyis //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na bcom ldan gyis //
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed One said:

original: rgya mtsho cher g-yengs gnya' shing gi / bu gar rus sbal mgrin chud ltar //🔽mi nyid shin tu thob dkar gsungs //
analyzed: rgya mtsho cher g-yengs gnya' shing gi / bu gar rus sbal mgrin chud ltar // mi nyid shin tu thob dkar gsungs //
translated: It is as if a turtle swimming in a vast ocean with a yoke on its back🔽were to rise to the surface through a hole in the yoke once every hundred years.

original: dper na dge slong dag sa chen po 'di rgya mtsho chen por gyur zhing /
analyzed: dper na dge slong dag sa chen po 'di rgya mtsho chen por gyur zhing /
translated: It is as if, monks, this great earth were to become a vast ocean,

original: de la gnya' shing bu ga gcig yod pa rlung gis g-yengs shing 'di nas bskyod pa dang / rus sbal long ba gcig cig yod la /
analyzed: de la gnya' shing bu ga gcig yod pa rlung gis g-yengs shing 'di nas bskyod pa dang / rus sbal long ba gcig cig yod la /
translated: and on it a yoke were to float, with a single hole in it, blown about by the wind. And there were a blind turtle living there.

original: rus sbal de yang lo brgya brgya zhing mgrin pa 'dogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rus sbal de yang lo brgya brgya zhing mgrin pa 'dogs par 'gyur na /
translated: And the turtle were to rise to the surface once every hundred years.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal mgrin pa chud pa rnyed par sla ba yin nam /🔽bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal mgrin pa chud pa rnyed par sla ba yin nam / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Is it easier for a turtle to put its neck through the hole of a yoke floating on a turbulent ocean than for an animal reborn in hell to find the opportunity to leave?

original: dge slong dag de bzhin du mi nyid shin tu thob par dka' ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin du mi nyid shin tu thob par dka' ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, it is even more difficult for a human to obtain a human rebirth.”

original: rnam pa 'di dang 'di zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dang 'di zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach this in a different way, he said:

original: skad cig gcig byas sdig pas kyang //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /🔽mtshams med pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: skad cig gcig byas sdig pas kyang // zhes bya ba smos te / mtshams med pa la sogs pas /
translated: Even a single moment of evil🔽is the cause for a human to be born in hell.🔽If, by committing a heinous crime,

original: bskal par mnar med gnas 'gyur na /🔽'dug par 'gyur na /🔽thog med 'khor bar bsags sdig gis //
analyzed: bskal par mnar med gnas 'gyur na / 'dug par 'gyur na / thog med 'khor bar bsags sdig gis //
translated: one must remain in Avīci Hell for an eon,🔽what need is there to mention the evil

original: bde 'gror mi 'gro smos ci dgos //
analyzed: bde 'gror mi 'gro smos ci dgos //
translated: accumulated in beginningless cyclic existence?

original: sgra mi thos par smos kyang ci dgos /🔽de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: sgra mi thos par smos kyang ci dgos / de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: What need is there to mention the evil🔽accumulated in beginningless cyclic existence?

original: sdig pa zad pa las mnar med pa las thar bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sdig pa zad pa las mnar med pa las thar bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: This is so, but one is freed from Avīci Hell by the exhaustion of that evil.

original: sdig pa de tsam kho na myong gyur nas //
analyzed: sdig pa de tsam kho na myong gyur nas //
translated: Having experienced just that much evil,

original: nyams su myong ba mnar med pa la sogs pa las sems de ni rnam thar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba mnar med pa la sogs pa las sems de ni rnam thar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because,

original: 'di ltar de ni sdig pa myong bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sdig pa myong bzhin du /
translated: while experiencing the results of evil actions,

original: sdig pa gzhan dag rab tu skye //
analyzed: sdig pa gzhan dag rab tu skye //
translated: other evil actions are produced.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las dge ba bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las dge ba bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should do good actions in this very place.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di las bslus pa gzhan med de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di las bslus pa gzhan med de /
translated: If one does not do so, there is no other deception than this.

original: 'di las rmongs pa'ang gzhan med do //
analyzed: 'di las rmongs pa'ang gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other delusion than this.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gal te 'di 'dra'i dal ba rnyed gyur nas /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'dra'i dal ba rnyed gyur nas /
translated: If, having obtained such an opportunity,

original: bdag gis dge goms ma byas pa las so //
analyzed: bdag gis dge goms ma byas pa las so //
translated: I do not practice virtue,

original: de'i phyir gal te bdag gis de rtogs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te bdag gis de rtogs nas /
translated: then, if I understand this,

original: rmongs pas phyis kyang sgyid lug na'o //
analyzed: rmongs pas phyis kyang sgyid lug na'o //
translated: I will be deluded and lazy later on.

original: bslab pa 'bad rtsol mi byed na /
analyzed: bslab pa 'bad rtsol mi byed na /
translated: If I do not make an effort to practice,

original: de'i tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: then at the time of death

original: mya ngan chen po ldang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan chen po ldang bar 'gyur //
translated: great sorrow will arise.

original: ci'i phyir khyod 'di 'dra'i las byed ces yongs su smra bar byed pa na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod 'di 'dra'i las byed ces yongs su smra bar byed pa na'o //
translated: “Why do you do such actions?”

original: dmyal ba dag tu yang /
analyzed: dmyal ba dag tu yang /
translated: In the hells,

original: @26a * // dmyal me bzod dka' yun ring du //
analyzed: @26a * // dmyal me bzod dka' yun ring du //
translated: And the fires of hell are hard to bear,

original: bdag gi lus ni bsregs gyur na //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ni bsregs gyur na //
translated: and my body will be burned in them.

original: zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: lus can gzhan dang dud 'gro dag na dud 'gro rnams za bar byed pa na ngan song de la rnam pa 'ga' zhig lhar 'phos shing bde 'gror skye na ni /
analyzed: lus can gzhan dang dud 'gro dag na dud 'gro rnams za bar byed pa na ngan song de la rnam pa 'ga' zhig lhar 'phos shing bde 'gror skye na ni /
translated: When other embodied beings, and animals, eat animals, they are reborn in that lower realm.

original: sdig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i shes pas gdungs shing phyis 'gyod pa mi bzod me 'bar bas /
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i shes pas gdungs shing phyis 'gyod pa mi bzod me 'bar bas /
translated: If they are reborn in a happy realm, they are tormented by the knowledge that it is the result of evil actions, and later they are burned by the fire of unbearable regret.

original: dus phyis mi bzad pa'i mes /
analyzed: dus phyis mi bzad pa'i mes /
translated: Later, the fire of regret

original: yun ring sems gdungs gdon mi za //
analyzed: yun ring sems gdungs gdon mi za //
translated: will torment my mind for a long time.

original: bdag deng bslab pa dag la mi slob pa'o //🔽gzhan yang shin tu rnyed dka' phan pa'i sa //
analyzed: bdag deng bslab pa dag la mi slob pa'o // gzhan yang shin tu rnyed dka' phan pa'i sa //
translated: I am not training in the precepts now.🔽Moreover, I have somehow obtained

original: bde 'gro dag gis ci zhig ltar stes rnyed gyur nas so //
analyzed: bde 'gro dag gis ci zhig ltar stes rnyed gyur nas so //
translated: the human condition, so difficult to obtain, which is the basis for achieving happiness.

original: de ltar thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pas /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pas /
translated: Thus, through the knowledge that comes from hearing and so on,

original: bdag nyid shes dang ldan bzhin du //
analyzed: bdag nyid shes dang ldan bzhin du //
translated: I know what is to be done and what is not to be done.

original: sdig pas spyir yang dmyal ba der khrid na'o //
analyzed: sdig pas spyir yang dmyal ba der khrid na'o //
translated: But if I am led by evil actions into that hell,

original: rmongs pas sdig pa byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmongs pas sdig pa byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one commits evil deeds out of delusion, he says:

original: sngags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Through mantras, etc.

original: bdag la 'dir te /
analyzed: bdag la 'dir te /
translated: Here, in regard to oneself,

original: phan pa'i sar bslab pa dag la slob pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i sar bslab pa dag la slob pa'o //
translated: one trains in the precepts.

original: sems med du zad de /
analyzed: sems med du zad de /
translated: One is simply without mind,

original: 'di ltar bdag 'ga' zhig sngags kyis rmongs par byed pa bzhin /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag 'ga' zhig sngags kyis rmongs par byed pa bzhin /
translated: because, like one who is deluded through mantras,

original: rgyu cis rmongs pa bdag kyang ma shes te /
analyzed: rgyu cis rmongs pa bdag kyang ma shes te /
translated: one does not know the cause of delusion.

original: bdag gi lus kyi khong na ci zhig yod /🔽sred pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi khong na ci zhig yod / sred pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is there in the interior of one’s body?🔽Craving, etc.

original: zhe sdang sred sogs dgra rnams la //
analyzed: zhe sdang sred sogs dgra rnams la //
translated: The enemies, such as hatred and craving,

original: rkang lag la sogs yod min te //
analyzed: rkang lag la sogs yod min te //
translated: do not have arms and legs, etc.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not material.

original: dpa' min te brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i sa chen po pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpa' min te brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i sa chen po pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not heroes because effort is a great ground of virtue.

original: sred pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: nyon mongs rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / @28a * // nyon mongs pa rnams ni yul na mi gnas te /
translated: The root text says, “The afflictions do not exist in the object, etc.”

original: kun tu rtog pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun tu rtog pa la yang yul med pa nyid kyi phyir dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rten dang brten pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid kyi dbang tshogs la min te /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun tu rtog pa la yang yul med pa nyid kyi phyir dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rten dang brten pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi dbang tshogs la min te /
translated: The afflictions do not exist in the object, because they arise from conceptualization, because the object does not exist in conceptualization, and because the afflictions are not physical, and because it is not possible for them to be a support or something supported.

original: mig la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not exist in the collection of the sense faculties, because they do not exist in the eyes, etc.

original: bar na yang min te /
analyzed: bar na yang min te /
translated: They do not exist in between,

original: bar na gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bar na gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: because they do not exist in what is in between.

original: de las gzhan na min na /
analyzed: de las gzhan na min na /
translated: They do not exist elsewhere,🔽because they do not exist anywhere else.

original: 'di dag gal te gang du gnas shing 'gro ba kun gnod byed /
analyzed: 'di dag gal te gang du gnas shing 'gro ba kun gnod byed /
translated: If they exist somewhere, then where do they go to harm all beings?

original: de yod pa nyid ni skad cig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid ni skad cig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that they exist only for an instant.

original: skad cig gcig par bdag nyid thams cad 'jig pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: skad cig gcig par bdag nyid thams cad 'jig pa med pa yin la /
translated: It is not possible for something that is momentary to destroy all of its own essential nature.

original: med pa skye bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa skye bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is not possible for something that does not exist to be a cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sgyu 'dra zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sgyu 'dra zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be like an illusion.

original: 'di thams cad ni brdzun pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni brdzun pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since all of this is false,

original: nyon mongs pa las /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las /
translated: one should not be afraid of the afflictions.

original: snying la 'jigs pa spongs shes phyir /
analyzed: snying la 'jigs pa spongs shes phyir /
translated: In order to remove fear from the heart,

original: kun rdzob tu yang brtson pa bsten zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang brtson pa bsten zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one should rely on effort even conventionally.

original: bslab pa las mi 'da' bar brtson pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa las mi 'da' bar brtson pa'o //
translated: One should not transgress the training; one should rely on effort.

original: shes phyir ni shes rab phul du byung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: shes phyir ni shes rab phul du byung ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to know, for the sake of the excellence of wisdom.

original: don med nyid du zhes bya ba ni skabs med pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: don med nyid du zhes bya ba ni skabs med pa nyid du ste /
translated: For no purpose means for no occasion.

original: bdag la ni dmyal ba ni mi chung ba rnams su ci ste gnod pa byed /
analyzed: bdag la ni dmyal ba ni mi chung ba rnams su ci ste gnod pa byed /
translated: What harm is there for me in the hells?

original: thabs dang shes rab dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni padma'i nags kyi ngang pa bzhin du mnar med par skye ba zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni padma'i nags kyi ngang pa bzhin du mnar med par skye ba zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses method, wisdom, and great compassion is like a swan in a lotus pond, born in the Avici hell.

original: de ltar rnam bsams zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnam bsams zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Having reflected in this way, etc. is said for the conclusion.

original: de ltar ni bab col brtsam pa gang yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par bsams pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ni bab col brtsam pa gang yin pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par bsams pa la /
translated: In this way, having reflected in the manner of the verse beginning, “Whatever foolish acts I have done,”

original: ci skad bshad pa'i bslab pa bsgrub pa'i ched du 'bad par bya ste /
analyzed: ci skad bshad pa'i bslab pa bsgrub pa'i ched du 'bad par bya ste /
translated: one should strive to practice the precepts as they have been explained.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bslab pa de la bsgrub pa de'i don du ji skad bshad pa'i bslab pa ni bslab pa bsgrub pa'i ched du bag yod pas 'bad par bya'o //🔽'jig rten na yang sman pa'i tshig ma mnyan na sman dag gis //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bslab pa de la bsgrub pa de'i don du ji skad bshad pa'i bslab pa ni bslab pa bsgrub pa'i ched du bag yod pas 'bad par bya'o // 'jig rten na yang sman pa'i tshig ma mnyan na sman dag gis //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the precepts as they have been taught by the Bhagavat Buddha, one should strive with heedfulness for the sake of practicing the precepts as they have been explained.

original: bcos dgos nad pa sos pa ga la yod //
analyzed: bcos dgos nad pa sos pa ga la yod //
translated: In the world, if one does not follow the doctor’s advice, how can the sick person be cured by the medicines?

original: nad med pa nyid ces pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: nad med pa nyid ces pa'o // byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las /
translated: “Without being sick” is the absence of illness.

original: byang chub kyi sems la bag yod pa bstan pa ste le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la bag yod pa bstan pa ste le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on heedfulness with regard to the thought of awakening, the fourth chapter of Introduction to the Bodhisattva’s Way of Life.

original: // /'bad pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: // /'bad pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of striving?

original: bslab pa @28b bsrung bar 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: bslab pa @28b bsrung bar 'dod pa yis //
translated: Those who wish to guard the precepts

original: rab tu bsgrims nas sems bsrung ste /🔽zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dran pa dang shes bzhin dag gis rab tu bsgrims nas bsrung bar bya'i de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: rab tu bsgrims nas sems bsrung ste / zhes bya ba smos te / dran pa dang shes bzhin dag gis rab tu bsgrims nas bsrung bar bya'i de lta ma yin na /
translated: Guard the mind with great effort.🔽You should guard the mind with great effort through mindfulness and vigilance.

original: sems 'di bsrung bar ma byas na //
analyzed: sems 'di bsrung bar ma byas na //
translated: If you do not do this,

original: bslab pa bsrung bar yong mi nus //
analyzed: bslab pa bsrung bar yong mi nus //
translated: you will not be able to guard the training.

original: 'di ltar sems kyi glang po yan btang bas //🔽mnar med gnod pa byed pa ltar //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems kyi glang po yan btang bas // mnar med gnod pa byed pa ltar //
translated: If you let the elephant of the mind go wild,🔽it will cause you harm in the Avici hells.

original: dmyal ba de'i rgyus ngan song du 'jug par byed pa ltar //
analyzed: dmyal ba de'i rgyus ngan song du 'jug par byed pa ltar //
translated: The cause for this is that you will enter the lower realms.

original: glang chen ma dul myos pa yis //🔽glang po che myos pa 'dul sbyong ma byas pa btang bas kyang skye ba 'di la mi rnams la /
analyzed: glang chen ma dul myos pa yis // glang po che myos pa 'dul sbyong ma byas pa btang bas kyang skye ba 'di la mi rnams la /
translated: An untrained, rutting elephant🔽can cause harm to people in this life,

original: de 'dra'i gnod pa mi byed do //🔽kun nas dran pa'i thag pa yis //
analyzed: de 'dra'i gnod pa mi byed do // kun nas dran pa'i thag pa yis //
translated: but not the harm that the elephant of the mind can cause.

original: sems kyi glang chen dam btags na //
analyzed: sems kyi glang chen dam btags na //
translated: If you tie the elephant of the mind with the rope of mindfulness,

original: 'jigs pa thams cad med 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad med 'gyur zhing //
translated: you will be free from all fear

original: dge ba thams cad lag tu 'ong //
analyzed: dge ba thams cad lag tu 'ong //
translated: and will be able to achieve all virtues.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For,

original: stag dang seng ge glang chen dred //
analyzed: stag dang seng ge glang chen dred //
translated: tigers, lions, elephants, and rhinos

original: sbrul dang dgra rnams thams cad dang // dmyal ba'i srung ma thams cad dang // byed ma de bzhin srin po rnams //
analyzed: sbrul dang dgra rnams thams cad dang // dmyal ba'i srung ma thams cad dang // byed ma de bzhin srin po rnams //
translated: and so on.

original: dran pas sems 'di gcig pu btags pa yis //
analyzed: dran pas sems 'di gcig pu btags pa yis //
translated: By binding this mind alone with mindfulness,

original: de dag thams cad btags par 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag thams cad btags par 'gyur //
translated: all of them are bound.

original: sems ni gcig pu 'dul ba yis //
analyzed: sems ni gcig pu 'dul ba yis //
translated: By disciplining this mind alone,

original: shes bzhin gyis de dag thams cad thul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis de dag thams cad thul bar 'gyur /
translated: all of them are disciplined with introspection.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the Tathāgata has taught

original: 'di ltar 'jigs pa thams cad dang // sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jigs pa thams cad dang // sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa yang //
translated: that all fears and immeasurable suffering

original: sems las byung ba yin no zhes //🔽yang dag gsung pa nyid kyis bstan //
analyzed: sems las byung ba yin no zhes // yang dag gsung pa nyid kyis bstan //
translated: arise from the mind.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: The Blessed Buddha said in the noble Cloud of Jewels:

original: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni sems sngon du song ba tsam du yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos thams cad ni sems sngon du song ba tsam du yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Son of noble family, all phenomena are merely preceded by the mind.”

original: 'on kyang sems nyid dbang du gyur na chos thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / chos sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems nyid dbang du gyur na chos thams cad dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar dang / chos sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Dharmasangiti-sutra also says:🔽All phenomena depend on the mind.

original: chos thams cad ni sems la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the noble Array of Stalks Sid- dhanta says:🔽All the bodhisattva's activities are blessed by his mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs ni las las skyes pa yin zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs ni las las skyes pa yin zhing /
translated: And the world's variety arises from karma,

original: las kyang dngos su sems pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: las kyang dngos su sems pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: and karma is essentially intention.

original: sa bcu pa las kyang khams gsum po ni sems zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bcu pa las kyang khams gsum po ni sems zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Dasabhumika-sutra also says that the three realms are mind only.

original: 'di de de lta bu'i rnam pa can yin gyi /🔽gzhan du ni spu gri'i nags la sogs pa /
analyzed: 'di de de lta bu'i rnam pa can yin gyi / gzhan du ni spu gri'i nags la sogs pa /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: @29a * // sems can dmyal ba'i mtshon cha rnams //
analyzed: @29a * // sems can dmyal ba'i mtshon cha rnams //
translated: But the weapons of the hells, such as the razors in the forest of razor leaves,

original: su zhig gis ni ched du byas //
analyzed: su zhig gis ni ched du byas //
translated: Who made them?

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa ni 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa ni 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of a creator such as Īśvara will be refuted.

original: de bzhin du lcags bsregs sa gzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lcags bsregs sa gzhi ste /
translated: Similarly, a burning iron ground

original: lcags kyi sa gzhi bsregs par gyur pa 'bad rtsol dag gis su yis byas //
analyzed: lcags kyi sa gzhi bsregs par gyur pa 'bad rtsol dag gis su yis byas //
translated: is made by the effort of someone.

original: rab tu tsha zhing chu lan tshva can gyi chu bo rab med na bud med lcags kyi lus can gyis gzhan gyi chung ma la 'jug pa la 'khyud cing bsnun cing za bar byed pa 'am /
analyzed: rab tu tsha zhing chu lan tshva can gyi chu bo rab med na bud med lcags kyi lus can gyis gzhan gyi chung ma la 'jug pa la 'khyud cing bsnun cing za bar byed pa 'am /
translated: In the extremely hot river Vaitaraṇī, which is full of caustic water, women with iron bodies embrace, kiss, and devour another’s wife.

original: sen mos gtubs par byed pa gang yin pa 'am /
analyzed: sen mos gtubs par byed pa gang yin pa 'am /
translated: Or they cut her with their nails.

original: yang 'tsho ba la 'pho bar byed byed kyi /
analyzed: yang 'tsho ba la 'pho bar byed byed kyi /
translated: They are revived and then killed again.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal drag po myong bar byed pa'i me tshogs de dag ci las skyes /
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal drag po myong bar byed pa'i me tshogs de dag ci las skyes /
translated: But from what do those masses of fire that cause them to experience intense suffering arise?

original: bud med de dag ci las skyes //🔽de 'dra de dag thams cad kyang //
analyzed: bud med de dag ci las skyes // de 'dra de dag thams cad kyang //
translated: From what do those women arise?🔽The Muni has said that all of these

original: sdig sems yin par thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: sdig sems yin par thub pas gsungs //
translated: are the mind of sin.

original: zhes pa thub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa thub pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what the Muni, the Buddha, the Blessed One, has said.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gsum po na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gsum po na /
translated: Therefore, in the three worlds

original: sems las 'jigs pa gzhan gang med //
analyzed: sems las 'jigs pa gzhan gang med //
translated: there is no fear other than mind.

original: sems nyid 'jigs pa dang 'jigs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid 'jigs pa dang 'jigs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Mind itself is both the fear and the fearful.

original: de bcings na 'jigs pa thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bcings na 'jigs pa thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is bound, all fears are eliminated.

original: ji ltar thams cad dge bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad dge bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it become all wholesome?

original: gal te 'gro ba dbul bor nas //
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba dbul bor nas //
translated: If the world were emptied of poverty

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽pha rol tu phyin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / pha rol tu phyin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: de'i dngos po ni pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection is the other shore, and that is the reality of the perfection.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, up to the perfection of wisdom is the other shore, and that is the reality of the perfection.

original: de la gal te 'gro ba dbul bor nas //
analyzed: de la gal te 'gro ba dbul bor nas //
translated: There, if the world were emptied of poverty

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin yin na'o //🔽'o na de lta na ni da rung 'gro bkren yod na sngon //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin yin na'o // 'o na de lta na ni da rung 'gro bkren yod na sngon //
translated: and the perfection of generosity were to exist,🔽then, if the world is still poor,

original: skyob pa ji ltar pha rol phyin //
analyzed: skyob pa ji ltar pha rol phyin //
translated: how did the protector perfect it in the past?

original: 'o na de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: bdog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said:

original: bdog pa thams cad 'bras bcas te //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad 'bras bcas te //
translated: All possessions, along with their fruits,

original: dus gsum gyi chos dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa thams cad kyis sems ni gtong ba thams cad kyi sems yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi chos dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa thams cad kyis sems ni gtong ba thams cad kyi sems yin no //
translated: The mind is the giver of all gifts, of all Dharma teachings, of all fearlessness, and of all material things.🔽Therefore, with a mind of giving to all beings,

original: de'i phyir skye bo kun la gtang sems kyis //🔽'bras bu dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bo kun la gtang sems kyis // 'bras bu dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: one should practice generosity.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa las /
translated: As the noble Aksayamati Sūtra says,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin gsungs te //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin gsungs te //
translated: “The perfection of generosity is taught to be the mind itself.

original: de phyir de ni sems nyid do //
analyzed: de phyir de ni sems nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the mind that is the perfection.”

original: chos sems pa'i ka ba chen po la dran pa'i thag pas kun nas btags na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang dge ba'i sems @29b nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos sems pa'i ka ba chen po la dran pa'i thag pas kun nas btags na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang dge ba'i sems @29b nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When the great pillar of the mind of Dharma is tied all around with the rope of mindfulness, the perfections of morality and so on are also the virtuous mind itself.

original: nya pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nya pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: As the noble Sūtra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head says,🔽“Here, what is the perfection of morality?🔽It is the mind that is not divorced from the mind of enlightenment.

original: nya ni srog chags nye bar mtshon pa'o //🔽sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan gyi bud med dang nor la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: nya ni srog chags nye bar mtshon pa'o // sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan gyi bud med dang nor la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: What is the perfection of patience?🔽It is the mind that is not disturbed.

original: thag nye ba na yod na yang gang zhig tu //
analyzed: thag nye ba na yod na yang gang zhig tu //
translated: What is the perfection of perseverance?🔽It is the mind that is not lazy.🔽What is the perfection of meditation?🔽It is the mind that is not distracted.🔽What is the perfection of wisdom?🔽It is the mind that is not confused.”

original: de dag gsod mi 'gyur bar bskrad //
analyzed: de dag gsod mi 'gyur bar bskrad //
translated: And so on.

original: de dag nya pa la sogs pa'i srog chags so //
analyzed: de dag nya pa la sogs pa'i srog chags so //
translated: These are the fishermen and so on.

original: thams cad kyang las kyi dbang gis yul la sogs pa nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad kyang las kyi dbang gis yul la sogs pa nges pa yin gyi /
translated: All of them are determined in their country and so on by the power of karma.

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang bskrad par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang bskrad par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not able to be expelled anywhere.

original: gsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'phrog pa dang / len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: gsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'phrog pa dang / len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The term “killing” is a synecdoche for stealing, taking what is not given, and so on.

original: gzhan las yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan las yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of taking up the precepts from another,

original: 'tshe ba la sogs pa thams cad las spong ba'i sems ni thob pa las zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: 'tshe ba la sogs pa thams cad las spong ba'i sems ni thob pa las zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: the mind that abandons all harm and so on is called “obtained from obtaining.”

original: dge ba chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyi dran pas bcings na /
analyzed: dge ba chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyi dran pas bcings na /
translated: If the mind that engages in gathering virtuous dharmas and acting for the welfare of sentient beings is bound by mindfulness,

original: tshul khrims pha rol phyin par bshad //
analyzed: tshul khrims pha rol phyin par bshad //
translated: it is explained as the perfection of morality.

original: sbyin pa sngon du song ba can ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa sngon du song ba can ni /
translated: The perfection of morality is preceded by generosity.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa yin la /
translated: It is the correct taking up of morality.

original: de nas bzod pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de nas bzod pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: After that, it is patience.🔽In that way, the perfection of patience itself

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni /
translated: is the correct taking up of patience.

original: sems can mi srun nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: sems can mi srun nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: The unruly beings are as numerous as the sky is vast.

original: de dag gzhom gyis yang mi lang //
analyzed: de dag gzhom gyis yang mi lang //
translated: It is impossible to conquer them all.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dag gi zhags pa dang ral gri dag gis khro ba'i sems dgra bo drangs te bsnun cing bcom na /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dag gi zhags pa dang ral gri dag gis khro ba'i sems dgra bo drangs te bsnun cing bcom na /
translated: When the enemy, the angry thought, is drawn out by the noose and sword of mindfulness and vigilance, and is struck down and destroyed,

original: dgra bo thams cad choms dang 'dra //
analyzed: dgra bo thams cad choms dang 'dra //
translated: it is as if all enemies were conquered.

original: kun tu rtog pa las skyes pa'i dgra bo zhe sdang de med pa'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las skyes pa'i dgra bo zhe sdang de med pa'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no longer any angry enemy born of conceptual thought, it is as if it no longer exists.

original: 'dir dpe ni /🔽sa stengs 'di dag kos g-yogs su //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni / sa stengs 'di dag kos g-yogs su //
translated: The example here is this:🔽How could there be enough leather

original: de snyed ko bas ga la lang //
analyzed: de snyed ko bas ga la lang //
translated: to cover the whole earth?

original: lham mthil tsam gyi ko bas ni //
analyzed: lham mthil tsam gyi ko bas ni //
translated: But with just enough leather for the soles of my sandals,

original: sa stengs ste sa gzhi thams cad g-yogs dang 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sa stengs ste sa gzhi thams cad g-yogs dang 'dra // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: I am as if covered all over the earth.

original: gzhan gyi don la bzod pa'i bzod pa bshad nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la bzod pa'i bzod pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained patience as the benefit for others,

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate patience with respect to the nonarising of phenomena,

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
translated: it says “Likewise,” meaning “as in the case of space.”

original: phyi rol dngos po'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol dngos po'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “External things” are forms and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir sa thams cad bcings nas bdag gis phyir bzlog mi long ba de'i phyir chos la spyod pa'i bzod pas de bzhin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa thams cad bcings nas bdag gis phyir bzlog mi long ba de'i phyir chos la spyod pa'i bzod pas de bzhin te /
translated: Because I cannot turn back all the ways of the world, therefore, with the patience of a Dharma practitioner,

original: lham mthil tsam gyi ko ba bzhin du /
analyzed: lham mthil tsam gyi ko ba bzhin du /
translated: like a piece of leather

original: bdag gi sems 'di phyir bzlog bya'i //🔽gzhan rnams bzlog pa ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: bdag gi sems 'di phyir bzlog bya'i // gzhan rnams bzlog pa ci zhig dgos /
translated: I will toughen my mind.

original: bcom @30a * //
analyzed: bcom @30a * //
translated: What need is there to turn back others?

original: ldan 'das kyis sdong dum tshig pa la yang las kyi bgo skal la dmigs nas sems sdang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du nad kyi dgon pa'i nang du zhugs pas stong pa nyid la so sor dpyad pas skrag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis sdong dum tshig pa la yang las kyi bgo skal la dmigs nas sems sdang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du nad kyi dgon pa'i nang du zhugs pas stong pa nyid la so sor dpyad pas skrag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Even with regard to a burned stump, if you focus on the results of karma, do not give rise to anger,” and similarly, “Having entered the wilderness of sickness, do not be frightened by the analysis of emptiness.”

original: bzod pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus bskyed par bya ba de lta bas na /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus bskyed par bya ba de lta bas na /
translated: Since one who possesses patience should generate effort,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni sems gsal de ni brtson 'grus drag po'i gcig / ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag med na yang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni sems gsal de ni brtson 'grus drag po'i gcig / ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag med na yang /
translated: the perfection of effort is the clarity of mind.

original: gang tshangs pa yin pa ltar /
analyzed: gang tshangs pa yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as is the case with Brahma.

original: lus ngag bcas pa'i 'bras bu yang //
analyzed: lus ngag bcas pa'i 'bras bu yang //
translated: The results of body and speech

original: lus dang ngag gi spyod pa zhan pas de ltar min no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi spyod pa zhan pas de ltar min no //
translated: are not like that, because the conduct of body and speech is weak.

original: brtson 'grus kyang bsam gtan gyi phyir yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang bsam gtan gyi phyir yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And effort is for the sake of meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid bstan pa ni bzlas brjod ni nang du mi smra bar bzla ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid bstan pa ni bzlas brjod ni nang du mi smra bar bzla ba'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration itself is taught by “recitation” which is the recitation of the mind inwardly, “austerity”

original: dka' thub kun te /
analyzed: dka' thub kun te /
translated: which is the austerity of the mind, and “all austerities”

original: bzlas pa las gzhan dang gzhan pa'i bsod nams /
analyzed: bzlas pa las gzhan dang gzhan pa'i bsod nams /
translated: which are the austerities other than recitation.

original: yun ring dus su spyad byas kyang //🔽sems gzhan sems g-yengs pas byas pa ni /
analyzed: yun ring dus su spyad byas kyang // sems gzhan sems g-yengs pas byas pa ni /
translated: Even though they are practiced for a long time,🔽they are useless, because they are done with a different mind, a distracted mind,

original: dran pa dang bsam gtan med pa'i phyir dang / dman pa shes bzhin med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa dang bsam gtan med pa'i phyir dang / dman pa shes bzhin med pa'i phyir /
translated: and because they are inferior and without vigilance.

original: don med ces bsgoms pa 'bras bu can yin zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ste de nyid rig pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don med ces bsgoms pa 'bras bu can yin zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa ste de nyid rig pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Omniscient One, the Knower of Reality, has said that meditation is fruitful.

original: bsam gtan ni 'dir sems 'dod pa spyod pa yin yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing rtse gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni 'dir sems 'dod pa spyod pa yin yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing rtse gcig pa yin no //
translated: Meditation is the one-pointed mind that is not defiled, even though it is a mind that experiences the desire realm.

original: de nas kho na nyid kyi blo yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de nas kho na nyid kyi blo yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Then, the mind of reality is just like that.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni gang gis chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni gang gis chos kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said, “The perfection of wisdom itself is that by which the Dharma is known.”

original: shes rab kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa na yang skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med pa de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni mchog tu bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa na yang skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med pa de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni mchog tu bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: When the afflictions are abandoned by wisdom, there is no suffering of birth, etc. For that very reason, nirvana is the attainment of supreme bliss.

original: de dag don med kyi na 'khyam //
analyzed: de dag don med kyi na 'khyam //
translated: They wander aimlessly.

original: chos thams cad ngo po nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo po nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are by nature nirvana.🔽Thus it is said:

original: de skad du yang de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
analyzed: de skad du yang de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
translated: The Tathagata is always unborn,

original: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: And all phenomena are like the Tathagata.

original: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa yis //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa yis //
translated: Those with childish minds, who grasp at characteristics,

original: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
translated: Experience phenomena that do not exist in the world.

original: ces bya ba dang / gang 'di chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / gang 'di chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma lta bur shes /
translated: He who knows all things are like illusions,

original: sgyu ma 'ang @30b gzhan min chos rnams dag kyang gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: sgyu ma 'ang @30b gzhan min chos rnams dag kyang gzhan ma yin //
translated: Illusions are not other than things, and things are not other than illusions.

original: yod med ming dang bral ba nye bar zhi spyod pa //
analyzed: yod med ming dang bral ba nye bar zhi spyod pa //
translated: He who practices the pacification of the name-only of existence and non-existence,

original: de 'di shes rab pha rol phyin mchog la spyod yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'di shes rab pha rol phyin mchog la spyod yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi de de ltar zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can rnam pa bcu 'am /
