analyzed: gang gi de de ltar zab cing rgya che ba'i bdag nyid can rnam pa bcu 'am /
translated: The thought of awakening is of such a nature, profound and vast, with ten aspects,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bdag nyid can gyi byang chub kyi sems yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bdag nyid can gyi byang chub kyi sems yin no //
translated: or with the nature of the six perfections.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / chos ma yin pa'i 'gog pa 'dzin pa'i phyir de tsam nyid ni chos yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / chos ma yin pa'i 'gog pa 'dzin pa'i phyir de tsam nyid ni chos yin no //
translated: It is the Dharma, just that much, because it holds its own characteristic and because it holds the cessation of non-Dharma.

original: chos kyi don po mchog sems kyi gsang 'di skye bo snod ma yin pa la bstan par bya ba ma yin pa de dang de ma shes shing goms par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don po mchog sems kyi gsang 'di skye bo snod ma yin pa la bstan par bya ba ma yin pa de dang de ma shes shing goms par ma byas pa'o //
translated: The supreme essence of the Dharma, this secret of mind, should not be taught to people who are not vessels.

original: cho ga 'dis grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag don med kyi na 'khyam mo //
analyzed: cho ga 'dis grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag don med kyi na 'khyam mo //
translated: Those who say that one is not liberated by this rite wander about aimlessly.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos kyang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos kyang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t there a Dharma of the perfection of means?

original: bden te / de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bden te / de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba nyid yin no //
translated: That is true, but that is a subdivision of the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: thabs ni snying rje chen po dang dad pas bsdus pa'i de kho na nyid kyi blo'o //
analyzed: thabs ni snying rje chen po dang dad pas bsdus pa'i de kho na nyid kyi blo'o //
translated: The means is the mind of reality, which is gathered by faith and great compassion.

original: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don du gnyer ba'i smon lam yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don du gnyer ba'i smon lam yang de nyid yin no //
translated: The vow is the aspiration for one’s own and others’ goals.

original: stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtsa nas 'don pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: stobs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtsa nas 'don pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la sogs pa la thogs pa med do //
translated: The power is the removal of the roots of the opposing factors, without obstruction in the bases and non-bases.

original: ye shes ni nges par bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni nges par bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: The knowledge is the certainty of one’s own nature.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ka ba la dran pa'i thag pas sems kyi glang po dam du bcings na thams cad dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ka ba la dran pa'i thag pas sems kyi glang po dam du bcings na thams cad dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the elephant of the mind is tightly bound by the rope of mindfulness to the pillar of generosity and so on, everything becomes virtuous.

original: de phyir bdag gi sems de ni //
analyzed: de phyir bdag gi sems de ni //
translated: Therefore, my mind

original: dran pas legs par gzung shes bzhin gyis legs par bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dran pas legs par gzung shes bzhin gyis legs par bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: You should hold it well with mindfulness and protect it well with vigilance.

original: bdag gi sems bsrung brtul zhugs ma gtogs par //
analyzed: bdag gi sems bsrung brtul zhugs ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for the discipline of protecting my mind,

original: brtul zhugs mang pos ci zhig bya //🔽skye bo ngan pa'i nang na gnas pas /
analyzed: brtul zhugs mang pos ci zhig bya // skye bo ngan pa'i nang na gnas pas /
translated: what use are many other disciplines?

original: ji ltar sems bsrung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems bsrung bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should you protect your mind when you live among bad people?

original: dper na grol ba'i khrod gnas na //
analyzed: dper na grol ba'i khrod gnas na //
translated: For example, when you live in a jungle,

original: bsgrims te rma yi bag byed bzhin //
analyzed: bsgrims te rma yi bag byed bzhin //
translated: you are careful to protect your wounds.

original: skye bo ngan khrod gnas pas kyang //
analyzed: skye bo ngan khrod gnas pas kyang //
translated: In the same way, when you live among bad people,

original: sems kyi rma ni rtag tu bsrung //
analyzed: sems kyi rma ni rtag tu bsrung //
translated: you must always protect the wounds of your mind.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa bsrung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa bsrung ba yin gyi /
translated: You should protect yourself from the fear of suffering,

original: shig la sogs pa gsod pa la sogs pa las sems bsrung ba mi byed de /
analyzed: shig la sogs pa gsod pa la sogs pa las sems bsrung ba mi byed de /
translated: not from the fear of being killed by lice, and so on.

original: rang la sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir zhe na /🔽rma'i sdug bsngal chung ngu yis //
analyzed: rang la sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir zhe na / rma'i sdug bsngal chung ngu yis //
translated: You say, “I have no suffering,”🔽but you are afraid of a small wound.

original: skrag pa'ang bdag rma'i bsgrims te bag byed na /🔽ri bo @31a * //
analyzed: skrag pa'ang bdag rma'i bsgrims te bag byed na / ri bo @31a * //
translated: You protect the wound of your body,

original: bsdus 'joms bcom skrag pas //
analyzed: bsdus 'joms bcom skrag pas //
translated: but you are not afraid of the mountain🔽of the crushing hell.

original: bsdus 'joms zhes bya ba'i dmyal ba na /
analyzed: bsdus 'joms zhes bya ba'i dmyal ba na /
translated: In the hell called “Crushing,”

original: lug lta bu'i ri bo dag phyogs gnyis nas 'ongs pas shig la sogs pa sen mos bcar ba ltar de dag 'joms pas skrag pa dag / sems kyi rma lta cis mi bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni cis mi bsrung ste /
analyzed: lug lta bu'i ri bo dag phyogs gnyis nas 'ongs pas shig la sogs pa sen mos bcar ba ltar de dag 'joms pas skrag pa dag / sems kyi rma lta cis mi bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni cis mi bsrung ste /
translated: One should not fail to guard it.

original: 'on kyang bsrung ba nyid yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsrung ba nyid yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: But it is guarded.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyod pa 'di 'dras zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyod pa 'di 'dras zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “By this kind of conduct, etc. ”

original: spyod pa 'di 'dras gnas byed na //
analyzed: spyod pa 'di 'dras gnas byed na //
translated: By this kind of conduct,

original: sems bsrung pa'i bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: sems bsrung pa'i bdag nyid kyis /
translated: the one who is intent on guarding the mind,

original: skye bo ngan pa'i khrod gnas sam //🔽bud med khrod gnas kyang rung ba ;
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa'i khrod gnas sam // bud med khrod gnas kyang rung ba ;
translated: whether he lives in the midst of evil people🔽or in the midst of women,

original: / bud med kyi nang na 'dug na yang /
analyzed: / bud med kyi nang na 'dug na yang /
translated: even if he lives in the midst of women,

original: sdom brtson brtan pa ste /
analyzed: sdom brtson brtan pa ste /
translated: the one who is firm in his vows

original: bag yod pas nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag yod pas nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not be destroyed by carelessness.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: That may be so, but

original: gnas pa 'dis gnas pa na /
analyzed: gnas pa 'dis gnas pa na /
translated: when he lives by this rule,

original: bdag la bstod pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because he has no self-praise, etc.,

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang rnyed pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang rnyed pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And at some times, there will be no gain, etc.

original: bdag gi rnyed dang bkur sti dang // lus dang 'tsho ba med bla zhing //
analyzed: bdag gi rnyed dang bkur sti dang // lus dang 'tsho ba med bla zhing //
translated: Better for me to have no gain, no honor, no body, and no life,

original: med du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: med du zin kyang ngo //
translated: and even better if I have no self.

original: gang bdag gi don nyid kyis /
analyzed: gang bdag gi don nyid kyis /
translated: For the sake of my own welfare,

original: dge ba gzhan yang nyams bla yi //
analyzed: dge ba gzhan yang nyams bla yi //
translated: I would give up even the other virtues,

original: sems ni nam kyang nyams mi bya //
analyzed: sems ni nam kyang nyams mi bya //
translated: but never would I give up my mind.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnams rnam pa bcu 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnams rnam pa bcu 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The thought of awakening never fails in any of the ten aspects.

original: byang chub kyi sems nam yang zhig par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nam yang zhig par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “May the thought of awakening never fail.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sems bsrung 'dod pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: sems bsrung 'dod pa rnams la ni //
translated: To those who want to protect their minds,

original: bdag gis thal mo sbyar byas nas //
analyzed: bdag gis thal mo sbyar byas nas //
translated: I say with folded hands:🔽“Guard your mindfulness and awareness

original: dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dag / srog la bab kyang srungs shig ces //
analyzed: dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dag / srog la bab kyang srungs shig ces //
translated: even at the cost of your life!”

original: bdag ni de skad 'dom par byed //
analyzed: bdag ni de skad 'dom par byed //
translated: I speak thus.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is not forgetting the object.

original: shes bzhin ni yang dag par rab tu shes pa'i sgra'i tshig bya ba dang phyi ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni yang dag par rab tu shes pa'i sgra'i tshig bya ba dang phyi ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Vigilance is the term for the correct understanding of the words to be done and to be avoided.

original: shes bzhin ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni shes rab ste /
translated: Vigilance is wisdom.

original: gang gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad yang dag par brtags shing /
analyzed: gang gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad yang dag par brtags shing /
translated: By means of it, one examines all actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa shes nas rtag tu byed pa dang / 'bad rtsol thams cad kyis bag yod pa phul du byung bas srungs shig ces so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa shes nas rtag tu byed pa dang / 'bad rtsol thams cad kyis bag yod pa phul du byung bas srungs shig ces so //
translated: Having understood what is beneficial for oneself and others, one always acts and guards oneself with the utmost care through all one's efforts.

original: kye sems bsrung bar ni 'dod rnams la //
analyzed: kye sems bsrung bar ni 'dod rnams la //
translated: O mind, those who wish to guard you

original: zhes rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: should apply themselves with this transformation.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bsrung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bsrung zhe na /
translated: Why should one guard it?

original: 'di ltar @31b nad kyis dkrugs pa'i mi dag ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar @31b nad kyis dkrugs pa'i mi dag ni //
translated: Because, as it is said: People who are disturbed by illness

original: las rnams kun la mthu med pa //
analyzed: las rnams kun la mthu med pa //
translated: are unable to do anything.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu shes bzhin med pa'i sems ldan pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu shes bzhin med pa'i sems ldan pa'i //
translated: In the same way, people whose minds are without vigilance

original: thos dang bsam dang bsgom pa yang //
analyzed: thos dang bsam dang bsgom pa yang //
translated: cannot study, reflect, or meditate.

original: glo rdol bum pa'i chu bzhin du //
analyzed: glo rdol bum pa'i chu bzhin du //
translated: Like water in a cracked vase,

original: dran pa la ni de mi gnas //
analyzed: dran pa la ni de mi gnas //
translated: their mindfulness does not remain.

original: shes bzhin med par thos pa la sogs pa shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin med par thos pa la sogs pa shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without vigilance, one does not experience the hearing, etc. very clearly.

original: thos pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don shes bzhin ma yin nam zhe na /🔽smras pa / rang bzhin gyi thos ldan dad pa can dang ni //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don shes bzhin ma yin nam zhe na / smras pa / rang bzhin gyi thos ldan dad pa can dang ni //
translated: But is not the meaning of hearing, etc. understood with vigilance?🔽It is said:🔽Even the naturally faithful,

original: brtson pa lhur len du ma yang //
analyzed: brtson pa lhur len du ma yang //
translated: and those who are very diligent,

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: by some means, at some time,

original: shes bzhin med pa'i skyon chags pas //
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i skyon chags pas //
translated: are overcome by the fault of lack of vigilance.

original: shes bzhin med pa'i nyes pas /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i nyes pas /
translated: By the fault of lack of vigilance,

original: ltung ba'i rnyog dang bcas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ltung ba'i rnyog dang bcas par 'gyur //
translated: they become defiled by the stain of downfalls.🔽And those who have not abandoned faults by the wisdom that comes from hearing, etc., are overcome by adverse conditions. Therefore, they are thieves of lack of vigilance,

original: thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis nyes pa ma spangs pa de dag gi yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bcom pa yin pa des na de dag ni shes bzhin med pa'i chom rkun dag / dran pa nyams pa'i rjes 'brangs pas //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis nyes pa ma spangs pa de dag gi yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bcom pa yin pa des na de dag ni shes bzhin med pa'i chom rkun dag / dran pa nyams pa'i rjes 'brangs pas //
translated: following the loss of mindfulness.

original: bsod nams dag ni nyer bsags kyang //
analyzed: bsod nams dag ni nyer bsags kyang //
translated: Even though they have accumulated much merit,

original: rkun pos phrogs bzhin ngan 'gror 'gro //
analyzed: rkun pos phrogs bzhin ngan 'gror 'gro //
translated: they go to bad rebirths as if robbed by thieves.

original: dran pa nyams pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa ste /
translated: And the loss of mindfulness.

original: zhig pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i ngang tshul yod pa ni dran pa nyams pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa can te /🔽shes bzhin med pa'i chom rkun de dag gis bsod nams nye bar bsags su zin kyang /
analyzed: zhig pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i ngang tshul yod pa ni dran pa nyams pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa can te / shes bzhin med pa'i chom rkun de dag gis bsod nams nye bar bsags su zin kyang /
translated: The state of being pursued by the loss of mindfulness is the state of being pursued by the loss of mindfulness.🔽Even though one has accumulated merit,

original: phrogs nas ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrogs nas ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those thieves, the absence of vigilance, will steal it and one will go to a bad rebirth.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs chom rkun tshogs 'di ni //🔽glags skabs tshol bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs chom rkun tshogs 'di ni // glags skabs tshol bar byed pa ste //
translated: Thus, this group of thieves, the afflictions,🔽are looking for an opportunity.

original: glags te / skabs rnyed gyur nas dge 'phrog cing //🔽dran pa rmongs pas 'phrog par byed pa de //
analyzed: glags te / skabs rnyed gyur nas dge 'phrog cing // dran pa rmongs pas 'phrog par byed pa de //
translated: Having found an opportunity, they steal the virtue.

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i skabs 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i skabs 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The loss of mindfulness is the thief who steals the results of merit.

original: de bzhin du bde 'gro'i srog kyang 'phrog par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde 'gro'i srog kyang 'phrog par byed /
translated: In the same way, it steals the life of a good rebirth.

original: de bas dran pa yid sgo nas //
analyzed: de bas dran pa yid sgo nas //
translated: Therefore, mindfulness

original: gud du nam yang mi gtang ngo //🔽yid ni byang chub kyi sems yin la de nyid sgo yin te /
analyzed: gud du nam yang mi gtang ngo // yid ni byang chub kyi sems yin la de nyid sgo yin te /
translated: should never be allowed to leave the door of the mind.

original: byang chub pa'i thabs yin no//
analyzed: byang chub pa'i thabs yin no//
translated: The mind is the thought of awakening, and that itself is the door, the method of awakening.

original: de las nam yang bzlog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las nam yang bzlog par mi bya'o //
translated: One should never turn away from that.

original: yul gzhan du song na yang /
analyzed: yul gzhan du song na yang /
translated: Even when going to another place,🔽one should establish it in some way,

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis nye bar gzhag / yul gzhan las yid la byed pas bzhag la /
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis nye bar gzhag / yul gzhan las yid la byed pas bzhag la /
translated: having established it with mental attention from another place.

original: yid kyi sgo las /
analyzed: yid kyi sgo las /
translated: As it says in the Gate of Concentration:

original: ngan song gnod pa dag dran par byas te nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ngan song gnod pa dag dran par byas te nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: “One should establish it by recollecting the harm of the lower realms.”

original: ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /🔽bla ma @32a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na / bla ma @32a * //
translated: How should it be established?

original: dang ni 'grogs pa las //
analyzed: dang ni 'grogs pa las //
translated: From associating with a guru,🔽and from the teacher’s instruction,

original: mkhan pos rjes su bstan pa dang // slob ma dag la mkhan pos bslab pa las 'das pa na /
analyzed: mkhan pos rjes su bstan pa dang // slob ma dag la mkhan pos bslab pa las 'das pa na /
translated: when a disciple transgresses the training,

original: bskul zhing rjes su ston pa ni dran par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: bskul zhing rjes su ston pa ni dran par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lnga yin te /
translated: the teacher’s exhortation and instruction are the five beginning with “recollection.”

original: mkhan pos rjes su bstan pa des //
analyzed: mkhan pos rjes su bstan pa des //
translated: By that teacher’s instruction,

original: 'jigs pas skal ldan gus byed la //
analyzed: 'jigs pas skal ldan gus byed la //
translated: the fortunate one who acts respectfully

original: dran pa shin tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa shin tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will give rise to recollection.🔽Moreover, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dag / shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' dag / shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i gzigs pa ste /
translated: have the vision that is unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.🔽Those who possess that vision

original: spyan gang la mnga' ba de dag ni /
analyzed: spyan gang la mnga' ba de dag ni /
translated: are

original: kun tu thogs med gzigs par ldan //
analyzed: kun tu thogs med gzigs par ldan //
translated: He has unobstructed vision.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: He is omniscient.

original: de'i phyir de dag thams cad kyi spyan snga na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag thams cad kyi spyan snga na /
translated: Therefore, in the presence of all of them,

original: de dag gi mdun na bzhugs so zhes /
analyzed: de dag gi mdun na bzhugs so zhes /
translated: he is seated in their presence.

original: de ltar bsams nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas /
translated: Thinking in this way,🔽in their presence, one should establish mindfulness that is full of shame, respect, and fear.

original: de dag gi spyan sngar ngo tsha dang / gus pa dang 'jigs bcas dran pa rab tu gzhag / sdig pa dag las khrel yod pa dang // dad pa las gus par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi spyan sngar ngo tsha dang / gus pa dang 'jigs bcas dran pa rab tu gzhag / sdig pa dag las khrel yod pa dang // dad pa las gus par gzhag pa'o //
translated: One should establish respect through shame and faith in regard to the bad actions.

original: de la sangs rgyas dran pa yang //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dran pa yang //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha

original: yang dang yang du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: arises again and again.

original: de ltar spyan sngar gnas pa de la skad cig ma re re gzugs dang chos kyi sku la dmigs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yang rjes su 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar spyan sngar gnas pa de la skad cig ma re re gzugs dang chos kyi sku la dmigs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yang rjes su 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this way, in his presence, the recollection of the Buddha that takes the form body and the dharma body as its objects arises again and again in each moment.

original: de'i tshe yid kyi sgo 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang tshe dran pa'i yid sgo nas //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid kyi sgo 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang tshe dran pa'i yid sgo nas //
translated: Not only in the mind door, but also in the eye door,

original: bslab pa dag bsrung ba'i don du gnas gyur la /
analyzed: bslab pa dag bsrung ba'i don du gnas gyur la /
translated: when the mind door is occupied with guarding the precepts,

original: de tshe shes bzhin 'ong 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de tshe shes bzhin 'ong 'gyur zhing //
translated: Then, mindfulness and vigilance will come.

original: song ba dag kyang phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: song ba dag kyang phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And when they have come, they will not depart.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dag gis ji ltar sems bsrung bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dag gis ji ltar sems bsrung bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one guard the mind through mindfulness and vigilance?

original: re zhig dang po sbyor ba'i mjug thogs su sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i de ma thag tu 'di 'dra ba'i sems te /🔽byang chub kyi sems so so'i skye bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bad pas /
analyzed: re zhig dang po sbyor ba'i mjug thogs su sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i de ma thag tu 'di 'dra ba'i sems te / byang chub kyi sems so so'i skye bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bad pas /
translated: First of all, immediately after the conclusion of the preparatory practice, immediately after the taking of the vow, one should generate a mind like this:

original: 'di ni skyon bcas shas byas nas te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon bcas shas byas nas te /
translated: “I will strive to generate the Thought of Enlightenment, even at the cost of my life, because it is the nature of ordinary beings to be forgetful.”

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin legs par bzhag nas so //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin legs par bzhag nas so //
translated: Having done so, one should guard the mind well, having established mindfulness and vigilance.

original: glegs bam la la las ni de ni yul gzhan byas nas zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni de ni yul gzhan byas nas zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some editions of the scriptures, the line reads, “Having made it an object of another,”

original: khong du chud par sla'o //
analyzed: khong du chud par sla'o //
translated: which is easy to understand.

original: de bas na 'di ltar bsam bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar bsam bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should reflect in the following manner:

original: ltung ba'i sgo thams cad la /🔽de tshe bdag gis shing bzhin du //
analyzed: ltung ba'i sgo thams cad la / de tshe bdag gis shing bzhin du //
translated: “In all situations that might cause a downfall,🔽I will remain as steadfast as a mountain

original: zungs thub par ni gnas par bya //
analyzed: zungs thub par ni gnas par bya //
translated: and as unmoving as a wall.”

original: shing yang rlung gis g-yengs pa'i rtse mo'i cha dbang po dang bcas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: shing yang rlung gis g-yengs pa'i rtse mo'i cha dbang po dang bcas pa bzhin du /
translated: The tree is like the top of a tree shaken by the wind, together with its sense faculties.

original: sgra 'byin pa de ltar na zungs thub @32b pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgra 'byin pa de ltar na zungs thub @32b pa zhes smos te /
translated: It makes a sound. Thus, it is said to be “uncontrolled.”

original: yid kyi dbang po med pa na brjod par 'dod pa'i don med pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po med pa na brjod par 'dod pa'i don med pa yin no //
translated: If there is no mental faculty, there is no object of expression.

original: dbang po med pa'i rlung yang g-yo ba yin pa de ltar na g-yo ba med pa'i don du shing zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dbang po med pa'i rlung yang g-yo ba yin pa de ltar na g-yo ba med pa'i don du shing zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The wind without a sense faculty is moving. Thus, it is said to be “without movement,” like a tree.

original: de ltar yin na slob pa yang spyod pa yang med pa ma yin nam zhe na /🔽smras pa / don med g-yengs par blta ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar yin na slob pa yang spyod pa yang med pa ma yin nam zhe na / smras pa / don med g-yengs par blta ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then there is no learning and no practice.🔽It is said:

original: nam yang bdag gis mi bya ste //
analyzed: nam yang bdag gis mi bya ste //
translated: I will never look with a meaningless distraction.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba yin no //
translated: I will do it with a result.

original: de la yang nges par sems pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang nges par sems pa ste /
translated: And there is also certainty in that.

original: cung zad dpyod pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis rtag tu ni /
analyzed: cung zad dpyod pa'i 'bad rtsol gyis rtag tu ni /
translated: With a little effort of analysis, I will always

original: mig ni phab ste blta bar bya //
analyzed: mig ni phab ste blta bar bya //
translated: look with lowered eyes.

original: blta ba ngal bso'i ched du ni //
analyzed: blta ba ngal bso'i ched du ni //
translated: For the sake of resting from looking,

original: res 'ga' phyogs su blta bar bya //
analyzed: res 'ga' phyogs su blta bar bya //
translated: I will sometimes look in the directions.

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig mig lam snang gyur na //🔽legs 'ongs don du blta bar bya //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig mig lam snang gyur na // legs 'ongs don du blta bar bya //
translated: If one sees a person on the road,🔽one should look at him with a friendly

original: legs par 'ongs sam zhes brjod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs par 'ongs sam zhes brjod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: purpose, thinking, “Welcome! ”

original: lam la sogs zhes bya ba 'dis 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: lam la sogs zhes bya ba 'dis 'jigs pa ste /
translated: “On the road, etc.” means in a frightening place.

original: rkun po la sogs pa'o //🔽de brtag pa ni yongs su shes pa de'i phyir yang dang yang du ste /🔽skad cig skad cig phyogs bzhir blta bar bya ba ni 'gro ba'i tshe ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rkun po la sogs pa'o // de brtag pa ni yongs su shes pa de'i phyir yang dang yang du ste / skad cig skad cig phyogs bzhir blta bar bya ba ni 'gro ba'i tshe ma yin gyi /
translated: “Etc.” means a place with thieves, etc.🔽“One should look around” means that one should look again and again in the four directions, not just once.

original: 'on kyang ngal bso ba na phyogs su blta bar bya'o //🔽ngal bso kha ni phyir bltas nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngal bso ba na phyogs su blta bar bya'o // ngal bso kha ni phyir bltas nas /
translated: This is not meant for when one is walking, but when one is resting.

original: lus thams cad phyir bsgyur nas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad phyir bsgyur nas blta bar bya'o //
translated: “One should rest, looking back” means that one should look back after turning the whole body around.

original: mdun dang rgyab tu brtag byas nas /
analyzed: mdun dang rgyab tu brtag byas nas /
translated: “Having looked in front and behind” means

original: 'gro ba 'am yang na 'ong bya ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'am yang na 'ong bya ste //
translated: that one should go or come after looking in front and behind.

original: mdun brtags nas 'gro ba dang rgyab brtags nas 'ong bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdun brtags nas 'gro ba dang rgyab brtags nas 'ong bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should go after looking in front and come after looking behind.

original: de ltar phyogs 'dis gnas skabs thams cad du //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs 'dis gnas skabs thams cad du //
translated: In this way, in all situations,

original: spyod lam rnam pa bzhi dag la //
analyzed: spyod lam rnam pa bzhi dag la //
translated: One should practice the four modes of action

original: dgos pa shes nas spyad par bya /
analyzed: dgos pa shes nas spyad par bya /
translated: after knowing the purpose.

original: gnas skabs thams cad bshad na ni spros pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad bshad na ni spros pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If one explains all the circumstances, all the elaborations will arise.

original: de ltar phyi'i rnam pa'i spyod pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i rnam pa'i spyod pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the external conduct,

original: nang gi spyod pa ni /
analyzed: nang gi spyod pa ni /
translated: the internal conduct is

original: lus kyis 'di ltar gnas byas te //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus kyis 'di ltar gnas byas te // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: one should remain physically like this.

original: 'di ltar gnas par bya'o zhes shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas par bya'o zhes shing /
translated: One should remain like this.

original: de ltar byas nas mnyan pa la sogs pa bya ba bsdogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas mnyan pa la sogs pa bya ba bsdogs pas /
translated: Having done so, one should listen and so forth.

original: de nas ni skabs su lus 'di ste bya ba'i bar du ji lta bur /🔽gnas pa yin zhes blta bar bya //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs su lus 'di ste bya ba'i bar du ji lta bur / gnas pa yin zhes blta bar bya //
translated: Then, from time to time, one should look at this body,🔽up to the place of action,🔽and see how it is.

original: bltas nas bdag gis bya'o //
analyzed: bltas nas bdag gis bya'o //
translated: Having seen, one should do it.

original: bdag gis byas nas yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: bdag gis byas nas yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: Having done it, at some point

original: yang dag par sems par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par sems par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: one will not think correctly.

original: chos la sems pa'i ka chen la //
analyzed: chos la sems pa'i ka chen la //
translated: On the great pillar of Dharma

original: dge ba yang sems pa'i @33a * //
analyzed: dge ba yang sems pa'i @33a * //
translated: the virtue is also bound.

original: ka ba la bcings pa grol bar mi 'gyur ltar //
analyzed: ka ba la bcings pa grol bar mi 'gyur ltar //
translated: The pillar of thought is not liberated.

original: sems kyi glang chen smyon pa dag /'bad pa kun gyis dpyad par bya //
analyzed: sems kyi glang chen smyon pa dag /'bad pa kun gyis dpyad par bya //
translated: The wild elephant of the mind should be examined with all effort.

original: ji ltar dpyad par bya zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar dpyad par bya zhe na //
translated: How should it be examined?

original: ci nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽ci nas yang dag blangs pa'i gtso //🔽yang dag par blangs pa'i gtso bo 'di'i /
analyzed: ci nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // ci nas yang dag blangs pa'i gtso // yang dag par blangs pa'i gtso bo 'di'i /
translated: He says, “In such a way that…”

original: skad cig gcig kyang mi 'tshor bar //
analyzed: skad cig gcig kyang mi 'tshor bar //
translated: In such a way that the mind is not lost even for a moment from the foremost of all that is to be undertaken.🔽The foremost of all that is to be undertaken is

original: dge ba 'am gzhan dag la /
analyzed: dge ba 'am gzhan dag la /
translated: either virtue or the other.

original: bdag gi yid 'di gar dpyod ces //
analyzed: bdag gi yid 'di gar dpyod ces //
translated: “Where is my mind wandering?”

original: de ltar yid la so sor brtag / gal te dge ba la yin na gong nas gong du dge ba dag la yang yang dag par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yid la so sor brtag / gal te dge ba la yin na gong nas gong du dge ba dag la yang yang dag par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should examine the mind. If it is wandering in virtue, one should apply it again and again to ever higher virtues.

original: gal te gzhan la yin na mi dge ba de las bzlog cing /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la yin na mi dge ba de las bzlog cing /
translated: If it is wandering in the other, one should turn it away from that nonvirtue,

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / de nas dge ba la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / de nas dge ba la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: and then apply it to the neutral, and then to virtue.

original: go rims 'dis dge ba 'di la gzhag par bya zhing de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims 'dis dge ba 'di la gzhag par bya zhing de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should examine the mind and settle it in virtue.

original: 'jigs dang dga' ston sogs byung bas phyi'i 'jigs pa la yang 'dis 'jigs pas na 'jigs pa ste sbrul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs dang dga' ston sogs byung bas phyi'i 'jigs pa la yang 'dis 'jigs pas na 'jigs pa ste sbrul la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fear and festivals, etc. are external fears, because one is afraid of them, such as snakes, etc.

original: dga' ston ni rigs kyi me skor la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: dga' ston ni rigs kyi me skor la sogs pa'am /
translated: Festivals are the worship of the clan gods, etc.

original: gtsug lag khang du ni sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du ni sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the monastery, it is the worship of the Buddha, etc.

original: la sogs pa'i sgras ni gnyid log pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i sgras ni gnyid log pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes sleep.

original: de dag dang 'brel cing ldan par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel cing ldan par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Because one is connected with and possesses those,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: when one enters meditative concentration,

original: gal te ci bder mi nus na //
analyzed: gal te ci bder mi nus na //
translated: if one is unable to do what is comfortable,

original: 'di la 'gyod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: one should not regret it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir sbyin pa'i dus dag tu //
analyzed: gang phyir sbyin pa'i dus dag tu //
translated: Because it is said that at the time of giving,

original: tshul khrims btang snyoms gzhag par gsungs //
analyzed: tshul khrims btang snyoms gzhag par gsungs //
translated: one should be indifferent to morality.

original: zhes bya ba smos te sbyin pa ni 'dir nus pa nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te sbyin pa ni 'dir nus pa nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: Giving is a metaphor for ability here.

original: tu'i sgras ni nges par bzung ba ste /
analyzed: tu'i sgras ni nges par bzung ba ste /
translated: The word “at” definitely indicates

original: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims nyon mongs pa can nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus na tshul khrims nyon mongs pa can nyid ma yin pa /
translated: that at the time of giving, morality is not defiled.

original: bdag gir ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa las ldog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can bdag gir ma byas pa la sogs pa yang rnam pa thams cad rjes su gnang ba med pa las snying rje'i bsam pa dag pa yin zhing mngon par shes pa thob pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa las ldog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can bdag gir ma byas pa la sogs pa yang rnam pa thams cad rjes su gnang ba med pa las snying rje'i bsam pa dag pa yin zhing mngon par shes pa thob pa yin na /
translated: The opposite of not taking possession of what is not given, etc. is permitted in all aspects, except for the afflicted not taking possession of what is not given, etc.

original: 'tshe ba la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'tshe ba la sogs pa yang nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: If one is pure in the thought of compassion and has attained the superknowledges, then even violence, etc. is permitted, since it is not an affliction.

original: so so'i skye bo ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin na yang nyon mongs pa byed pa'i phyir dka' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin na yang nyon mongs pa byed pa'i phyir dka' bar byed pa'o //
translated: An ordinary person, even though not afflicted, is difficult to act like, because of the afflictions.

original: de mi nus pa ni btang snyoms su gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de mi nus pa ni btang snyoms su gzhag pa ni /
translated: One who is unable to do that should be indifferent.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: @33b sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims bsrung ba btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: @33b sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims bsrung ba btang snyoms su gzhag par bya'o zhes rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: At the time of generosity, one should be indifferent to the observance of morality. This is permitted.

original: gal te rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jigs pa dang / dga' ston la sogs pa dang 'brel ba las nus pa med pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur na /🔽'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bshags pa byas nas /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jigs pa dang / dga' ston la sogs pa dang 'brel ba las nus pa med pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur na / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i mdo las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bshags pa byas nas /
translated: If a root downfall occurs for someone who is not capable of avoiding it because of being involved with fear, a festival, and so on,🔽he should confess it according to the rite taught in the Akashagarbha

original: rgyal po la sogs pas yang sdom pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas yang sdom pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Sutra, and he should take the vow again in the presence of a king or other person like him.

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan du gzhan 'byung ba na yang /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan du gzhan 'byung ba na yang /
translated: If it occurs in another way,

original: tshul khrims kyi le'u la sogs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi le'u la sogs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bshags par bya'o //
translated: he should confess it according to the rite taught in the Silapatala and other texts.

original: ji ltar na bya ba thams cad yang dag par byas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bya ba thams cad yang dag par byas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one do everything properly?

original: gang zhig zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states:

original: gang zhig bsams te byar brtsams pa //
analyzed: gang zhig bsams te byar brtsams pa //
translated: One should think about what one is going to do.

original: de las gzhan du mi bsam ste //🔽der gtad pa yi bsam pa yis //
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi bsam ste // der gtad pa yi bsam pa yis //
translated: One should not think about anything else.🔽With a mind focused on that,

original: sems kyis de nyid re zhig bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: sems kyis de nyid re zhig bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish just that.

original: de lta na ni kun legs bya //
analyzed: de lta na ni kun legs bya //
translated: In this way, everything is done well.

original: gzhan du gnyi gar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gnyi gar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not both.🔽It is not only intention, nor is it something else.

original: bsam pa dang de las gzhan pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gnyis kar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang de las gzhan pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gnyis kar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not both.

original: shes bzhin ma yin nye nyon mongs pa dag kyang /
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin nye nyon mongs pa dag kyang /
translated: The subsidiary defilements of lack of vigilance

original: de lta na ni 'phel mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'phel mi 'gyur //
translated: do not increase in the same way.

original: 'phel ba nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phel ba nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not increase.

original: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhan pa bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be considered to be something else.

original: yang ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done?

original: bre mo'i gtam zhes bya ba smos te /🔽bre mo'i gtam ni sna tshogs dang // rgyal ba'i gtam la sogs pa dang // ngo mtshar ltad mo ste mig 'phrul sogs pa rnam pa mang pos kun la ste /
analyzed: bre mo'i gtam zhes bya ba smos te / bre mo'i gtam ni sna tshogs dang // rgyal ba'i gtam la sogs pa dang // ngo mtshar ltad mo ste mig 'phrul sogs pa rnam pa mang pos kun la ste /
translated: It is said: “idle chatter”.

original: dpung gi bkod pa dang / shi ba'i ro 'degs pa la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tshogs pa la 'jug par gyur pa na /
analyzed: dpung gi bkod pa dang / shi ba'i ro 'degs pa la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tshogs pa la 'jug par gyur pa na /
translated: Idle chatter is of many kinds: about kings, thieves, food, drink, clothing, beds, garlands, incense, relatives, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, countries, women, heroes, streets, wells, relatives, ancestors, the departed, trifles, the origin of the world, the origin of the elements, whether there is or is not another world, etc.

original: de la chags pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: When one becomes engaged in the affairs of the world, one should abandon attachment to them.

original: de bzhin du don med sa rko rtsva gcod dang // sa ris 'dri sogs byed gyur na ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du don med sa rko rtsva gcod dang // sa ris 'dri sogs byed gyur na ste //
translated: In the same way, if one digs the ground, cuts grass, draws lines, etc., for no reason,

original: dgos pa med pa byed pa na //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa byed pa na //
translated: When you do something that is pointless,

original: bde gshegs bslab pa dran byas nas //
analyzed: bde gshegs bslab pa dran byas nas //
translated: remember the training of the Well-Gone One.

original: skrag pas de'i mod la gtang bar byas so //
analyzed: skrag pas de'i mod la gtang bar byas so //
translated: Out of fear, you should immediately give it up.

original: gang tshe bskyod par 'dod gyur tam //
analyzed: gang tshe bskyod par 'dod gyur tam //
translated: Whenever you want to move

original: smra bar 'dod par gyur na yang /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod par gyur na yang /
translated: or speak,

original: de'i tshe re zhig dang por rang gi sems brtags nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe re zhig dang por rang gi sems brtags nas /
translated: first examine your mind.

original: de nas brtan pas g-yo ba dang / bskyod pa dang smra ba rigs par ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas brtan pas g-yo ba dang / bskyod pa dang smra ba rigs par ldan par bya'o //
translated: Then, with a stable mind, move and speak in a way that is appropriate.🔽When you see that your mind is distracted,

original: gang tshe rang yid la so sor rtog pa dang chags pa dang / khro ba'am rnam par sdang ba mthong ba de'i tshe las su mi bya ste /🔽skyob par mi bya zhing @34a * //
analyzed: gang tshe rang yid la so sor rtog pa dang chags pa dang / khro ba'am rnam par sdang ba mthong ba de'i tshe las su mi bya ste / skyob par mi bya zhing @34a * //
translated: or that it is attached, hostile, or hateful, do not act,

original: smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: do not speak,

original: 'on kyang btang snyoms su shing bzhin du ni gnas par bya //
analyzed: 'on kyang btang snyoms su shing bzhin du ni gnas par bya //
translated: but remain indifferent like a piece of wood.

original: de ltar na gang gi tshe dgod dang gzhar bcas pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi tshe dgod dang gzhar bcas pa'am /
translated: In this way, whenever you laugh, joke,

original: gal te nga rgyal te khengs pa dang / rgyags shing dregs pa dang ldan zhing 'byor ba ni nga rgyal rgyags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gal te nga rgyal te khengs pa dang / rgyags shing dregs pa dang ldan zhing 'byor ba ni nga rgyal rgyags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: If there is pride, haughtiness, arrogance, and conceit, then there is pride, haughtiness, arrogance, and conceit.

original: mtshang 'dru ba yi bsam pa dang ; / zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi skyon rnam par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshang 'dru ba yi bsam pa dang ; / zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi skyon rnam par brjod pa'o //
translated: The thought of finding fault is the expression of the faults of others.

original: gal te skyor 'byin slu sems dang // zhes bya ba ni g-yo sgyu'o //🔽gang gi tshe bdag la bstod pa lhur len pas na /
analyzed: gal te skyor 'byin slu sems dang // zhes bya ba ni g-yo sgyu'o // gang gi tshe bdag la bstod pa lhur len pas na /
translated: If there is flattery, deceit, and fraud, then there is flattery, deceit, and fraud.

original: bdag bstod lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: bdag bstod lhur len pa'o //
translated: When one is intent on praising oneself, then there is intent on praising oneself.

original: gzhan la smod pa nyid dang ni ste /
analyzed: gzhan la smod pa nyid dang ni ste /
translated: When one is intent on disparaging others, then there is intent on disparaging others.🔽When one is intent on reciting verses of praise to others, then there is intent on reciting verses of praise to others.🔽When one is intent on insulting others, then there is intent on insulting others.

original: gzhan la tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa rjod par byed pa nyid do //🔽gshe bcas ni gzhan dag la brnyas pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa rjod par byed pa nyid do // gshe bcas ni gzhan dag la brnyas pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: When one is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others, then there is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others.🔽When one is intent on reproaching others, then there is intent on reproaching others.🔽When one is intent on reciting verses of praise to others, then there is intent on reciting verses of praise to others.

original: 'gyod dang bcas gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod dang bcas gyur pa ste /
translated: When one is intent on insulting others, then there is intent on insulting others.🔽When one is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others, then there is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others.🔽When one is intent on reproaching others, then there is intent on reproaching others.🔽When one is intent on reciting verses of praise to others, then there is intent on reciting verses of praise to others.

original: khro bas 'khrugs par 'gyur ba dang bcas na'o //🔽de'i phyir shing bzhin gnas par bya'o //🔽'di ltar yang bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: khro bas 'khrugs par 'gyur ba dang bcas na'o // de'i phyir shing bzhin gnas par bya'o // 'di ltar yang bsam par bya ste /
translated: When one is intent on insulting others, then there is intent on insulting others.🔽When one is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others, then there is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others.🔽When one is intent on reproaching others, then there is intent on reproaching others.🔽When one is intent on reciting verses of praise to others, then there is intent on reciting verses of praise to others.

original: rnyed dang bkur sti grags 'dod pa'am //
analyzed: rnyed dang bkur sti grags 'dod pa'am //
translated: When one is intent on insulting others, then there is intent on insulting others.🔽When one is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others, then there is intent on reciting non-metrical verses to others.

original: g-yog 'khor don du gnyer ba'am //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor don du gnyer ba'am //
translated: Or if one’s mind is bent on service,

original: bdag sems rim gro 'dod gyur na //
analyzed: bdag sems rim gro 'dod gyur na //
translated: Or if one wishes to acquire a following,

original: de tshe shing bzhin gnas par bya //
analyzed: de tshe shing bzhin gnas par bya //
translated: Then one should remain like a piece of wood.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don yal bar 'dor zhing spong ba ni gzhan don yal bar 'dor ba'o //🔽rang don gnyer bar 'dod pa dag / yang ni 'khor ni 'dod 'gyur ba 'am slob pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don yal bar 'dor zhing spong ba ni gzhan don yal bar 'dor ba'o // rang don gnyer bar 'dod pa dag / yang ni 'khor ni 'dod 'gyur ba 'am slob pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba'am /
translated: Similarly, one should not abandon the welfare of others, nor should one be indifferent to it.

original: smra bar 'dod pa'i sems byung na //
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa'i sems byung na //
translated: If one wishes to acquire one’s own welfare, or if one’s mind is bent on service, or if one wishes to acquire a following, or if one wishes to acquire disciples, or if one wishes to speak,

original: de ltar gyur bas bdag gi sems g-yo zhing smra bar byed par 'dod pa des ni shing bzhin gnas par bya /
analyzed: de ltar gyur bas bdag gi sems g-yo zhing smra bar byed par 'dod pa des ni shing bzhin gnas par bya /
translated: then one should remain like a piece of wood.

original: de bzhin du bzod par mi nus pa'i ngang tshul ni mi bzod le lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod par mi nus pa'i ngang tshul ni mi bzod le lo'o //
translated: In the same way, one should not be impatient, nor should one be lazy.

original: 'jigs pa ni dang nga ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni dang nga ba'o //
translated: One should not be fearful, nor should one be timid.

original: de bzhin spyi brtol ni phod pa can no //
analyzed: de bzhin spyi brtol ni phod pa can no //
translated: One should not be overbearing, nor should one be arrogant.

original: mu cor ni tshig 'khyal  pa'o //
analyzed: mu cor ni tshig 'khyal  pa'o //
translated: One should not be a chatterer, nor should one be a gossip.

original: de bzhin du rang gi phyogs zhen sems byung na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi phyogs zhen sems byung na /
translated: In the same way, if one’s mind is bent on attachment to one’s own group,

original: des ni shing bzhin gnas par bya //
analyzed: des ni shing bzhin gnas par bya //
translated: then one should remain like a piece of wood.

original: ji ltar chags pa nas rang gi phyogs la mngon par zhen pa'i bar de ltar 'chab pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhan dag kyang brtags nas sam /
analyzed: ji ltar chags pa nas rang gi phyogs la mngon par zhen pa'i bar de ltar 'chab pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhan dag kyang brtags nas sam /
translated: Just as it is with attachment, so it is with the other addictions, such as concealment, etc.

original: don med brtson pa'i yid brtags nas te /
analyzed: don med brtson pa'i yid brtags nas te /
translated: One should examine the mind that is devoted to useless activities.

original: sa rko ba la sogs byung na yid lung du ma bstan pa bltas shing brtags nas so //
analyzed: sa rko ba la sogs byung na yid lung du ma bstan pa bltas shing brtags nas so //
translated: If one is engaged in digging the earth, etc., one should examine the mind that is inoperative.

original: de tshe dpa' bos gnyen po yis //
analyzed: de tshe dpa' bos gnyen po yis //
translated: Then the hero, with the antidote,

original: bag yod par gyur pas shes bzhin gyi yid de brtan par bya gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bag yod par gyur pas shes bzhin gyi yid de brtan par bya gzung bar bya'o //
translated: should make the mind of vigilance firm and stable by means of heedfulness.

original: nges par gzung bas brtan pa rigs pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: nges par gzung bas brtan pa rigs pa dang ldan pas /
translated: By means of the firmness of retention, which is endowed with reason,

original: lus kyi g-yo 'gul dang smra ba la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi g-yo 'gul dang smra ba la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: one should engage in the activities of body and speech.

original: @34b sdom pa dang dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du mdzad nas de ltar sems sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: @34b sdom pa dang dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du mdzad nas de ltar sems sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the way to train the mind in the morality of vow and of amassing virtue.

original: sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims la ci 'dra ba gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims la ci 'dra ba gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one hold the morality of working for the benefit of all living beings?

original: shin tu nges dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shin tu nges dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He states “with great certainty, etc.”

original: shin tu nges par ni brtan por dam bcas pas so //
analyzed: shin tu nges par ni brtan por dam bcas pas so //
translated: With great certainty means with firm commitment.

original: rab tu dang ba ni shes rab dang bag yod can dang / yon tan dag la dad pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba ni shes rab dang bag yod can dang / yon tan dag la dad pa'o //
translated: With clear faith means with wisdom, heedfulness, and confidence in good qualities.

original: bstan pa ni dka' ba la sngar ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni dka' ba la sngar ba med pa'o //
translated: With teaching means without previous difficulty.

original: zab cing rgya che ba mos pas dkon mchog gsum dang / bla ma rnams dang chos 'dzin pa la gus pa ste /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba mos pas dkon mchog gsum dang / bla ma rnams dang chos 'dzin pa la gus pa ste /
translated: With devotion to the profound and the magnificent, with devotion to the Three Jewels, to the gurus, and to the Dharma holders.

original: bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes ni gzhon rabs dag la yang bla ma nyid du 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed pa zhes ni gzhon rabs dag la yang bla ma nyid du 'du shes pa'o //
translated: With service means with the perception of gurus even in young people.

original: de dag dang bcas par 'jug pas na gus dang zhe sar bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bcas par 'jug pas na gus dang zhe sar bcas pa'o //
translated: With respect and deference means with respect and deference to those who possess those qualities.

original: rang dang gzhan la ltos nas nyes pas ngo tsha ba ni ngo tsha ba ste de dang bcas pa ni ngo tsha dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la ltos nas nyes pas ngo tsha ba ni ngo tsha ba ste de dang bcas pa ni ngo tsha dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With conscience means with conscience, ashamed of faults in relation to oneself and others.

original: nyes pa dag las 'jigs pas 'jigs pa ste /🔽de dang bcas pa ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dag las 'jigs pas 'jigs pa ste / de dang bcas pa ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With dread means with dread of faults.

original: rgod pa'i rkyen yod na yang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa'i rkyen yod na yang zhi ba'o //
translated: With calm means with calm even when conditions for excitement are present.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis gzhan dga' bar byed pa la brtson /🔽phan tshun mi mthun byis pa yis //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis gzhan dga' bar byed pa la brtson / phan tshun mi mthun byis pa yis //
translated: He strives to please others by means of the four social practices, such as generosity and so on.🔽He is not discouraged by the mutual discords of childish beings.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyis mi skyo zhing bzod pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyis mi skyo zhing bzod pas so //
translated: He is patient with them.

original: byis pa sdug bsngal mi 'dod cing //
analyzed: byis pa sdug bsngal mi 'dod cing //
translated: Childish beings do not want suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhan la 'tshe ba yang 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhan la 'tshe ba yang 'dod par byed do //
translated: and they also want to harm others, which is the cause of suffering.

original: nyon mongs skyes pas 'di dag gi //
analyzed: nyon mongs skyes pas 'di dag gi //
translated: When the afflictions arise in them,

original: sems 'di byung snyam brtser ldan dang / kha na ma tho med dngos la //
analyzed: sems 'di byung snyam brtser ldan dang / kha na ma tho med dngos la //
translated: he thinks, “This is because of their minds,” and with compassion,🔽he always controls himself and sentient beings,

original: bdag dang sems can dbang byas shing rtag tu dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dbang byas shing rtag tu dbang du bya'o //
translated: and he always controls his mind,

original: sprul pa bzhin du nga med par //🔽yid 'di rtag tu gzung bar bya //
